"Ok, I'm a BBQ fan. St. Louis, Chicago, Philly, Memphis, Texas I love em all. I have often dragged my wife on BBQ treks for hundreds of miles. With that being said I have to begin by saying that Bobby Q has EXCELLENT BBQ. Tender, smoky and chock full o' flavor. I have been here multiple times and have never had anything that disappointed me...until last night. An event so treacherous and diabolical that it prevented me from rating them with 5 stars. The horror!

The in-laws were in from the East Coast and we decided to take them there for dinner. Everything was smashing and up to par as usual until dessert came. Now I have to go on record as saying that I always loved the heaping pile of scrumptious peach cobbler that they serve on the dessert menu. So much so that I convinced my table of 6 to order 3 since they are usually large enough to share and stunningly delicious. Every time I go to Bobby Q I finish off my meal with it and love to complain to my wife as I waddle out of the building (in the grand tradition of glutinous American excess) that I ate too much and my belly hurt. I was looking forward to lamenting my fate yet again last night. But alas, I was in for a shocking turn of events and was dubbed a deceitful liar by the entire table. 

To my horror when the cobblers arrived, they were measly, sickly, ill-prepared portions and a pale shadow of what they were on previous visits. We were plagued with three bowls of undercooked (as in practically raw) peaches that tasted like they were straight from a can and a soggy, undercooked thin square of ""crust"" sitting on top as an afterthought.  This flavorless absurdity could only have been more demeaning if it were capable of speech and threw dated insults at us. It literally looked like they dumped half a can of uncooked peach slices in a bowl and threw a wet piece of thin white bread on top. All three servings were like this. Now on EVERY occasion in the past the cobbler was gigantic, actually was cooked and warm, had a delectable FULL crust and tasted like it came out of Gramma' Cobbler's oven fresh. To this peach cobbler bizarro universe doppelganger I spit at thee and thine preparer. Bah I say. BAH.

Of course, we complained to the waitress who was nice but said she didn't know that it was any different from normal.  She went back to whoever prepared them and came back saying that the preparer said ""they're the same as they always were"" which either proved the preparer's incompetence or their willingness to shame the establishment with a bowl full of cobbler-like lies. Our waitress even said she talked to the manager who went back to speak with the preparer...but said manager never came out to either see the imposter cobblers or speak with us about it, which rates as quite poor customer service.  Overall, it left a dark mark on an otherwise belly -bustingly deeeelicious visit. Shame on you Robert Q, shame. 

So, I will still eat at Bobby Q. as their dinner fare IS fantastic (assuming there are no more obvious but blatently denied changes such as with the cobbler), the environment is cozy and the staff are (generally) quite pleasant. However,  I will be wary about ordering the dessert in the future and about the quality and integrity of their customer service skills. I would advise you to use the same caution."
"Another awesome find on Yelp!  The food is amazing. Hard to decide what to eat it all looked so delicious. My wife and I ended up getting the bbq chicken and ribs and sharing. 

The crispy onion rings had a nice chipotle kick to them. To top it off they give you cinnamon sugar donuts complimentary. 

Great atmosphere. Friendly wait staff. Ate outside on the covered patio. Which is great in February when you are from Chicago."
"No need to go into full details but let's say I had the mutha f&$&in best FOOD COMA lol.  The service is incredible and the food again... Just keep in mind FOOD..... COMA.  

Oh yeah a very very good recommendation is to get RESERVATIONS before you go.  You feel like VIP when everyone just waits outside hoping to get a seat.


Thank you BOBBY Q's"
"My hubby & I aren't the biggest BBQ fans but Bobby Q is definitely a fav of ours! I have been here a few times for lunch with my dad & the engineering company I used to work for would always order it in for lunch meetings. Last night I wasn't in the mood to cook dinner so I called in a to go order & used my $50 gc I got for my bday, thx bro!

I ordered the following for the Mr. & I: q-rolls (app), smokehouse burger (no bbq sauce-add mustard) with shoestring fries, half rack of back baby ribs with mac & cheese & potato salad & for dessert their homemade mud pie. Oh & it also came with 4 pieces of cornbread & I bought a bottle of their BBQ sauce. 

The q-rolls were so freakin good, the chipotle dip that comes with is delish! My hubs said his burger was just ok but loved the fries. My ribs were fall off the bone tender & the mac & cheese was yummy. I didn't have room for the potato salad, but I've had it before & it's always good. I have to say their cornbread is so amazing, possibly the best I've ever had! The mud pie was just ok, the cookie crust had a weird taste & they used vanilla & chocolate ice cream, I prefer it with mocha. My hubby however, thought it was very good. 

We'll definitely be back whenever we have a craving for some delicious BBQ!"
Food was wonderful. Had Bob's salad. Hubby had brisket. Mac and Cheese is the bomb. Server Meghan was awesome. Very attentive and explained everything. Will be coming back for sure!!!!
"Really liked this place.great atmosphere and fantastic service. I had the trio of baby back ribs, brisket and pulled pork. Topped it off with a side of Mac n cheese and pecan Cole slaw. Some of the best I've ever had."
"Top-notch, enthusiastic waiter who understands customer service; outstanding food!  An expansive menu with big satisfying portions!  Very clean and organized restaurant, which tells me management takes pride in this establishment.  My only negative comment:  the young girl taking us to our table was quite rude.  If the hostess/greeter was welcoming and friendly I would rate 5-stars on a first visit.  For those residing in the East Valley, it is worth the trip!"
"This second time here. Last time we had the combo BBQ platter, which was good. This time we shared the 14 oz ribeye. It came with 2 sides and cornbread. We chose baked potato and pecan cole slaw. Steak was cooked perfectly, and seasoned well. Both sides were very good.
Our server was Bre. It was her first day, and she did an excellent job!
They give you warm mini donuts as you leave, which was a nice treat.
We will definitely be back."
"Awesome BBQ goodness!

Bobby Q's is right off I17 and was easy to find for us out-of-towners. The parking lot is huge and when we went it was really quiet.

The interior has a bit more of an upscale vibe to it, not like an old traditional bbq place. The service was good and they give you mini-doughnuts at the end.

We ordered the whole hog platter to share amongst the two of us and it was definitely enough food. I don't think it'd be enough food for three hungry people, but definitely two. We had the brisket, pulled pork, beef ribs and st louis ribs.

The mac & cheese was delicious. It was creamy, cheesy and amazing. Definitely worth getting. The garlic mash potatoes were also very good, but not as mouth watering as the mac & cheese. If I had to do it again I would just have the three sides as mac & cheese, it was that good.

All of the meat was tender - the meat feel right off the bone of the ribs and we could cut the brisket with our forks. It was delicious with the smoked flavour and sauce they put on. Unlike other places they do put some sauce on it, which is how I prefer it. It's not overpowering and drenched in sauce to prevent you from tasting the actual flavour of the meat though.

Price wise it was a little higher than other restaurants (Seems to be $18-25 per person) we had been to, however the quality of the food is well worth it. Unfortunately we were too full to try the dessert, but that's OK because there's nothing wrong with filling up with meaty goodness."
"Definitely liked this place. After my cousin convinced me to come here (because I'm not a huge fan of BBQ) I was pleased. I ordered the country fried chicken. It comes with mash potatoes and choice of one side (I chose Mac&Cheese....I know two starches). The cornbread is complimentary, super hot and yummy. My friend ordered the baby back ribs with Mac and baked potatoes (2 starches again). I tried some of her ribs and they were really good, falling off the bone good. I definitely would come back when I visit Arizona. I would love to try the pulled pork or the beef brisket. At the end of your meal they give you a bag of complimentary donuts that resembles the taste of churros. 

My waiter was really nice and very attentive to us as we told him it was our first time dining at the establishment. The manager even walked over to us to make sure everything was fine. The staff appeared to be really nice and courteous."
Bobby Q never disappoints.  They serve the best chocolate martinis and I have  one or two every visit.  I usually order steak or BBQ combo. Tonight I tried the fried chicken with mashed potatoes/gravy.  Another winner.

I would definitely return. I would also say Texas BBQ is the best. Service was excellent."

"I have absolutely no idea how this place has so many great reviews. We were in the mood for bbq one recent Saturday night and the place we wanted to try only stayed open until 7, so we found this place on yelp and decided with so many great reviews, we should give it a try. 

Let's just say the cornbread was the highlight of the meal and I've had better cornbread. We ordered the Three Meat Combo and chose the St. Louis Style Ribs (they were out of the Baby Back Ribs), the brisket and the pulled pork. For our sides, we got the mac & cheese and the ranch style beans. The beans were good and the ribs were just ok. The mac & cheese was definitely not up to par. The brisket had so much fat on it, it wasn't even edible and I had to drown the pulled pork in bbq sauce to eat it.

Minutes after we were given our food, they asked if we wanted boxes, and then came back a few minutes later and did the same thing. Not good service. Also - I was excited about the free mini donuts they give you to go. But - they're so bad, they're not even worth eating.

Pretty sure we won't be coming back here."

"I went to this place with some friends, and with an open mind. The service was great! Unfortunately, the food was so-so. "Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: parking lot. 2 minute wait with reservation. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: very nice waitress. Very clean for a BBQ place. This place looks cool. Feels like a secret shack but its clean and decorated very well. Seats wee comfortable. The manager even came out to say hello and if we needed any thing. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: BEST BBQ I have ever had! Everything was soft, smooth, and melt in your mouth! The brisket is a MUST TRY! And make sure you get a burnt end!!! I've never had a better bite of brisket than that burnt end. Even after I ate the burnt end my mouth was watering for more. The mac & cheese was extremely creamy and delicious. The mash potatoes were also extremely creamy and delicious. It's very rare that I like mash potatoes without gravy but this was amazing! There wasn't even bacon bits on the mash potatoes and it was still delicious! Pulled pork was so soft it almost had the consistency of the mash potatoes. Ribs fell off the bones and were delicious. Fried chicken fillet was very crispy and juicy and was covered is delicious gravy. The only thing that wasn't for me was the BBQ chicken. The Sunday family feast could feed more like 2 normal people. The free mini doughnuts at the end were hot, fresh, and delicious as they fall apart between your fingers as you pick up the super fresh sucker that was fried probably 10 seconds before it got to you. Simply put, food here is amazing and was worth the $40 taxi ride there from the JW Marriott Dessert Ridge and the $40 taxi ride back. 

_____

Overall Experience
5/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
BEST BBQ I'VE EVER HAD!"
"We enjoy out BBQ and have eaten the ""Q"" all over. In addition I have my own smoker and have taken classes from some fine pit men and competition winners from KC and Memphis. I really enjoy the meat here but was very disappointed when we ordered a selection of pork ribs, brisket and beef ribs for a trip to Utah. We wanted some good food while hiking the parks. Everything was great except the beef ribs. We got 6 ribs with NO MEAT. I mean literally NO MEAT just smoked bones. If you ever had smoked beef ribs you know that there is a solid 3/4 to 1 inch thick strip of meat on the top side of the rib. The ones from here were stripped to the bone with only a little meat on the side. They ended up being expensive dog treats. everything else was great. DO NOT WASTE MONEY ON BEEF RIBS.  Always great service and drinks."

"My family and I decided to visit last night.  This was my third time and their first.  What can I say that has not already been said in previous reviews.  We knew to arrive early on a Saturday (4pm) with reservations for 4:15.  It was just starting to become busy with about 50% tables filled.  Our server was AJ.  Very knowledgeable and attentive.  Made excellent recommendations. We started with those little Q-rolls.  A meal could be made of those alone but we restrained ourselves.  Egg roll type dough wrapped around BBQ beef with Chipotle and bbq dipping sauces.  Yum.  
    My family had beers.  Not a beer drinker myself but they have a good selection.  I had the frozen lemonade which was excellent.  Only change I would make would be to leave the sugar off the glass rim because it falls off and makes everything sticky.  Not enough paper napkins at the table to dip into the water glass to try to clean up the sugar mess.
   Main meals were outstanding.  Between the 3 of us we had sausage, brisket, fried catfish, and 3 orders of baby back ribs.  All were fall off the bone, tender and flavorful.  The catfish was a crispy breaded boneless fillet, perfect size. Extra BBQ sauce was brought to the table by AJ.  Spicy and mild.  Combining the 2 brought on an extra depth of flavor.
   Our sides were cole slaw, mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, ranch beans.  All were excellent, especially the mac and cheese which had a nice little kick to it.  At this point we decided if we didn't stop, we would need help getting out of the restaurant.  But we could not leave without those little bits of heaven, hot donuts.  Fresh off the donut machine they are a perfect ending to the meal.  Did I mention leftovers?  We took enough home for all of us to have 2 more meals each.
      Staff is very attentive.  Managers visit each patrons table to meet and greet.  Staff very friendly and upbeat.  Seem to genuinely enjoy working there.  100 best restaurant award well deserved.  Congratulations."
"I wish I caught his name but there's a super friendly gray haired waiter working the night of 3.6.16 @ 8ish. He was so knowledgeable & friendly. 
We split an 8 oz steak & 1/2 rack of ribs. Came with loaded baked & mac n cheese & grilled veggies. Ribs were so good and sauce was perfect. Steak was a tad red but still enjoyed it.

"BOBBY Q's - I never knew how much I loved BBQ until I ate here. Now I will crave it.

Ended up here for a friend's birthday. The restaurant is big and airy and laid out well. They can pack them in but not like sardines. The tables are nicely spaced out and for such a big place, it has charm and is comfortable. The hostess desk rocks - friendly and efficient. We had a reservation for 7pm on a Wednesday, in the summer. I can only imagine how busy it gets on a weekend in prime season...so plan ahead and make a reservation. And GPS how to get there, if you've never been or are new to the valley. Running on the frontage road near I-17, it's easy to end up on a wrong street. Then again, once you've been here once, you'll never forget how to get back. Follow your gut instincts...

 The prime rib looked so delicious that I had to order it (great prime rib is harder to find than you'd think). But everything I tasted was out of this world:

House Salad (I love this kind of classic salad! For a perfect dressing - combine the dijon and herb vinaigrettes)

Corn bread (ask for honey with the butter)
Prime Rib (medium rare, naturally)
Brisket
Mac and Cheese
BBQ pulled chicken (I have never liked BBQ chicken before eating Bobby Q's - DELISH!)

It was a taste bud bonanza.

**They were out of the Mississippi mud pie (which I am such a fan that not getting to sample theirs could plummet a rating but everything was too good for anything other than 5 stars). So we sampled the cobbler - yum.

The service was friendly, cheerful, competent and pretty much perfect. 
**I will mention that as a group of adults, our meal came a little quicker than was ideal. But Bobby Q's is popular for a reason and the service is so competent that knowing that, I will just order a little slower/staggered, when I return with adult friends. 

Families with kids - you will not have any problem feeding your kids in a timely manner. I imagine the service is perfectly paced for families.

And as if all that isn't wonderful enough, they give you a bag of the best cinnamon dusted mini donuts to take with you!!!  They are as good of donuts as Cafe du Monde serves beignets. Only problem, I couldn't eat another bite.

So diners - here's my final tip - store the bag of donuts in your fridge, overnight and then reheat in the microwave (still in the paper bag) for 30 seconds. Have with your morning coffee. You're welcome.

Bobby Q does everything so well that I can not wait to go back. I'll starve myself for a day or two, before I do. Go hungry. It's amazing."
"Once again this was a hit! So delicious  .. This was my husbands first time because he wasn't able to go last time and he was speechless (in a good way) We had Kristen or Kristin and she was amazing too! Thank you guys for great service and great food

"The ambiance.....i cant say enough about the fantastic feel this place has. It has a rustic look with upscale charm. I sat on the patio and was nervous the noise of the expressway would annoy me. That exact opposite happened. The fountain with the trickling water and the ebb and flow of cars combined to make me feel peaceful and relaxed. The place is incredibly clean as well. 

For the meal itself I ordered Q-rolls to start. These were like beef brisket meeting an egg roll.  It was served with a chipotle sauce and bbq sauce. It was easy to eat and very tasty. The crispy dough outer shell complimented the flavor in the beef. 

For dinner i ordered the 2 choice option. Beef brisket, of course, and the baby back ribs because sever said they'd be one of the best i would ever had.   To be honest, i have had better beef brisket in Tennessee. By all means it was excellent but a tad dry compared to some of the juicy fatty brisket from those hillybilly towns off the  main roads. The server did not lie about the baby back ribs. My grandmother's ribs compete with these and that says a lot to the quality and taste. WOW!!!!!!  Wonderful!!!!!  I also ordered the ranch baked beans. Very flavorful. It has beef and pork in them. Some of the meat was stringy so texture was odd but flavor is great. 

As for the service.....OUTSTANDING!!!!!  Hunter was my server and his knowledge of the menu and ability to give tips enhanced my experience. He was friendly and had just the right amount of chattiness. The manager, Cameron, was also extremely attentive. I felt like i was in the fine dining section of a cruise ship. They both teamed up to make sure everything was perfect throughout the night. 

I look forward to returning here to try more of their fabulous menu items!!!!

Ps. They due brew their own beer. Tastes like a shiner bock with less after taste."
"Went there to celebrate my sisters birthday, everything was great. The service was fast we sat outside with the heaters so we didn't freeze too bad seeing as it's December. Can't really complain much about anything to be honest it was fun with the two dance floors one side is hip hop the other is latin music!"
"Amazing ribs the best I have ever had!  Delicious, great sauce. And I had a watermelon drink which was also delicious. Certainly a place to visit in Phoenix."
"We just started eating here last week. I guess it used to be a Bobby McGees before and these guys bought them out. Anyway, we had just picked up a friend from the airport and were on our way home. He asked if there were any good bbq places here. Since we didn't know of any, we looked on yelp. 
We got here very late, so they were about to close the kitchen. However, the lounge/club was about to open. They told us that it would be loud, once the club opened up. We didn't mind it and decided to stay. 
We all ordered food and drinks. I ordered the full plate of bbq brisket, coleslaw and mashed potatoes. We also ordered some appetizers. Everything was great. I loved the corn bread so much that I asked for more. The Sangria was good too. 
Everything is priced right and the portions are fair. Try it out; it's worth it. 
By the way, we stayed at restaurant after the club opened. Let's just say it wasn't like the food. I would never come here for the lounge/club--food only.
We're taking our friend back to the airport tonight, and we are going to have dinner here again. I hope to have a good experience again."

Still the manager showed up moments later to apologize for the oversight and offer us a free dessert.  I love those extra customer service touches. "Service: We definitely had great service. Prompt attention from our server Phil and the manager stopped by.

Food and drink: Full bar; mediocre strawberry daiquiri & good virgin strawberry lemonade. The corn had great flavor along with the corn bread patties. Grilled chicken and ribs had decent flavor, a little smokey, very little char. .. The ribs were very tender but the chicken was a tad dry. Great smoked sausage and shoestring fries. The bbq sauce was tasty, not overly sweet and not to runny. Cinnamon donuts are a nice touch at the end of the meal.

Overall I would give it 3.5. It wasn't bad,  it just wasn't outstanding."

"A Crowd favorite! I have been coming to Bobby Q's since I moved back to the valley in 2006. This place is great if you want BBQ. From their BBQ egg rolls to their brisket, and little donuts for desert.. Where to start!? My wife and I generally get a 3 meat combo because you get a lot of variety. Their sauce is great they have a nice kick and I like that they do it right and not slather it on for you. Over the holidays this past year we had placed a reservation and we were accommodated easily. 16 people, not a single mistake, billing was done perfectly, and everyone was attentively taken care of during the meal. It so rarely happens with large groups we were impressed with the service. The prices are really reasonable compared to a few places that are a significantly closer for us, When people come to town, hungry - I send them your way. Keep up the great BBQ we'll be back soon!"

"I was out here for work with my coworker working offsite. A couple of facebook friends recommended this place to eat. The bbq here was sooo good we came here twice. I did the 3 meat combo beef ribs, st louis, and brisket with sides of mac and cheese and roasted corn. The sauce on the meat was perfect not too sweet and not too overwhelming, they do give you a jar for added sauce and a option to add their spicy sauce (highly recommend). The meat falls right off the bone and melts in your mouth like ice cream. The mac and cheese was so good it had melty cheesy hearty goodness to it. And the roasted corn was ok, due to im a corn on the cob type of guy. The concept of the restaurant may look deceiving, but once you walk in is like walking into a 4 star restaurant. It gave the presence of comfort with immaculate service. Even the manager that was working both Wednesday and Thursday even recognize us and gave us that welcoming feeling. Definitely a place to come back to when visiting Phoenix. Thank you Bobby Q staff for an awesome service and great food. 5 stars all around."

"Brother and I decided to take our dad out for his birthday yesterday. We chose Bobby Q's for it's great reviews, also because they served beef ribs (dad's request). I called two days in advanced to make reservations for 6:30 pm. We arrived about 6:10ish pm and checked in. When 6:30 came around, we were told that the table was being set up. Returned back to the front at 6:45 pm and was told that a large party was finishing up. When we finally got seated about 6:50ish pm, the server took our drink orders right away and asked if we wanted to order any appetizers. One of the tables that they sat us at was not even with the other tables. The restaurant was extremely warm inside, it took a good 30 min or so for us to finally cool down. Throughout the dinner, we felt extremely rushed by the server to get us in and out. She was not personable at all and was training someone on top of that. Our family was still eating our food and the server asked us if we wanted boxes for the food. When I called to make the reservation, I was told that our party of 8 had a two hour limit. We were in and out of the restaurant within a little over an hour. The food was ok, nothing too special about it. I would not recommend this place for large groups, unless you want to feel rushed to eat your meal and get subpar food."

"The food!! It was delicious. The service and atmosphere could have been awful and I still would have given a good review on the basis of the food alone. There is complimentary cornbread to start, which just melts in your mouth. Our food came out very quick and every single thing was just to die for. "Darn good BBQ. Not nearly as good as Bryan's Black Mountain BBQ in Cave Creek, or Little Miss, but solid for Phoenix."
"We had lunch at this place on our recent trip to Phoenix.  We came in between lunch and dinner and were seated promptly.  My husband and I ordered a full baby back with grilled veggies and shoestring fries on the side to split.  My son ordered the chicken tenders with shoestring fries on the side.  The food was amazing.  Our ribs were very tender and fell off the bone.  The sauce was not overly sweet which was also a plus.  The veggies were grilled well and not too overly cooked.  The shoestring fries had enough crunch and saltiness.  My son I'm sure enjoyed his food because he ate the leftover chicken tenders for dinner, and he doesn't normally eat leftovers.  Our drinks were never empty.  The server was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed - extra sauce, drinks, etc...  The bathrooms were clean which is always a plus.  The only thing is that I wished they had sweet potato fries on the menu too.  Their fries were good, but love sweet potato fries with my ribs.  Great food, great service, ample parking, clean bathrooms.  Definitely will return."
"Review for first time going to Bobby Qs - lunch on a Sunday. Ordered the pulled pork with a side of mac. Food was very tastey. The mac and cheese was made in house. It's all about the cheese sauce and there's was very rich without being greasey. The pulled pork was tender and not drown in sauce. I thought the serving would be a little larger a serving. The mac did not fill the bowl and the bun (not a roll) the pulled pork was served on was about the size of a McDonalds cheeseburger roll. It was piled pretty high, but it was 20% smaller than I pictured for the price. I ordered two brews service ice cold in a frosted glass. Service was quick and very good. I would go back again to try the platter. Just be really hungry or bring a bunch of friends because the people next to me ordered it, and it's a huge plate."

"We couldn't make it to Little Miss BBQ, so we went to the next best rated BBQ join in town: Bobby Q (ha ha - Arizonian and their puns). 

Among 5 girls, we ordered a family meal and an additional rack of ribs.
-Cornbread: buttery and delicious, but save your appetite!
-Meat: enjoyed the baby back ribs over the st. louis; for both types of ribs, the meat falls off the bone; didn't enjoy the pulled pork or beef brisket 
-Sides: recommend the cole slaw and mac & cheese; potato salad is decent. 
-BBQ sauce: enjoyed the spicy BBQ sauce and used lots of it; regular sauce is too sweet.
-Complimentary donuts: just fried dough - nice gesture, but we passed on it. 

Bobby Q was super affordable for a hearty, calorie-heavy meal. Good service, ample seating and delicious BBQ."
"Excellent bbq, tried the ""smoasted"" (smoke-roasted) chicken and the brisket, both excellent. Sauces good but not needed with the amount of flavor meat had. Sides excellent-roasted corn especially, table cornbread and donuts delicious as well."
"Duuude! The hamburger here is one of the best in the Valley. I forgot which Yelper recommended it to me, but he was right. Just very good, high-quality ingredients -- and the right amount of them. Soft, flavorful bun. Fresh, hand-formed, patties. Mmmm!

Oh yeah, the BBQ here is good too. Their sauce is great; and they serve it in heated containers so it doesn't get your food cold. Try the BBQ Chicken sandwich -- with fries or coleslaw because both are top notch.

Lastly, if you check in with your phone, you'll see a 10% discount to Yelpers if you mention it."

"I have had 3 experiences with Bobby Q's.  I have eaten there once, and picked up their food twice.

Driving past their location on the freeway it looks like an interesting yet typical bbq place.  However, once you walk in, you will find that Bobby Q's is more upscale than you would think.  The inside is very nice and definitely the nicest bbq place I have ever seen.

As for the food, it is excellent!  The brisket is the best I have ever tasted.  The bbq chicken, fries, and macaroni n' cheese are up there as well.  I would like to try more things (like the ribs), but I just can't get enough of the brisket.  The corn bread is also worth a try as are those lil' donuts they give you at the end of your meal.  The donuts are made fresh and  are definitely not the healthiest thing you can have, but omg they are fried magic for your mouth!

My experience with the service is that it is always fast, friendly, and helpful on both my dine-in and take-out experiences.

I honestly can't wait to eat here again!"

"A little on the pricey side for BBQ, but the food and ambiance here are great. Looks a little more upscale on the inside than what I had expected...reminds me of something somewhere between Charleston's and the Keg. This is a pleasant surprise, especially considering the location.

The portions are huge, definitely big enough to share (which helps with the cost) and there are probably going to be leftovers depending on what you order. I have sampled most of the BBQ on the menu and it is all delicious. They bring a carafe of mild and regular sauces to the table so there is no shortage of sweet-tangy-saucy deliciousness. Good selection of side dishes. I especially liked their cole slaw -- not too wet, not too sweet.

The server brings a little bag of fresh mini donuts sprinkled with cinnamon sugar at the end of the meal. They are pretty incredible!!!"
"I was visiting my friend in Arizona this past May, and we were looking to get some barbecue. She had never been here, so we decided to check it out for lunch. We both ordered the platter sampler ($16) that came with a variety of items. I got the brisket, ribs, and pork with a side of fries while my friend got the sausage instead of the pork. The sausage was a little spicy and a tad on the drier side (still good though), but everything else was excellent. The ribs were especially good - the meat was tender and fell off the bone easily. At the end of your meal they give you free mini donuts which was cute.
Interior is nice and spacious, there is outdoor seating, and service was great. According to my friend it was a little pricier, but I'm used to LA/NY prices, so I thought it was a deal considering I still had leftovers after eating my fill. If I were ever in the area again, I would definitely go."

"Wow...  I'm from California and we don't really have any BBQ there, so I like to indulge a little when I travel.   Last month I was in Ft Worth, Dallas, Austin, San Antonio, and New Orleans.    People there  said I had to try the Salt Lick in Round Rock (outside of Austin), and it was ""ok""... I thought at the time.. ""ok, it's above average""... I thought maybe I didn't really have a taste for it. 

New Orleans Jambalaya can't be matched... I'll leave it at that.  I didn't try the gumbo at Bobby Q, I just thought I would be disappointed after New Orleans a couple of weeks ago.   Brisket was unbelievable, also the best I've ever had. 

I tried the 3-meat combo and had chicken, St. Louis ribs, and brisket.   All were over the top, the brisket especially.  The ribs were very large and very tender.. probably the best I've ever had (anywhere). 

Mac & Cheese is supposedly their specialty... it was good, but I've had better, it wasn't that memorable but I didn't leave any behind either.  Baked potato side ... I wasn't happy with it, seemed under cooked or something.   I usually have a salad at least once a day, but I didn't try it at Bobby Q, I assumed it wasn't their thing. 

Ambiance was excellent but I opted to sit in the patio, it was a beautiful night, but what a mistake.   It was only occupied by a work-party or something and they were rather ripped, drunk, and to the point of talking about what it's like to travel in the south as a gay man, etc... kind of crude and I wasn't interested, neither was anyone else... higher class places would have asked them to leave. (I dinged the score for this).  After the crowd had it's fill of drinking, they turned to smoking... Oh My ... Yuck... haven't seen that in about a decade... One nice thing about California... smoking is fine, as long as it's 200 feet from anyone else.  The patio has a cover that is low and curved at the sides, it held the smoke in like an airship.   After 20 minutes, I was really gagging and it made the food taste awful.   Smokers... I know you like to light up after dinner, but you don't smoke ""during"" dinner.  Why is that?  Makes the food taste nasty? Yes... it does... learn to be considerate and take it outside for people that are eating and paying as well.   Took any desire for dessert away, I just wanted to leave at that point. 

If not for the smoking (which should really be banned in the constrained area), and the mediocre sides I would have given it 5 stars.   As it is, solid 4 (meat was that good)."
"Oh my God!!! Best food and service ever. I'm here in Phoenix on a business trip. Found this place on Yelp, the ratings are true!!!! Definitely a five star... "Sooo glad we got a chance to try Bobby Q while visiting Arizona!

My boyfriend and I shared the Wedge Salad and the 3 Meat Combo - St. Louis Ribs, Baby Back Ribs, and the Brisket. For the sides we had the Baked Beans which were perfectly sweet, and the Mac n Cheese which I could probably have done without but it was okay.

"Remember Bobby McGee's? Well they changed with the times and now it's Bobby Q's. Crazy. Know what else?  They've done it right!

The building has been renovated to anopen country feel. The patios are awesome with great water features.  The seating is comfortable and the lighting is perfect with the setup. It's all. Well balanced. 

We started with the Q rolls because all the reviews on here said we should. Yep. Yelpers are right. Tasty!

Let me take just a brief moment to tell you about Caleb our waiter. What a great guy!  He gave us a run down of what's what with his cute helpful self. We came late, which can be a problem, and the service and staff were so friendly. 

Ok back to it...

Next was the wedge salad and yummy. Caleb (the rockstar) split it without us even asking.   the chunks of blue cheese and the crispness of the iceberg were awesome. You could hear the couch from the lettuce. The crispy onions on top were a bonus. 

We went with the massive meat platter and three sides. The beef ribs were massive and not stringy at all. As Caleb told us, all meat is cooked 22 hours or something.   The pork was shredded perfect with the right amount of BBQ sauce. The brisket, my favorite was sooo tender. Mmmm meat. 

We had the corn, mac and cheese and beans. I tried them all and felt they were all a great ""goes along with"" but mostly ate meat. 

What a great dinner out!  Great food, ambiance, and amazing staff.  Caleb thanks for being a great server and hope to have the pleasure of your service again."

"Truly the best restaurant bbq I've ever eaten. I wasn't excited to drive 15 minutes more but I decided to take a chance and I am so glad I did. Bobby Qs is amazing BBQ! The ambiance is impress a date worthy. The food is delicious. Our waitress was so nice and her service was on point. We ordered the Q rolls as an appetizer and a three meat combo with mac & cheese and potato salad. Every bite was delicious.  So I had to try the banana cream pie for dessert. It was all to die for. I wanted to call ""The Best Thing I Ever Ate"" or ""DDD"" and tell them they missed one! The St Louis ribs are perfectly seasoned, fall of the bone, smoky deliciousness. The brisket was juicy, thick cut, with just the right amount of bark on it. The pulled pork is tender and delicious. The sauce was just as good as the meat. The menu prices are similar to other BBQ restaurants of this caliber. I definitely recommend giving Bobby Qs a try"
"Best BBQ food I've had in a long time. Jason, our server, was knowledgeable and very pleasant. Overall a great place for dinner."
"""I LIKE PIG BUTTS and I cannot lie""

When visiting a new city, I try to eat things we don't have in Hawaii. Good BBQ is one of them so I'm no expert, but this place was so finger-licking-I'm-on-vacay-screw-my-diet good! Since we only had one shot to try everything, we tried the sampler:

WHOLE HOG HEAVEN $48
2 choices of ribs (we got baby back and St. Louis, I would get double baby back next time)
2 choices of meat (we got pulled pork and brisket, totally would get that again)
3 sides (we got roasted corn, beans, grilled veggies, but the shoestring fries were also very good)

KIDS MENU too! The kids had the chicken strips (which is like the breaded processed kind you get in the freezer), which they absolutely enjoyed because it is familiar to them. The key to a good kids menu is to offer things kids like (not mini versions of the adult food), and they do very well here. (We also ordered the appetizer chicken tenders, which is more like real chicken, real batter and they didn't like that as much.)

BBQ sauce- when asked if we wanted extra sauce, (regular or spicy?) I asked for both. I thought they'd bring little containers but hallelujah they thought of everything-we got little coffee pots of sauce brought to the table. Try the meat first before you drown it with sauce because it really needs no sauce! But I love sauce. I dipped the fries in it, the corn in it, the beans in it, I love good sauce. We (or I) emptied both pots of sauce, but TRY THE SPICY sauce! It's not that spicy and was delicious!

Service was great, and the little things like complimentary cornbread cakes and cute freshly made on the spot ""THANK Q"" cinnamon sugar donuts was a nice treat! 
Highly recommend!"
"Great staff, huge portions, excellent prices. Not to mention some of the best bbq and sides I've ever had. A can't miss spot in Phoenix!"
"Some amazing BBQ!  You start off with corn bread that is really moist and sweet.  It's almost like eating cake.  We did the three meat platter and they split it onto two plates for us.  Don't bother with trying different sides, just get double the Mac n cheese...you won't regret it!  It's creamy cheesy goodness!  Brisket is really tender as well as the chicken.  Finish your meal off with some complimentary mini donuts in cinnamon sugar goodness and you'll have to roll out the door. Nice environment, good service and great food!  I know I'll be back for more when I come back to Phoenix!"
"Eat here often. Actually, I tend to order to go more than I do dine in. I have to say, the food is excellent.  Best BBQ in the Phoenix area . Staff is pleasant.  I only gave 4 stars because I feel the staff behind the bar could be more personable."

The brisket was just $7 and was quite a large portion.  In fact, we had enough left over for lunch for one the next day.  What a deal.  I must say that the chicken was so delicious.  Moist and slightly smoky but not so much that it took away from the flavor of the chicken.  We sat at the bar and every bartender was great... special shout out to Savannah, Chris, and Ben who always make us feel welcome and appreciated.  Thank you!"
"Great BBQ dinner on our last day of Phoenix vacation. Great staff - Ashlynn explained history of restaurant, how ribs and brisket prepared, and choices of sauces. Had a ""Whole Hog Heaven"" - which for our family was baby backs, St Louis ribs, and double order of smoked beef brisket. Tried two sauces - regular and spicy, which came to us in two small carafes for pouring. Sides included corn bread, roasted corn and ranch beans. Everything was tasty and we had left overs for part of lunch the next day. Ended with a death by chocolate dessert - which was two pieces of cake and a huge dollop of cream. Staff came by to replace empty drinks and refill water. A little dark inside so we were afraid to see what BBQ sauce stains were on our shirts when we left, but overall, a great place to dine."

I ate a piece, and I do not like cornbread usually.  I will come bk and give you guys another try in the future."

"Outstanding!
We tried this place basically on a whim.  I had just been browsing BBQ places on Yelp and saw that this one had a good rating and mostly good reviews.  I am so glad we decided to give it a try!  It was at an odd time, between lunch and dinner, so it was pretty empty when we were there. Let's see if I can break this down simply...

Appearance
-Easily missed from the road, but good amount of parking
- Not that much to look at from the outside, but the inside was *very* surprising to me.  It was well done inside, and much nicer than expected.  Pretty nice restroom as well (and includes a changing table)

Service
- Friendly greeting at the door 
- Attentive server who answered any questions we had
- All-around pleasant experience

Food
Now this is where I have to try not to gush too much.  I'll review what we ate...
- Cornbread: a hockey-puck shape rather than a muffin or a loaf, very tasty, served with butter.  Even my husband who doesn't much care for cornbread enjoyed it.
- Q-Rolls:  I practically inhaled 3 of these before remembering I had more food coming.  I loved both the sauces that came with it (chipotle and bbq)
- Smoked pulled pork platter:  HUGE portion!  I wasn't prepared for the size!  I chose fries and mac&cheese as my sides.  The fries were well seasoned and skinny, came with ketchup.  I wouldn't normally order mac&cheese, but I'd read good reviews about it... it did not disappoint!  The pulled pork itself, paired with the bbq sauce, was up there with some of the best I've had.  Moist, flavorful, not full of fat globs (always a complaint of mine), and with the sauce, it was fantastic.  I had to pack up more than half to bring home because there was so much.
- Pulled pork sandwich:  My husband's dish, with a side of mashed potatoes.  He enjoyed his pork as well, and said his mashed potatoes were good, but was unable to finish them because of all we'd eaten already.
- Lemonade:  My husband's drink.  He said that (happily) it was ""real"" lemonade, not the minute-maid kind.  Good!
- Sweet tea:  I usually love sweet tea, and this is no exception.
- I'm not sure what was put in our take-away bag with our leftovers as I can't identify it on the menu, but we were given a small baggie with some...I guess little cinnamon doughnuts?  Which...were also wonderful.

Other
- Very reasonably priced for the quality and quantity of food you're given

Overall
Fantastic!  The minute we got home, I called my parents to tell them they had to try this place the next time they were in town, and I let my friends know it's worth a try as well!  There is seriously not a negative thing I can think to say about this place."
"Took the family (2 adults, kids:2,3, & 6). Ordered the big sample platter $35 i think, and it was enough for all of us. 2 different kinds of ribs, 2 different kinds of beef, and slow roasted chicken plus 3 different sides. The food was great. You could argue that other places make a single type of BBQ better but as a whole sample of BBQ, it doesn't get better than this. The portions of the side dishes could be bigger. We got there before 6pm and had no wait... once we left though, there were lot's of people waiting.

Their bar was rockin'. They have happy hour 'till 6p. Apparently this is the spot for drinks after work. Lot's of hot looking women. I will definitely be back, either with the family or with friends for the bar.

After reading the bad reviews I noticed a trend... they were written mostly by out-of-towner's that compare this place to joints in St. Louis and such. If you're some kind of a BBQ snob, of course you've had better... get over it. The BBQ is better than you're going to get at most full service restaurants that happen to have BBQ on the menu. As for those that complained about occasional bad service... have you seen the wait for a table after 6pm? Obviously they're doing something right. People have bad days sometimes."
"This place was really good! Service was really great too. We had ordered an appetizer but they forgot to put it in, but we honestly forgot about it until after we ate our lunch. They ended up boxing the appetizer up for us to take home no charge (they really didn't have to but the gesture was nice). Good barbecue, definitely will go back."
Love this place ! The Bbq  was amazing this is the second time I've been here we came up from Tucson  and I couldn't wait to come back with more family ! The food is amazing and the service . Thank you for the great food ! We will be back
"This place is a hidden gem! The staff are SUPER friendly and the food is delicious. I am originally form California, and wish they would have a Bobby Q's in the bay area. The cornbread is mouth watering, and their beer is delicious as are the ribs, mash potatoes, mac n cheese, grilled corn and apple cobbler. There were 4 of us, and we all shared each others food, as there was hearty portions offered. I advise you to do the same, so you can taste different dishes at once. I will definitely return, if I am back in Arizona. Our waitress Victoria was soooo friendly and nice! I absolutely also loved the ambiance and the restaurant is set up so you think you are in the south. LOVED it!"
"A) this place is open on Sundays which apparently a lot of good lunch spots in Phoenix are not and B) this is one of the best BBQ joints I've ever been to! 

The BBQ brisket was tender and moist, my bf is from the south and was very impressed with the authentic Carolina BBQ sauce. The service was really above and beyond, at least 3 different staff members came to check up on us and everyone was SO friendly. (A certain resort in Sedona could learn from the people here!). 

The strawberry lemonade was super sweet and after you've stuffed yourself on delicious, moist BBQ, they give you 4 donuts in a bag with your check. Great idea because a bag of beignets certainly makes paying easier, though the food and service were so good, paying would never be a burden here. 

If you like BBQ, you MUST come here! We'll be back for sure!"
"Was not expecting food this good. I had the brisket and was not disappointed, the family had ribs and chicken. Both were very good in appearance and flavor. We will be back the next time we are in Arizona."

The brisket is the best I've ever had, excellent roast corn and mac and cheese, and strawberry colada is a total mouthgasm.  It's very cozy in the restaurant and nice and dark so that you don't have to be ashamed as you're smearing rib sauce all over your face.  But seriously....this is the best BBQ I have had in the Phoenix area so far.  So go!"

"I would give 6 stars if I could. This place has it all! The food, the service, and the atmosphere is always on point. I've never had a problem in all of my visits here. 

-The Service
My first time at Bobby Q, the Server greeted us (My Girlfriend and I) with an awesome attitude. She explained that their signature ribs are smoked for 22 hours, and a brief history about the company. There's usually a Manager circling around to make sure everyone is satisfied.

-The Food
My Girlfriend and I always order the 2 Rib Combo, I get the St. Louis Style, She gets the Baby Back. Believe me when I say, the meat literally and I mean literally falls off the bone with no effort at all! The sauce tastes amazing and they're not stingy with it. One of the highlights is the cornbread. Now, if you know me at all, I used to hate cornbread. But Bobby Q has changed my mind. The cornbread is very tasty and you can actually taste the real corn.

-Atmosphere
Kinda gives you a feel of an indoor picnic. They have unique seating. I personally like seating in the booths facing the TVs at the Bar. They usually have sports games on (NFL, MLB, NBA etc...) I believe at a certain time, it changes into a Night Club, which I have yet to try. I haven't tried their drinks yet, but I'm looking forward to it.

I would recommend Bobby Q to anyone I know. No matter how busy they are, they make sure their customers are happy. And they do get pretty busy. That's expected with the amazing food and service they have. Kudos to the Owner and Managers. And thank you to the wonderful staff! I'll definitely be back! - Gabriel Salazar"

Our server Amethyst was great! So attentive, made sure we were never thirsty. My dad had a Bacon Wrapped Hot Dog and loved it! I went for the Steak Tacos that were hot off the grill and amazing. """You smell like smoke.""  That's the greeting I received when coming home from a terrific UYE organized by BBQ lovin' Deb L.  And at that point, if my stuffed self didn't already know it, I knew I had just eaten some damn good food.

Upon arriving, I had a deja vu moment of being there before...a long time ago, sipping a virgin strawberry daiquiri (I told you it was a long time ago), and thinking I was all that.  Yes, it was Bobby McGee's at one time!  So flash forward 25 years, and I'm having a strawberry lemonade ""adult"" beverage, which was quite tasty btw, in the company of 20 fabulous Yelpers!

We were given corn bread pretty quickly, and it was devoured pretty quickly.  A little on the crumbly side, but delicious nonetheless.  Because my husband could not join us, I went with the 2-meat combo (brisket and pulled pork) so there would be some left to take him.  Yeah, that's my story.  I was a happy eater to find I could order my meats sauce free!  The brisket was good, but a little too fatty.  The pork was really good, however; adequately seasoned and smokey.  I tried the spicy sauce on the table, and found it to be just right, just a little kick to it.  For sides, the mac and cheese was creamy and not lacking in sauce.  Yum.  The roasted corn was really really good.  If corn always tasted that good, I would move to Iowa.

Our service was great and they were accommodating for our request for separate checks with a 20% gratuity.  Our service was actually good enough, especially given a party that size, that I tipped extra.  And I did refrain from eating all of my meal, so that I could have a nice lunch the next day when my husband refused my offer of the leftovers.  Only problem was he didn't refuse.  And I went hungry the next day, wishing I had eaten all of my meal when I had the chance."
Not real BBQ...just over cooked meat.
Excellent food and service.  Michael was our waiter.  He had only been working here for a week and was outstanding.  Kudos to the hiring staff. Thank you for another great experience at Bobby Q Michael!  My family and I will definitely be returning.

"Service here is amazing. While a coworker and I were waiting for the rest of our party, the probably-owner offered us drinks, and the waiter checked in with us a fair few times to make sure everything was good.

Food was...not so amazing. Portions are large enough for 3 people, and none of those people are meant to be me.

I ordered the 1) 8oz sirloin steak with 2) mac n cheese and 3) shoelace fries, along with a 4) frozen strawberry lemonade. 

1) Ordered medium rare. Average steak. There was a vein of unchewable running through it that I had to spit out. It really is quite massive and is the only thing I wound up finishing or even putting a dent into.

2) Waaaay rich. Like eating a bowl of solid melting cheese. Not my thing, but maybe it is yours.

3) Fried breaded onions. Like onion rings, but also like eating oil.

4) Unbelievably, jaw-achingly sour. The waitstaff offered me another to replace it, which was just as sour, but it couldn't be helped.

Tl;dr: 5 star service, 3 star food."
"Bobby Q...you had me at cornbread and donuts.

We made an open table reservation for 7:30 but arrived at 7:15 and were seated immediately. 

We ordered the whole hog ($38) that comes with your choice of two orders of ribs and two orders of meat and three sides. We decided to order the St Louis Ribs, baby back ribs, pulled pork and brisket. The sides were two orders of Mac n cheese (since our kiddos love Mac n cheese) and corn.  

Complimentary cornbread quickly arrived. Flatter than most corn breads it is packed with flavor. Tad oily but it was warm, moist and absolutely delicious.

As soon as we finished the bread our entrees arrived and we were shocked at the quantity. Could definitely feed 4 adults.  The St Louis Ribs...OMG! Yummy. Fall off the bone tender with excellent flavor. My boys who usually don't care for ribs ate half of the ribs.  The baby back was also delicious and less fatty. The pulled pork and brisket were also excellent although the ribs were definitely the highlight. Mac n cheese was incredibly creamy and perfect for the kiddos. Corn was a mix of slivers of Cobb and corn kernels in butter. Can't go wrong with that.

We couldn't finish our meal but that wasn't the end...they give you a brown bag labeled with ""thank q"" on it. Fresh hot, light and fluffy cinnamonny sugary goodness that tastes like fresh churros but with a mini donut texture.

10% off with check in only sweetens this place. Thanks Bobby Q for a delicious meal."
"Great food, great service, tasty treats. The baby back ribs fall off the bone, the bbq sauce is really good, both the regular and spicy. Mashed potatoes delicious, brisket is good, chicken is good. I really haven't had anything I didn't like. :)"

"If your me and want to find a joint with a rocking atmosphere, awesome food, and just to have a good time, this is your place!This is what we ordered:

Baby Back Ribs W/ Cold Slaw and Potato Salad- 5/5 rating. Ribs were succulent and off the bone tender. They had a smoky and flavorful bbq taste. Both sides were flavorful and were a great palette refresher.

St. Louis Style Ribs W/ Corn and Cold Slaw-
4/5 rating. These ribs were more meatier yet still were fall of the bone tender. However, these had a less of a bbq and smoky flavor than the baby back ribs. Both sides brought value to the Ribs as well. 

Bbq Brisket W/ MAC n Cheese and Cold Slaw- 3.5/5 rating. Brisket was very tender with a nice melt in your mouth texture. However, they lacked a predominant smoky flavor and the portion was skimp to price. Mac n Cheese was very cheesy while Cold Slaw had good flavor. 

Overall, this place is great to pig out and have an awesome time with dynamite bbq. Service was superb and as an added bonus you get mini donuts at the end of your meal;) 
Note: Prepare for long lines or else call in reservations."

"I don't give five star reviews for barbeque restaurants lightly. I'm from Kansas. And Kansas City BBQ is in my blood. That being said... This place has some amazing food. I had the St Louis Style ribs and the sliced brisket and it was amazing. Smoked and grilled to perfection. Just the right amount of bark on the brisket. Delicious ribs that almost fall off the bone. So good that I'm salivating thinking about it a day later.  

We also got the Barbeque Egg roll appetizer and it was delicious. The wrap for these rolls is a puff pastry that is fried around their delicious brisket. Dipping sauces are both wonderful. I really enjoyed the nice sweet smokiness of their regular BBQ sauce. The chipotle ranch is also quite good.

No complaints from anyone at our table. Southern Fried Chicken looked amazing. My wife got the pulled pork sandwich and let me taste... It was really good.

I just don't think you can go wrong here. The only downside is the price. You can easily drop $25 per person here, but it's money well spent on a damn fine meal. 

Possibly the best BBQ in Phoenix. Easily the best I've had since living here and I've been trying them all. You should go here... Your wallet might regret it but YOU won't."
"The food is amazing, you can 100% taste the fact that they smoke the meat for so long, it is a little expensive but I would say it is worth the splurge and leaving with your pants being a little tight. Only reason I'm not leaving a 5 Star review is just because the wait time for the food was a little long, but that can be over looked because the food itself was worth the wait."

"My wife and I stopped at Bobby Q's because we were in that area of town and looking for something tasty for lunch on Yelp. We found this place, which had several stellar reviews, and decided to give it a try. 

I got the beef brisket sandwich and my wife got the pulled pork sandwich. I had a side of fries and she got a side of macaroni and cheese. Starting with mine, the beef brisket was amazing. It was well seasoned, they used incredibly soft, super fresh, potato rolls for the buns, and the order came out hot. The french fries were crisp and well seasoned. 

The pulled pork that my wife had was good as well, however it was a little on the dry side, and probably could have used some more barbeque sauce. The macaroni and cheese was really good, and some of the creamiest I've ever had. As a starter, they also bring out cornbread which is hot, fresh and soft. It was quite excellent. 

For drinks we both got some of their specials. The drinks were massive, well priced at only $10 apiece, and easily big enough to share! Our waiter was Mateo, and he was really friendly and helpful. If he's working, request him. The restaurant itself had a huge outdoor covered seating area with fans and a fountain. There was a nice breeze, and even though it was a hot day it was still comfortable to sit outside. We really enjoyed this place, and would definitely go back."
"Not a big fan of BBQ (Sorry!) but the bf is so our friends decided to bring us here while we visited. My bf and friends bf had the Whole Hog Heaven. Being big eaters they were both happy and left full. I had the best southern fried chicken ever! Boneless chicken breast with the crispy outside (not chicken fried steak) it was amazing. Everyone at the table had a bite. Mash was great too. Service was quick. Staff was amazing. My bf wanted donuts (which they give you on the way out) before dinner and they gave them to him, he's spoiled.  Manager came over to chat with us which was really nice. She also gave us another bag of donuts on the way out for later. We will def be returning here for the best bbq ever!"

"It took a UYE (thanks, Deb!) to get me to finally try this place which is just a few blocks from where I live, and now I'm sorry I didn't try it much earlier. The cornbread starter was awesome - I could have eaten all that was in the basket, but had to be considerate ;-) Upon a yelper's recommendation (thanks, Jacob!), I had the St. Louis style BBQ ribs with sides of roasted corn and pecan coleslaw.  The ribs were fall-off-the-bone tender, so amazingly good. The more sedate flavors of the sides were a good counterpoint for the intensely savory ribs. We shared desserts -- the chocolate overload was good, and the peach cobbler was not overly sugared like it usually is in most establishments. I like it better that way because the taste of the fruit comes out more, although apparently the others preferred sweeter.  My only gripe was the lighting: on our table, the spotlight-like fixture above me shone harshly on me while keeping the others in comfortable darkness. The servers were friendly and efficient, and the mini donuts given on the way out were scrumptious. This is one place for many return visits, and I'll make sure they seat me in an area without a mini-searchlight above."
"Definitely a huge fan. I absolutely love the ambience and setup. Their service was fast and amazing. They serve tea that comes in these cute little boxes and they give you a select variety. They also give you home made cornbread with butter.

"Stopped in for dinner.  The atmosphere was great and there were many good smells wafting through the room.  We had several questions for the waitress regarding use of soy as an ingredient or cooking oil.  She had to keep going away to ask and the answers coming back were vague and not very helpful.  Not acceptable in these times.  Many people don't care, but soy is an allergen and one of our group has an intolerance.  We expect better of highly rated restaurants than to use soy as the cheap go-to ingredient in most of their menu.  Barbecue sauces can be made from real ingredients like cane sugar, tomatoes, vinegar, spices etc...   Ingredients like soy and corn syrup are a cheap sellout in my view.  With better ingredients and staff training this could be a really good restaurant.  If soy doesn't bother you, go for it.  The fresh donuts at the end are a great touch (soy there too)."

"Went to Bobby Q on 7/5/2015 after seeing them on the morning news. Ordered the Whole Hog Heaven platter with Baby Back, and St Louis style ribs, Brisket, and Pulled Pork. Food looks good but that is about it. There was no smoke flavor. Brisket tasted like pot roast with BBQ Sauce. The rub on the ribs tasted good along with the regular sauce but that was about it. Food tasted like it was cooked in an oven then finished on a grill/smoker where the smoke did not penetrate the food."
"The bbq here is pretty good, but that has been documented well by others. My favorite thing on the menu is actually the fried chicken. It's a HUGE boneless breast that is breaded in a yummy coating and although it is fried, it is not a big greasy blob. It comes with two sides, but they suggest one be the mashed potatoes and gravy. The mash is really quite good. There is a hint of spice in there that is unexpected and nice.  My only gripe is that they serve the gravy on top of the fried chicken and I have never understood why you would drench something crispy in anything that is going to eventually turn everything to a gooey mess.  The flavor is great. Just put it on the side.

The free donuts are a nice touch, but nothing special, so save the calories and get the banana pie/pudding thing. The crust is made of crushed nuts, which is then topped with a substantial layer of bannana pudding. All of this is then topped with carmelized bananas and drizzled in carmel. YUMMO!!

And if you like their macaroni and cheese (which IMHO) is heavenly cheesy goodness, skip it as a side and order a quart to go instead.  You will get about 8 to 10 side servings for around $6.50 and that is a HUGE savings over the sides price.

Put your walking shoes on for the hike you will need to burn off the calories and just know going in that you have to through your diet out the window for one good meal."

"10/12/14

Little speedy, but  not unreasonable & well worth it, if you are taking someone out for a nice dinner, you will be sure to please!

To be honest, this change in format was the best thing that happened to Bobby McGees, because it was starting to feel stuck in the 1970s.  Bobby Q's is just plain awesome.

Update 12/31/17

My review still stands, but be aware that I have noticed since my last review that the crime activity in the surrounding area has become remarkably worse."

"In an effort to cure our weekend blues - the hubby devised a new plan.  Instead of staring @ each other all weekend we alternate weekends and plan something for us to do.  Budget of $100.   No complaining!   

This was his weekend.  I'm one of those wives that loves a surprise/hates a surprise.  With that in mind I had great anxiety over the adventure ahead of me.  We start off with major construction going on our off ramp.  So we got a little side tracked and wound up going through some stranger parts of Phoenix.  I couldn't imagine a restaurant here so I was really starting to wonder what he had planned.  Then all of a sudden closer to the freeway there it is.  The most glorious signage I had ever seen.  Bobby Q's.  Fantastic.  He's gonna feed me and then the night will really begin. 

We head into the restaurant and everything is so cute.  It helped so much that tonight we could finally WANT to eat outdoors if we wanted to.  It's so much cooler.  We were told that it would be about five minutes.  We turned around, sat down and then our names were called.  Not bad.  I immediately notice the comfy little love seats and some of the tables.  We were not lucky enough to grab one of them but next time I tell you, my butt will be in one of them, or outside.  Tiffany came over and explained everything.  Which was great.  I love when wait staff knows their shit.  As a diet coke fanatic I will gladly let it pass that the competition is served in their restaurant.  I oped for the peach iced tea and had four more glasses after that.  At $1.75 how can you beat that.  And its not artificial tasting at all.  This was good.  Hubby had a beer that was specifically made for the restaurant.  BBQ Amber.  Good.  Went well with the meat.  Tiffany (who in my opinion is the epitome of what a wait person should be) immediately brought us some corn bread (to hold us over) and it was so good.  So GOOD.  I frosted mine like a mini cake with that butter and was all over it.  YUM.  When we put our drink order in we put an order for the Q-rolls in.  Before I was done with my first glass of iced tea - the appy was out. Think a smaller version of a taquito with beef brisket inside.  So awesome.  Good, just good!  I ordered the three meat combo (go big or go home) chicken, brisket and baby back ribs.  Chose mashed potatoes and corn as my sides.  Done and done.  Pic to follow.  I picked up a rib and it looked like the flintstone quarry.  Clean.  Not a lick of meat on it.  Where was the meat?  Oh on my plate.  It slid right off.  Not a touch of fat anywhere on it.  Melted on my mouth and was so good I was having trouble sharing.  The brisket was phenomenal.  The chicken with a touch of the spicy bbq sauce was run out on to the freeway and play good.  DELISH!  Do you get what I'm telling you here?  Hubby's meal was just as good.  Mac and cheese was great.  The corn.  O EM GEE the corn.  The little corn coins.  So cute and so damn good.  More peach iced tea.  At some point hubby used the term ""meat mayonaisse"" to describe the ribs.   He says that the fat on the ribs (which was minimal) melted in his mouth.  

The manager came over to check on us and what a doll she is.  I'm so mad that we didn't get her name.  Dear Manager - thank you again for the delish meal, the unexpected treat after and the great time we had on our date.  We will bring everyone we know there, we will suggest to everyone that they go there.  It was a real treat.  

To summarize - great place, great drinks, great service, great food, great manager, great dessert.  It will be our go to restaurant."
"We were here earlier during this last MLB Spring Training, and didn't have reservations. It was too late to wait the one hour plus wait time. This time I planned ahead using OpenTable. After a long drive from Orange County, we arrive just in time for our 7:30 appointment. Our waitress Christin was awesome allowing us to sample things, so we knew exactly what we wanted to order. My wife and I had the Hog Heaven plate for 2 (or more!)... Baby back and St Louis ribs, beef brisket and chicken, and we even got to try the sausage. The meat was falling off the bone and was tender as could be. They didn't over do the barbecue sauce either. The cornbread muffins were tasty. The manager Barron was amazing as well... Thank you for comping the mudd pie to celebrate our son's birthday. We were constantly attended to. They definitely won over a customer for life. I will certainly be coming back next spring training."
"We were traveling through Phoenix on Father's Day and I was trying to find something great for my dad. Yelp led me to Bobby Q as it was close to my hotel. "Coming from LOs Angeles I really wanted to try some AZ BBQ. The place was very nice resembling Lucilles Bbq. We ordered the  hog heaven, and easily shared amongst 3 of us. It was very moist, and delicious I enjoyed the meat entrees very much. What I didn't care for was the Mac n cheese it was a little too velvetta for my taste. It resembled the Mac n cheese from KFC. The coleslaw was delicious as well as the baked beans. I would probably eat here again but keep in mind for peeps from Los Angeles it's comparable to claim jumper IMO. "Went out on a date Friday night, again he picked the place, and it was a non-chain place, which scored him some points, but Bobby Q's gives the feeling a chain place, I have never been and I never knew about the Bobby McGee's that used to be there, I'm not from Arizona, and wasn't around during that time.   

After I went to Bobby Q's I actually looked at some the reviews from fellow yelpers and man I am sorry I missed out on the roasted corn, I am going to have to try that next time I go!  Our server's Melissa was a good, but she got tractable, like we made bets to see how long it would take before she came back to our table to check on us, it was about every 10 mins. Now don't get me wrong I love good service, but there is a difference between being pushy and good.

Like I have said before, Im a visual person and when I saw on the drink menu that yummy looking drink called Strawberry Qlada, I knew I had to get that, when it came to the table, it was just as beautiful in person, pinks, red, white, pineapple & cherry garish, it was a delish drink!

The round corn breads were a sweet surprise! I love me some cornbread! And with the whipped butter, what could be better, other than drowning them in hot bowl of chili! 

I ordered the 8oz center cut top sirloin with mac & cheese, ranch beans & mushrooms & onions for my steak!   I had asked Melissa if she liked the mac & cheese and she is it was the bestselling item on the menu, oh that's good, but that didn't answer my question lol but I wound up ordering them anyways, and they were good, but it wasn't great! Yes it's made with 5 different cheese, its creamy and it's like eating velveeta mac n cheese, not my fav but if that's your thing, then it's up your alley! The ranch beans were good, it was little peppery and sweet, which is a great combo for me!  The steak was the perfect amount for me! It was cooked to perfection, it was tender and tasty! The mushrooms and onions were sautéed just right, not too soft not to hard!   

Had I read reviews I would have known at the end of the meal they give us some sweet donuts! How cool is that! Any places that offers sweet little donuts is alright with me!"

"Oh man, Yelp did not disappoint me during a weekend trip to the Phoenix area with this place. First of all, they warm you up with free cornbread whilst you decide on what kind of grilled flesh you'd like to consume; it's served with a side of butter but TOTALLY not needed...the cornbread is warm, soft, and buttery as it is. 

On to the main stuff - promove if there's just two of you dining would be the Whole Hog Heaven deal for $38: pick from two meats off of a list of four (the ladyfriend and I picked the beef brisket and sausage), two rib selections out of three (we rolled with the beef ribs and St. Louis-style), and three sides from their list (went with grilled veggies, mac and cheese, and shoestring fries). The brisket had that wonderful, beefy flavor - tender and moist on this particular occasion. Sausage was sausage; nothing spectacular. The beef ribs were good; they were decently sized and definitely meaty. However, we enjoyed the St. Louis-style ribs; these too weren't the pinnacle of ribdom, but these were also tender and delicious. As for the sides: grilled veggies - good, wish we had more; shoestring fries - they were fries; mac and cheese - too cheesy.

Why five stars? Great service, great deal for the amount of food we got, and, as many have noted, WARM DONUTS BEFORE YOU LEAVE. We didn't know about that part until we passed on dessert and received the check. If you feed me a good meal for a good price and give me a fresh treat at the end...well, you're a winner in my book."
This is my favorite place to eat in Phoenix! I love the rotisserie chicken and mashed potatoes.

"This place was OK. I was surprised about the overwhelming amount of positive reviews, so I had to check it out for myself. I'm not from the South but I know when great food is great, and this place is good, but not great. The St. Louis ribs are better than the baby backs, which are a little too sweet. The mac and cheese was nothing to write home about -- it almost tasted from the box, but not as orange in color. Two friends who had the beef brisket said it was OK but too mushy. I got the peach cobbler, which was mediocre (and seemed like it had been microwaved hot). It's a far way to go for OK bbq, in my opinion. 

Most of us at the meal thought this place was fairly expensive as BBQ joints go. It was $17 for a two-meat sampler, and apps were about $7-8."
"Back in the 70's this was THE spot to go before/after prim when it was Bobby McGee's Conglomeration.  Waiters in costume, bathtub salad bar and the best disco !  We loved it then, took our son when he turned 17 (13 years ago) and the place always had a soft spot in our hearts.  Then it changed with the times and became Bobby Q's BBQ.  The hubby and I had to try it after all our times there in high school, college and beyond.  We were very pleasantly surprised at the change and delighted with the food!  The BBQ us terrific and shows how their slow cooking technique pays off.  I love the fries and the salads are good too.  A nice stiff cocktail arrives when ordered and the service is mighty good.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are HUGE!  The crowning jewel are the hot little biscuit dough donuts like Mom used to make with cinnamon and sugar; served in a paper bag.  A great family spot with rich history."

"All you need to know is... PULLED PORK!!! It is seriously one of the best pulled pork I've ever had! I'm from California and we are blessed with Phil's BBQ and my sister and I prefer Bobby Q over Phil's BBQ!

What We Ordered
- Beef Brisket with Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes
- 2 Meat Combo: Pulled Pork and Beef Brisket with Mac and Cheese and Mashed Potatoes
- Steak Sandwich with Shoestring Fries
- Catfish Po Boy Sandwich with Roasted Corn

The complimentary corn bread was good! Very moist! The beef brisket was good! The meat was tender but I felt that I needed to add the bbq sauce for it to taste better. The Mac and Cheese was super duper cheesy!! I loved it!! The Mashed Potatoes were really good as well! Super buttery and smooth.

The Pulled Pork (not pictured because my sister was sitting too far) was AMAZING. It was good by itself or with the bbq sauce! I really wished I ordered this instead, like I originally planned. Luckily, my sister let me sample some of hers. :) My Mom enjoyed her catfish po boy. She's really picky so that's telling you something lol. My Sister and Mom loved the roasted corn! 

The only bad dish was the Steak Sandwich but I don't know if that's because my Dad ordered it medium well. He said it was too chewy and had no flavor. His shoestring fries were really, really salty and soggy! He was very upset, to say the least lol.

They give you little sugar donuts, (Thank Q's), at the end of the meal! They were so cuteeee! They were just average tasting but I enjoyed the fact that they were free! I will come back for the Pulled Pork!"

"From the moment you park your car and step  out there is magic in the air. It is almost a foreshadowing of things to come inside.  And when you finally do reach your  seat  your mouth will water and your  stomach will rumble because everything you've  heard is true. There food is that good.
  As far as restaurants go, Bobby Q has the look of an old industrial factory with a touch of western thrown in. The interior is a combination of wood, steel, glass, concrete, exposed pipes, ducts, and wires. At first it may  look like everything was thrown randomly together, but everything fits in a modern organic way. The overall  effect is entertaining. Your eye drifts from one area  of the  room to the  next.
  Now  the food. For lunch I had their combination platter consisting of the ribs, brisket, and chicken. And as expected, the food looked good. It smelled good. And it tasted even better.  It was hot. It was  tender. It was tastey. But what suprised me the most was the chicken. It held it's  own against against the ribs and mighty brisket.
  For more info check out their  website. Or better yet, just go."
