"This is our go-to BBQ place in Phoenix!! The BBQ is amazing, the decor is inviting, and the service is great! We come here as often as we can!"
"Wow, this place is amazeballs! I've been to some of the best BBQ joints in the country (Bogart's, Pappy's in St. Louis and Kreuz, Smitty's, Black's in Texas) and this is not far behind at all! Plus, the service couldn't be much better. 

Ambience was great and a tad dark with a bit of a rustic feel to it. Too bad it was cold outside that night or we would have eaten out on the patio. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with a side of potato salad. Before that came, we started with a complimentary corn bread which was one of the best corn breads I've ever had. It was warm, sweet, and almost cake-like in texture. Pork from the sandwich was moist and not stringy at all (which is often the case in a lot of BBQ places). The flavor itself was smoky and there was just enough sauce so that the taste of the meat still took center stage. Potato salad was great too and had just the right amount of mayo. 

Once we had finished our meal, we were given a bag of complimentary mini donuts to take home. Wow, free cornbread AND donuts? I'm completely sold! I've tried a good amount of restaurants since moving to Arizona about 2 months ago, and Bobby Q is definitely in my top 3."
"Great service and atmosphere, tons of parking, and the food is awesome.

The brisket is amazing, just incredible, juicy, melt in mouth-type of meat, I personally think I would come back just to eat this. Baby back ribs are so good, I actually enjoy less fat vs the St Louis. The sausage is also super tastyans juicy.

My friend said their brisket was dry so stay away from there.  Ribs were def falling off the bone. "On a visit to Arizona about a week ago I stopped by here for lunch before flying home. This is a nice barbecue restaurant that has an attractive interior along with a bar area. "I have heard many things about BBQ in the state of Arizona. Everything from how its not in the same league as KC and TX Bbq and how it lacks flavor like bbq from those places. but I have to say that this place makes me wonder if they never ate here.

It is certainly not blue collar BBQ as its not cheap which means its food not everyone can enjoy. That is the magic of BBQ! I lacks that  ""wear the shirt you dont mind getting messy"" feel which is the only reason I gave it 4 stars. 

Otherwise the meat is expertly smoked (you can smell it on the drive in which is key), the flavors are amazing, ribs fall right off the bone and of you so much as breathe on the meat it falls appart for you. 

The endless cornbread is really a nice selling point for me now as its so moist and yummy. 

The waitress was very well versed on the menu and provided some excellent attention to us while we were dining. 

The food was fantastic, the staff is very friendly, the setting is well enough for a special occasion. Its not your everyday neighborhood bbq joint but if you just got paid and want to celebrate a special occasion then this place will send you home with a full belly and a smile of your face."

"This was an interesting find. Upon arriving in Phoenix, i obv checked yelp to see what the best eats were. Based on the reviews, this seemed like a no brainer.

We shared the Q rolls and a both ordered the pulled pork sandwich. The Q rolls tasted like they were from Applebees and the pulled pork just wasnt juicy at all. "Best BBQ in Phoenix, hands down.

Great ribs and brisket, especially. The donuts are good when they are fresh, and usually are.

Service has never been an issue here, but never over-the-top stellar - but that's okay in a casual BBQ joint. 

Keep it up!"
"Where do I even begin? This is the best bbq I've ever had in my life. So so good. The bbq ribs are so bomb!! My boyfriends favorite is the brisket. And DO NOT SKIP the corn bread. So good. So warm. Fresh. Tasty. Buttery. Goodness. I suggest to make reservations, it's always so busy."
"We were in town visiting and looking for a BBQ place and ended up at Bobby Q's. Let me start off by saying I'm not a huge fan of bbq so I was hesitant on going, but once I tasted it I was SO glad we chose it! The portions are huge and easily shareable, plus the sides are SO good! I tried the macaroni and mashed potatoes and they were both great along with the corn bread which comes before your meal. They also give you mini doughnuts with your check which were again super good. The service was also great, I don't remember our server's name but he was super attentive and recommended a bunch of items on the menu. Bobby Q's is definitely worth checking out and it's safe to say I will be eating there whenever I'm in town!"
This was such a good pit stop (pun intended) on our way from Sedona back to San Diego!
"Yummy! We drove up here since the other place on top of this list (close to the university) was sold out. Worth the drive! Easily the best bbq I've had. Hubby and I shared the 2 rib platter (St.Louis and beef) with 2 sides - cole slaw and roasted corn. Fall-off-the bone meat, tender and moist, smoked but no overwhelming ""smoky"" taste, delicious corn bread that we asked for more! Our server, Carissa was fantastic. The manager on duty came to each table greeting customers. Top that!"
"I went here tonight with my lady and everything was great. Ordered the St. Louis style ribs but wasn't a big fan. Mentioned it to the waiter and the GM came over and comped it. He got me the brisket platter instead, but also a few baby back ribs for us to try. Went way above and beyond my expectations! 

Also best macaroni and cheese I've ever had at a BBQ joint bar none!"
"The best barbeque I have ever had. Fast service. Great portions. Meat falls off the bone!! Service is ok!! Definitely worth going to in Phoenix, AZ!!"
"Coming from Florida with a lack of everything, this is outstanding BBQ and our service was great too!  No complaints. First visit and will definitely be back!!"
"Baylee was our server and the manager said she was new, we had excellent service along with great BBQ! Plus the portions are huge, definitely left overly full :)"
"This is our third time to Bobby Q. My husband requested that we go there for his birthday dinner. I have to start by saying that told the hostess that it was my husband's birthday but nothing was ever said about it. I don't expect alot but a candle stuck in the mac n cheese or in a donut as acknowledgement that it was his birthday would have been nice. That said, our server, Zac, was lovely. Very attentive and pleasant. Clearly, the hostess just didn't bother to mention the birthday because I'm sure that Zac would have said something nice. He was great. The baby back ribs were yummy. Very fall off the bone. The mac n cheese is quite cheesy and I love the cornbread. On this occasion, we didn't have dessert because we were stuffed from ribs but I have had the banana dessert before and it is spectacular."
"I was staying at a hotel about .8 miles away as I was going to the Fiesta Bowl, and I noticed that they had an ad about delivering food to the hotel. Then I started reading the small print. Does not include tip, tax, $3 set up charge, etc. I decided to go there so I called. I told the girl where I was staying, lots of one way streets, etc. and asked for directions from my hotel. Lots of um's and ah's and she then asked me to wait until she got someone else on the phone. I almost hung up and then another dizzy girl picked up and she started stammering and stuttering without any clear directions, until she told me to wait until she got someone else on the phone, and I said, ""never mind"" and hung up. I went to the front desk at the hotel and the woman there gave me clear directions in about  2 minutes. I was on the phone with the two dingbats for about 15 to 20 minutes. I drove over and it took about 5 minutes to get there. I walked in and the restaurant was packed, so I went into the lounge to see if I could order in there. As I was walking about, I received ""hard"" looks from the guys on duty there, bouncers I guess. I looked at the jerk, turned around and went to the reception area and asked one of the young ladies how long it would take for a table for one. She said about an hour and a half. I asked her if she was serious and she said ""yes"", so I left. When I got back to the hotel, I tried to order take out without success. Even though it was before 9PM and the order form said that they delivered up to that time, they said they were not delivering. I gues it was because it was New Years Eve. When I went to the office to look for another restaurant, I met some UConn fans, and as I was talking with them about Bobby Q, they said that Bobby Q wasn't that great when compared to a few CT barbecue places or some Southern places they visited in Charlotte during another bowl game. The famous cornbread did not live up to its rep, so I felt better. Then, they asked if I wanted to try some of their food. They had a bunch of leftovers, that they weren't going to eat, and I had a microwave in my room. Like them, I wasn't impressed with either the food or the famous sauce. More hype than good food, an incompetent wait staff, and nasty looking guys in the lounge does not look like a good time to me. Sorry Bobby Q."
"This place is great, solid proteins and when I want BBQ I care about the sides almost as much as the meat and this place has the BEST sides! Mac and cheese is incredible, highly recommend eating here."
"By far best bbq, Mac and cheese and cornbread I have ever had. I will be returning!!!!"

"First time back since the nightclub incident, but it has been five years and this time, I entered the no-dress restrictions dining room. The BBQ Burger with bacon, onion straws, house sauce and cheddar was easily in the top 5 burgers in the area. Perfectly cooked well done, it came with my choice of side and that was the very crisp and cold pecan dusted cole slaw that had a nice crunch. The pre-meal free cornbread was light and airy and a good starter, but I do prefer the more dense style.
Hot Donuts: Chewy, sweet, Doughy - a nice touch
Mac N Cheese - sticky style, perfect crust and just really good
Brisket - Some fat, but alot of moist meat as well and served sliced."
"This place has the BEST BBQ! Great facility/fun atmosphere, lots of cool stuff. Very busy place, but amazingly fast service.  Everyone from the hostess, to the manager were very polite  and welcoming.  My wife and I split ""The Whole Hog"" meal......more than enough for 2 people!  We went back the next night for more.  We got a mixed platter of baby back ribs, St Louis style ribs, pulled pork, beef brisket, potato salad, coleslaw and grilled veggies......everything was AWESOME!!! To top it off we got fresh made mini donuts to go. Shout out to our great bartender(server) too....Spencer, THANKS!"
"Not all barbecue is created equally. I'm from Chicago and grew up eating barbecue NOT pulled porked sandwiches or beef brisket, but pork barbecue ribs & rib tips from the south side of Chicago. Ya know, the kind where white bread and french fries are saturated in sauce at the bottom of the basket. Where you have to work a little bit to pull the meat off the bone. Where you smell the charred ribs a few blocks away. Now that's barbecue to me.

This does not mean that I cannot appreciate other types of barbecue. We spilt the pulled pork sandwich and slab of ribs. It was good, but I packed the leftovers for my husband's lunch today. When something is really good I don't share and sadly, the ribs we just okay. 

I gave an extra star for the customer service. The hostess and waitress were polite, attentive and nice. Too bad more establishments are not as well run as Bobby Q."

"Been here with my gf right before new years. Ordered a Q roll and a bbq sampler platter. The Q roll has beef brisket wrapped inside and deep fried. The bbq sampler comes with 3 meats for $13 so we chose bbq brisket, pulled pork, and the ribs. The ribs were REALLY tender and juicy, loved them. Brisket was very tender too and the pulled pork was good. Overall, the food was really good and service was pretty decent. I would recommend this place"
"Absolutely amazing! We had dinner tonight at Bobby Qs. We were sat quickly by friendly hostesses. It was our second time dining there. And it was the best service and food we've had in AZ, again. I hate to forget a name of a great server but he had a trimmed beard and said he was born in '88 in a conversation we kicked up. I got a great beer recommendation for a great price during happy hour. "The staff here is amazing.  Kristi the head hostess, Blake the manager and my server Travis were all attentive and very eager to please.  The night I visited there was a college graduation and a football team in the house.  The line wa backed well into the parking lot and the entire scene was a ballet of highly organized chaos.  They said it was a typical Friday night and took it all in stride.
They have a few ""Reserved"" high tops on the bar area...if you are a party of one, ask if you can sit there.
The thing to get is the Beef Brisket...so tender it melts in your mouth.  I also wanted to try the Texas Beef Ribs.  This is where the staff shined.  I found the rub to be a bit heavy on the salt and the pepper.  Travis asked how things tasted and I was honest.  He offerd to bring me something else.  In general, I live with my choices so I stuck with the ribs - despite his three tries to bring me an alternative.  The were still good and entirely edible...I chalked it up to my palate.  Blake brought me a side of their delicious Mac and Cheese.  
This is a solid 4.5 to 5 experience and I went high because of the service.
Oh BTW, 10% discount for Yelp checkin.   I will be back and bring my foodie boss.
9:30 and still a line."

This building also hosts a trendy night club, which we did not visit.

On top of that the staff and facility were all top notch, helpful and cleanly!"

"Bobby Q is a unique property, in which one side is a Barbecue restaurant and the other is a music venue. A couple weeks ago, we celebrated a co-worker's birthday here, and although we were outside when it rained, we didn't have to worry about getting soaked. The beers were quite tall, and the food was excellent! Along with ordering the pulled pork mini-burritos and wings, we were also given small sacks of fresh cooked mini-donuts. Nowhere have I gone to, have those been served; you wouldn't think of a BBQ place serving such delectable little donuts!

In regard to the music, I can't say I've been there but did have a DJ friend there recently headline there for a Thursday night. The set up looks good, for being outside of Downtown Phoenix and Old Town Scottsdale.

Can highly recommend if not for the BBQ, at least for the small sacks of fresh donuts!"
"Oh no! I caught the meat sweats again from Bobby Q! That bastard!

"My first review! I felt obliged to sign up (and do this), since I found Bobby Q via Yelp (tonight) in the first place. We enjoyed ribs and pulled pork, the food was just right. Not Memphis mastery, but a solid effort. The BBQ sauce was especially good--all our sides were fresh (especially the pecan cole slaw, which can easily get ""soft"" by 10pm depending on the establishment. They started the meal with good (sweet) cornbread. Overall nice and clean atmosphere--the manager asked if we were okay several times. We got free tiny cinammon donuts at the end, a nice touch-. I left stuffed, $40 even (without tip) for two. Note that they provide a 10% Yelp discount--smart choice, I wish them the best."
"I have been thinking about dining at Bobby Q for a couple years.  I am SO THRILLED that I checked them out tonight.  With luck we were sat right away on the adorable patio. "All around amazing restaurant! I have seen this restaurant on a MUST try in a list somewhere but forgot the name. So I decided to enlist Yelp for help when I was in the Arizona area for Spring Training this year. What strike me was the 1300+ yelp reviews and the 4.5 stars rating. I knew I had to bookmark this. Reservation was easy as I did it on open table (4:30PM on a Monday).

My bf and I arrived earlier and sat at the bar. That's when I learned the hard way that Arizona has a law that prohibits selling alcohol to anyone with a vertical ID, even though they might passed the age of 21. (Yes, I'll be renewing my license this month as it expires next month). Oh well...

The full party arrived and we were led to a table for 6 in the back. We were promptly greeted by our server, Riley. He made us feel welcomed with his friendly attitude and provided us with a great recommendation for appetizer, the Q-roll! Everyone enjoyed it and it set a good note for the rest of the evening.

All the ""adults"" except me got the Bobby Q Amber Ale that went really well with the BBQ, while I got the frozen strawberry lemonade. It was delicious! They served us complimentary circular shaped cornbread before our main course, that was really good too. This is coming from someone that doesn't blink twice for cornbread. Then our order of the Whole Hog Heaven and a rack of the St. Louis Style Ribs came. That was the perfect amount for our group of 6 adults. We only had 2 ribs left and everyone was stuffed! To top off the amazing meal, our server gave us a bag of homemade cinnamon sugar donuts to take home. Overall, I was so glad my choice for dinner was a success!

Parking: A big private lot. There are spaces reserved for to-go orders.

Atmosphere: Outdoor patio, bar and dimly lit indoor seating. 

Good for: Dates (not really for first dates unless you don't mind eating BBQ), catching up with friends, small and big groups (family, friends, celebration, birthdays, etc.)

Service: Super friendly and accommodating. Right when I entered, the hostess was smiling and ready to help. Our server was awesome!

Food: Amazing. Don't even need a knife, it just melts off the bone! Whole Hog Heaven for groups of 4! Try the Amber Ale or the frozen strawberry lemonade.

Apparently, they'll turn into a nightclub on St. Patrick's Day. I'll definitely be back if I'm back in this area! :)"
Great foods and a lot to choose. Service is good and people were kind.

I liked at the end of the meal they give you these wonderful little fresh donuts...Ahhh...be still my beating heart...When I go back to Phoenix, I'll be hitting up this place! One more thing... Location is a bit awkward. If You're headed to this restaurant & if it feels like you're lost.. You're not...it's in somewhat of a residential area."

"After all the glorious reviews this restaurant has, I had to check it out. I ordered the Saint Louis ribs, pulled pork and brisket. My sides were the beans and coleslaw.
The service was good, and the donuts at the end were good, the slaw wasn't bad either.
The rest of it was bad to terrible, the cornbread came out and it was mush, I couldn't pick it up and eat it, it fell apart in my hands.
 I thought what ever, the meat should be good. 
The main course came out, the exact same way, light brown clumps of mush, the brisket fell into little pieces and needed to be put in to a sandwich to be eaten. The pulled pork had very little taste. Next the ribs, the meat fell of the bones, a mushy mess, I had to eat them with a fork, because it was impossible to pick up a rib bone. I  only ate as much as I needed to feel not hungry,which was less than half. I had to eat the sides just because it was solid food. I will never go back there again, And considering the other complaints of  'mushy meat ""  on here  this wasn't a fluke, I felt I had to add to it. Total waste of money."
"My family and I frequent this restaurant often, the food is good yet pricey.  MY REVIEW INVOLVES The fact that my wife wanted to throw a graduation party for 30 people. The manager was non friendly and not AT ALL communicative with information, almost as if they didn't want our money or reservation. They offered us a small weeknight window, no menu suggestions, no flexibility.

"I remember this place from back in the Bobby McGee's days. A lot of crazy fun back then and a solid performer to date.

A lot of food for the money. Well prepared. Usually competent, friendly service. Sometimes the wait is a bit long. And, though plentiful, truthfully the barbeque is good, but not great.

"Everything is relative to the area.  So I will say that this is definitely the best in Phoenix or anywhere else in Arizona.  No chain or mom&pop shop can compare to Bobby Q's.

I ordered take out but their little after dinner doughnuts were a nice twist to bbq.  And the cornbread was certainly better than average.  My favorite part comes when we speak of the macaroni&cheese.  Who and how in the world did someone in Phoenix learn how to make mac n cheese like this ?!  I was skeptical when I looked at it because it was an off-white color.  But it was creamy and full of rich flavor.  I ordered the smoasted chicken and drizzled some of that bbq sauce on it.  It was well cooked and the bbq sauce was high quality with a little zip and long lasting good after taste.  Strongly recommed the sauce (on the smoasted chicken) and mac n cheese. 

Your mouth will water when we talk about the peach cobbler.  It's not the best I've had (3 places I've tried around the world have been better) but it's a B+++++.  The crust is almost candied and melts in your mouth.  The flavor is NOT too sweet or powerful to the point where you can only eat a few bites.  It was well put together.

To top it off, the person who answered the phone and took my order (and my money) had her customer service skills in high gear.  She made me want to return because I felt like I was being taken care of.  Big smile, plenty of suggestions on whether I wanted her to include an extra cornbread or a couple extra doughnuts....at no charge.  Very accomodating so I had no problem living her a nice sized tip.  She made the experience enjoyable and I will be back time and time again!!!"
"My boyfriend and I came here for his birthday (also our first time) and all I can say is- WOW!

"I'm not a huge BBQ fan, but I can go for a stack of ribs every now and then (especially if it's from a highly recommended location).

The venue is fairly large and was very busy when we arrived. The parking lot itself was %70-80 full on a Friday night. Luckily for our group, I had already made reservations. 

The restaurant has a rustic, western feel; it's casual as well. Service was spot on - fast and friendly. 

Started the evening with the fried Calamari. What's different about this calamari, compared to most, is that their pieces are large (think chicken tenders), but don't be intimidated. It's cooked perfectly so it's not too chewy and has a great texture. The panko breading puts it over the top with the extra crunch factor it's has.

As a group, we got the house salad, soup of the day (potato cream soup), and the Whole Hog Heaven. Soup was very good - it has a thick consistency with bits of bacon and cheese but nothing special. The Whole Hog Heaven comes with corn bread which was one of my favorite part to the course. It's light soft on the inside, descent layer of crust on the outside, savory and not too sweet. The beef ribs were BOMB! The baby ribs were good as well, but not my favorite or the best (kind of wish I had tried the the St. Louis instead of the baby backs). Sausages were good; if they were spicy, it would have been amazing. The brisket were one of my favorites, but they were not consistent in texture (some pieces were slightly dry while most pieces were melt-in-your-mouth delicious). Our sides consisted of the mac & cheese, shoestring fries, and ranch beans. All of the sides were good but nothing unique. The ranch beans were my favorite of the 3."
"We noticed that Yelp had given this place high reviews so decided to try it as my birthday dinner choice because I wanted to try something new.  When we arrived I expected to find a small dinner that served BBQ but the atmosphere was outstanding.  The place was packed which was a good indicator of the food.  When we ordered, our waiter, Bryce, was exceptional.  He was very knowledgeable about both the food and the cocktails and gave great suggestions.  He was very busy but stopped by to check on us often and went above and beyond as far as taking care of our table with a great attitude (how refreshing).  They way he described the food had me wanting to try everything. The food-the food-oh my goodness.  It was amazing.  We ordered the whole hog so we could try different items since it was our first time there and the three of us were not able to finish it.  Every time we took a bite we were like you got to try this it is amazing.  Everything became our favorite.  Bryce told us it would fall off of the bone and it did.  We had a hard time getting the meat to our plate because it was indeed so tender it fell apart.  We were completely stuffed but had to try the doughnuts.  Again, another favorite.  I am so happy we have found a new place to eat and will definitely be going back for atmosphere, food, and service.  Thanks Bryce for taking care of us."

"Loved this place - of course, another great find from Yelp!

The people at the table next to us on the patio were like...um, what did you two order?? We had no answers for them other than...awesomeness apparently! I've had some small martinis for $10 before...so this was just...whoa.

I had the pulled pork and mac and cheese. I will admit that the pulled pork was a bit dry, but a little extra BBQ sauce and that's an easy fix. Plus the BBQ sauce was delicious, so it gave me an excuse to use more! Win. 

The mac and cheese was, for lack of a better word, luscious. Creamy, cheesy and everything good southern style comfort food mac and cheese should be.

The real winner here for me was hands down the cornbread though. I'm a huge cornbread fanatic, and theirs was true southern to the core. Well done Bobbby Q, well done.

Overall: A+
Some good southern BBQ with great sauce and great sides. And...the drinks..I mean seriously...the drinks!"

"I absolutely love Bobby Q! I've been to Phoenix twice to visit my brother and both times, we've paid a visit here! "Okay, I am stingy with my stars.  This place really deserves all five.  Don't let the long wait discourage you.  We almost did and are so glad we didn't! "Since there have been so many reviews of Bobby Q, I'll just quickly review our experience with food and service. See pictures too.

Hot wings: very juicy (good quality chicken). Wifey thought the sauce was a bit ""different"" (i.e., not true buffalo authentic), but she enjoyed them nonetheless. They were a bit spicy, but not so hot that you finish your beer in 5 seconds (more like 30 seconds, but I digress) The veggie were also good, if you're into that sort of thing..

Pull Pork Sandwich: the pork itself was excellent. Big chunks of meat (not shredded), which was very tender. They serve it with a little BBQ sauce (but you can supplement), a pickle on the side, and a side of your choice. The bun, however, was very buttered - too much for my taste, and slightly burnt. I would probably tell them to hold the bun next time (or the butter!)

Baby-back ribs: I really wanted to like these since they looked so good (and fall-off-the-bone tender). However, they were VERY smoky - perhaps it was just the sauce, but it was definitely a detraction for me. I routinely go to the south for BBQ (so my expectations may be high) but I would pass on these in the future. Wifey also thought they were very salty, but she tends to be more sensitive to that than me.

Shoe-string french fries: as good as they sound. Very tasty, super thin, and salty. Would definitely get these again.

Service: very attentive and friendly. In addition to our main server, we had 2 other staff check up on us (as part of their routine), but it was not intrusive at all.

Beer on tap: went with the Bobby Q brown ale and later a Kiltlifter. The Bobby Q was a bit too nutty - definitely going with the Kiltlifter next time!"

r"
"It may be impossible to find good pit bar-b-q outside of Texas.  I'm still hoping, but have not found it yet.  Fair warning, I'm hard to please when it comes to bar-b-q'd brisket.  In Southern Texas, the pit master starts cooking at 10PM to have meats ready for lunch the next day.

I've heard a lot of good things about Bobby Q from family members.  Was able to stop for a Saturday lunch today.  Ordered the two meat platter with cole slaw and potato salad.  

Nice attentive waitress brought out some cornbread muffins.  I grind my own corn meal and cook buttermilk cornbread in a cast iron pan I've had for twenty years.  Tough to compete with my cornbread.  These muffins have blenderized corn kernels to give them a little flavor.  They were the classic sweet cornbread.  Sweet with a little bit of canned corn taste.  Oh well, I came for the bar-b-q.  

Sliced brisket and sausage was served on a platter with sides in small bowels.  Oh no!  There was sauce drizzled on the brisket and sausage.  It's almost heresy to put sauce on good bar-b-q.  Definitely an insult to the pit master.  

The prime brisket was very tender.  Brisket is a tough cut of meat that has to be gently cooked for a long time to coax out the tenderness and flavor.  Even then it has to be cut across the grain to be tender.  These thick slices were amazingly tender.  There was no smoke ring.  Tender bland brisket.  The sauce was the star of this plate.  Crash and burn.  

The sausage had grill marks on the sliced sides.  Reheating on the grill did not help the flavor.  It was a little spicy, but had very little flavor from smoking.   Again, the flavor was from the sauce that covered it.

Cole slaw had chopped pecans on top.  Nice touch as I love pecans.   If the pecans were browned in a little butter, it would have helped a lot.  Otherwise, pretty plain cole slaw.  OK, but not special.

I've had awesome potato salad.  This Bobby Q's version was OK.   Good, but not anything to write home about.  

So, I continue to be a disappointed Texan.  Guess I'll have to invest in a smoker.  

Go to Bobby Q's for good service, quality tender meat, and good bar-b-q sauce in a nice atmosphere."
"This is my all time favorite restaurant of all times. If I were on death row, my last meal would be from here. If I were ever going to get married, I would  have them cater for me. I never went to Bobby McGees unfortunately, but I have been eating at Bobby Qs since it became Bobby Qs. I have never had a bad meal, nor have I seen anyone else not enjoy their meal. I have never had bad service, or even mediocre service. The food and service have always been excellent, above average, wonderful. 
I can't say how many times I have been here over the past many years. I used to go at least once a month as it was me and someones date restaurant for a long time. Every time someone visits from out of town, I bring them there. They always request to go back when they are visiting again. I've brought dates to this place, they have always loved it. When I talk to someone else about Bobby Qs, and they've had it in the past, they always say they love it too. I even met someone from out of town that said they go all over the country to eat BBQ and Bobby Qs had their favorite ribs of anywhere they've ever been to!  I've been to going away parties, birthday parties, tons of stuff, and I've still never met anyone to complain about this place. 
The only complaints I've ever heard is of the club. Who cares about the club? This is about the restaurant, the food, the service. Not some dance club where some teeny bopper got in a fight with her boyfriend so they had a bad night so they are going to complain about Bobby Qs. Come on now! 
Try the amazing, phenomenal food that Bobby Qs is!! The cornbread is great, the nice donuts they give you as you're leaving are delicious and the spicy bbq sauce is my favorite. I like that they sell their bbq sauce so I can have it at home too! It feels comfortable inside as well, the decor is nice. The outside patio is a great spot when the weather is nice. My dad lives 1800 miles away and is always asking me if I've eaten there recently and to take pictures of the outside water chains so he can replicate that at his house."
"I took a group of 7 here. They were really busy but there was a lot of people working. We hung out at the bar and had a drink while we waited. "The best BBQ I ever had!!!!!
Ordered st. Louis ribs, baby back ribs and sausages.  The meat just super juicy and tender and fall right off the bone! Can't  get enough of that! I normaly love the ribs without bbq sauce, but their bbq sauce, Omg, adds sooo much flavor and nothing is too overpowering, the falvors are totally balanced, perfection!

For sides we ordered coleslaw(sooo good! Still thinking about that flavor mmm...),

potato salad(I prefer sweet potato  salad, but this one is great beacuse it will balance out the sweetness from the bbq), 

corn(love this one as well, the smoking flavor is soooo addictive!) 

and baked beans(loves their bbq sauce! Need I say more?)

Be sure to checkout this place when you in Phoenix!!!"
Went to BObby q for a birthday gathering recently. We were a party of 6. I was the only one who had been before. Everyone was impressed with the place. The service was outstanding. I appreciate the fact that we were really able to relax and our server paid attention to detail. Food was great. Will be back.
One of the best ribs and brisket I had. The rib meat could have fallen right off but it was just right- juicy and flavorful . The brisket was flavorful but could have been less dry. Overall top 3 ( I've been to a couple in Austin and Houston) and this one made it on that list. The meal comes w one side ( Mac and cheese- a little too cheesy for me tbh) and corn bread (could be warm. Order the sweet tea and call it a day!
"I went here with a large group for a friend's birthday. This place is great for large groups! The atmosphere is casual with slightly higher-than-normal ambient noise/sound level. Dishes are large and can be shared. 

Cornbread is served prior to appetizers and entries are brought out. The bread is fresh baked, but in my opinion, slightly dry. It's okay if you're using butter though. I had the Smoked Sliced Beef Brisket with Mac & Cheese and Shoestring Fries for my two side dishes. The brisket was probably one of the best I've ever had. Piping hot, super juicy, and tender (fell apart on my fork as I was picking it up)... With just enough sauce so that the meat wasn't swimming. I liked how they served both mild and hot bbq sauces on the side so you could have more sauce as needed and to the spice level you prefer. The Mac & Cheese was very creamy, but nothing extraordinary. It felt very heavy. The shoestring fries were your typical thinly cut fries that are crunchy, but could use a little more salt. Towards the end of the meal, ""donuts"" are given in brown lunch sacks. They resembled beignets in the shape of donut holes. These donuts were very sweet and oily, but had a nice crunchy outside and soft inside.

Over all, I was most excited about the brisket (next time I come back I'll definitely reorder this dish). The donuts were a nice surprise, but overly oily for my tastes. I would recommend a reservation, since when I went the restaurant seemed quite busy. Not too shabby for a bbq joint in the southwest!"
"We came here because I wanted to try something different. This place had very good reviews on Yelp so I thought I would give it a try and I'm glad I did. Bobby Q had really great food, service and an all around great experience."
"I came here for dinner with my family the other night and we had a nice time. I would definitely recommend making a reservation because they get SO busy especially on weekend nights. 

It is for sure likely going to be crowded and on the loud side, but it is a super fun environment. The restaurant is really big and it has a great Western theme. 

We were seated pretty quickly with our reservation. It definitely took awhile for us to be greeted and to get our first round of drinks. Our server mentioned that the bartender was really behind so that it might take awhile for our drinks. I felt bad for the bartender and it seemed like they should have had another bartender helping. They had also run out of many of their gins because it was the end of the month, but I felt like that shouldn't be an issue. However, their cocktails were tasty. 

Regardless, our server was super nice and friendly. She was very good and attentive in the beginning and then towards the end it was difficult to track her down for awhile. I think she had a really big party that she was taking care of. 

For starters, we started off with the recommended Q-rolls stuffed with brisket and served with chipotle sauce. These were delicious! They were crispy, not oily, and the brisket inside was tender and flavorful. 

For my entree, I got the fried chicken, with a baked potato and mac n'cheese. The fried chicken was very good--crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The baked potato was good--not overly oily. The mac n' cheese was very good too, but reminded me a lot of stouffer's mac n' cheese, which isn't a bad thing--just reminded me of it. The prime rib that I tasted was also very good--tender and flavorful.

The prices were fair.

Overall, really fun and casual ambience, good food, fair prices and decent service."

10/10 would recommend to anyone. Even Vegans."

"Shelley Sikora has to be one of Phoenix's most passionate restaurateurs. She has a remarkable history managing a restaurant empire and also has more than one published cookbook. She was one of 34 U.S. chefs chosen to appear in the 2006 IACP cookbook, ""For the Love of Food"". Her newest cookbook called ""Skinny Bread"", 100 Amazing Ways to make Flatbread. I'm looking forward to reading.

Bobby Q's serves up authentic dry rubbed meats cooked to perfection, and spicy sauces. Walking in, it feels very comfortable. The decor has always been outstanding for the past twenty years. The attentive service is solid.

I could rave about dinner but let me just say, this house is in the top 5 'best BBQ' In AZ. Want to be #1 on my list, let's have live Blues. And I almost forgot to mention the cornbread and donuts."

"Bobby Q is one of my favorite places to go whenever I have family or friends new to Arizona. It has fantastic, flavorful, smoky BBQ options in a clean spacious dining area. With all the choices and sides, it has something for all lovers of BBQ. 

My favorite starter is the Q-Rolls; but who could resist a crispy eggroll stuff with their delicious and tender smoked brisket. And usually we order the Whole Hog Heaven, which really is a feast for everyone eating it. You get to pick two ribs, two meats, and three sides. You cannot go wrong with anything you chose. I usually get the baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs, smoked sliced beef brisket, and smoked pulled pork with a side of sweet potato fries, pecan cole slaw, and mac & cheese.

-- Q-Rolls

"I have to say that this is some of the best BBQ I have ever had! The price is very reasonable as well, especially for the amount of food you are given. The BF and I shared the ""Whole Hog"" platter. We finished it, but only because we're gluttons and don't believe in wasting food. It was enough for at least 3 people. The meat just fell off the bone and melted in your mouth. I also appreciate that it wasn't smothered in sauce. They give you the opportunity to actually taste the meat but give you extra sauce on the side if you want it. We had the mac and cheese - gooey and scrumptious and the corn - roasty. The cocktails were tasty and also reasonably priced. We were there on a Saturday night with a party of 14. I don't know if we had a reservation but we were seated pretty quickly. We could tell that they were busy and even though we were taking up a lot of precious space they never  made us feel rushed. The waitress was a doll! Being a large group we didn't all arrive at the same time, needed separate checks, and needed drinks at different times. She didn't miss a beat and everything was accurate on our bill. If you check in on Yelp you get 10% off that visit and you can register for their mailings on their website and they'll send you a coupon for a free onion block appetizer.  There is a club attached to the restaurant but it is pretty bizarro. I wouldn't recommend hanging out there after your dinner. It isn't a honky tonk but a CLUB club for the locals. It doesn't really fit with the restaurant but whatever more power to them using the space to make some money. Apparently every table in the club is sold out every Saturday night so good for them. I forgot the mention the donuts. If you are too full to eat them after your meal, as we were, take them with you! I sincerely regret not bringing them home to be eaten at a later time."
"We drive by Bobby Q's all the time, and comment how so and so said it's good - we should try it. Well, we finally did.  Long time Phoenicians will remember this as the old Bobby McGees with costumed, singing waiters.

It's a rustic-looking, galavanized tin building with lots of tangled plants growing around it under what is one of the last stands of eucalyptus trees in the valley; it's cool - makes you feel like you are some place else.

I was pleasantly surprised when we walked in.  I didn't know what to expect, and the decor is more elegant than I would have expected, yet with shabby chic touches.  Some tables have chairs on one side and banquettes on the other - something different.  It's very pretty.

The menu is pretty standard for a barbeque place.  I went straight for the baby backs (half-rack, $16.00), my favorite.  Hubs ordered two meats ($17, I think) pulled pork and beef brisket.  Our waitress was nice, but a little unpolished, very valley-girl, yet helpful and attentive.  She plopped a basket with two round pieces of cornbread and whipped butter on our table - delish cornbread.  Beer comes with a frozen glass - a nice touch. 

He ordered a wedge salad - generous helping of chunky blue cheese over ice berg lettuce with bacon and onion strings.  

Sides are standard - shoestring fries that aren't really shoestring, beans, mac and cheese, pecan coleslaw that we almost tried.  We both got the fries and beans. Beans have a little bit of meat in them, and a bit of zip, but are nothing outstanding.

The ribs, however, were superb.  I put my fork in between rib one and two and the first bone basically fell on to my plate.  I had to nibble the meat off only a couple of the bones - other than that it melted off the bone.  The flavor was perfect - the meat flavor comes through the not too sweet, not too tart, smoky sauce.  

Hubs thoroughly enjoyed his pork and beef as well.  The sides were so, so - we will try different ones next time.

We were too full for desert, but received two little - fritters or donuts (couldn't understand the valley-speak) in a paper bag to go.  Fished them out and ate them - little bits of heaven right there.

We will definitely be back for ribs.  It's a very pleasant, dressy casual restaurant and, a plus, it's on the west side!"
"Came back again and this time brought some friends to help us eat the Hog Heaven meal and we still had a ton of yummy left overs. Our waitress (I think her name was Megan, sorry I can't remember now) was super patient with us. She was always on top of things. Jason, the manager, came by and said hi to all the patrons. What a nice guy!  Look forward to coming back here again and again. Sign up for their newsletter!  I just got an offer for a free appetizer."

I don't have to write a long review to say that this is the best BBQ I've ever had!!! Even going out of state and trying other BBQ places...Bobby Qs is still #1.
This place is really good ao far I been here twice and the food and service has been awesome. I had a waiter named Ruby and she was extremely friendly and I also meet the General Manager who was running around greeting himself. Their pulled chicken and beef brisket was off the chain and their drinks was awesome. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone
"Before the food review, I need to praise our server, Edgar, who was efficient, adorable, and helpful.  The atmosphere is also really nice. The portions were adequate for the price.  Now.....

Good Q flavor is a fairly subjective thing.  That being said, well-cooked meat should be pretty objective.  The meats I had here, I wasn't real excited about.  

There's ""falling off the bone tender,"" and then there's mush.  I found ours to be of the mushy variety.  The mouth-feel was pretty weird.  We had the baby backs, pulled pork, and brisket.  There was not much outer crust, and that's what held what flavor the meat possessed.  Under that was lightly-flavored mush.  The baby backs had potential.......

Sides we had:  pecan coleslaw (""we ran out of pecans"") - I liked it because it wasn't of the sugary-sweet-and-gloppy southern variety, and I could actually taste the cabbage.....mac 'n' cheese - ton of very creamy sauce that was on the bland side.....beans - pretty good, and I'm not a fan of BBQ beans, usually.....roasted corn - very buttery.....corn bread - flat disks that were of the crumbly-and-not-too-sweet type, as opposed to the cake-disguised-as-cornbread kind a la Marie Callenders.

I might go back for a burger...some cornbread....some of the little doughnuts served gratis at the end of the meal.....maybe not........"
"The brisket and Mac and cheese..... YUM! They slow cook the brisket for, I believe, 18 hours and it's so incredibly tender and flavorful. The Mac and cheese also has  quite a few different cheeses... Including velveeta? YES PLEASE.
Personally, I think the cornbread is a little dry and the steak sandwich was just a huge disappointment. I really don't think that one slice of garlic bread and a hunk of steak makes a sandwich. And yes, it's ONE slice of garlic bread... I just don't see that as a sandwich.
The mashed potatoes are great, make sure you get extra gray cause that's the best part.
If you want something as an appetizer, happy hour is from 4-8 and their 50% off... The brisket quesadilla and spinach artichoke queso dip with garlic bread are the best ones on the menu if you ask me.
Give this place a shot, it's got great reviews for a reason. Just don't get the steak sandwich. Hahahah"
"Short and Sweet. 

Long wait on Sunday Night.  Make a reservation. Location on 27th packed. 

Fast and friendly service. 

Prices too high. $22 for 1/2 rack Back Back and $29 for full rack. $13 for BBQ sandwiches and hamburgers. 

Prime rib and Steaks way over priced for a BBQ restaurant. Drinks (alcohol) overpriced. If you don't mind paying MORE than go for it. Food is generous portions and GOOD but nothing special. 

Mini (free) sugar donuts after dinner are hot and tasty but watch the grease contained herein. All and All if you don't mind paying more and get lots of food and a loud dinning area then go for it."
"Every time I have been to Bobby Qs I have had a great experience. Our server ZAC was awesome, especially for it being his first week! Thanks for great food and great service!!"
"We arrived at around 8 on Saturday and waited around 20 minutes to be seated. It was pretty busy.

The wait allowed us to check out the menu before hand and we knew what we wanted before we sat down. Unfortunately they were out of baby back ribs so I had to opt for the St. Louis style. FALLING OFF THE BONE. They smoke that shiz for 18 long beautiful hours! We were all very happy with our meal and I only wish there was BBQ this good in LA.

Afterwards we all shared an order of peach cobbler and nearly fell asleep at the table from tasty overload. I haven't had cobbler that good since I was a kid and my godmother use to pick the fruit fresh from her trees.

I bookmarked this spot for our trip to AZ and completely forgot to mention Yelp for 10% off. I would be kicking myself harder if the food wasn't worth the price in full. I have to remove the one star for not having the baby back ribs."

"Really I'd still say this place is 3 1/2 stars but since you can't do that on yelp, 4 stars it is.  Came back with some girlfriends.  Still not the best BBQ but not bad either.  As tender as the ribs are, they still don't have that great smoky bbq taste within the meat that makes bbq REAL bbq.  We got the hog heaven meal so we had the baby back ribs, st louis, pulled pork and chicken with the potato salad and pecan slaw sides.  THe pecan cole slaw was good.  
Roasted corn side was not quite what I expected as I thought it was just that.  It was roasted some but was more like small slivers of corn on the cob on top of a bunch of corn kernals.  But the sauce was tasty - probably pure butter.
We also got the fish fry special.  The fish I have to say was done pretty well.  It was a crispy batter so it wasn't overly soggy with oil.  The fish (cod) was pretty fresh tasting.
This time the cornbread wasn't as soft which I liked better.
Tried their banana pudding dessert.  It was different than what I was expecting.  The pudding was a lot thicker than I would have liked but still tasty.  The crust though was yummy.  It was a walnut-like crumble.  Very similar tasting to the inside of baklava.
Still have yet to try their peach cobbler.  Will next time."

"Not the best BBQ I have ever had, but it is pretty darn good.

Because it is not really obvious from the street, we overshot Bobby Q and had to do a turnaround in quite a sketchy strip mall a couple of blocks up. Half expecting a total dive we were pleasantly surprised to find the restaurant itself nicely appointed.

Before we even ordered our food a tasty basket of cornbread was brought to the table. We ordered a sampler plate containing 3 different meats - pulled pork, brisket and St. Louis ribs as well as a BBQ chicken sandwich. We couldn't decide on which sides to select but when our server brought us a sample of the mac & cheese to try our minds got made up in a hurry.

On the sampler plate the St. Louis ribs were terrific, the pulled pork was not too bad but the brisket was kind of dry. Fortunately the server had brought large containers of 2 types of BBQ sauce to our table so we were able to moisten the brisket with the sauce. The chicken on the sandwich was moist but I found the sauce a little too mild and sweet.

The service we received was friendly and attentive and the little doughnuts in the to-go bag was a nice touch.  Overall, worth a repeat visit if we are in the area. 3.5 stars."

"Do you want great, smoky brisket, but to order off of laminated menus handed to you by impeccably polite servers? Do you want authentic ribs, but not want to get your hands dirty? Are you curious about BBQ, but aren't sure if it's still conceptually owned by Confederates?  Do you prefer your pork sandwich in a dimly lit museum-lodge instead of at a splintery wooden table outside? Do you wish you were at Hillstone? 

Then Bobby Q is the spot for you! It's giant, civilized, organized, sexy, and capable of hosting massive private parties! It has no trace of the down home, no frill, authentic, dirty, traditional BBQ sentiment I love. Bobby Q combines two culinary traditions (Southern barbecue meets steakhouse vibe) without much organic intersection, providing a nice way for the bourgeoisie to enjoy BBQ, sans flies/plastic cutlery. The food is good, but the hike in price for out-of-place frilliness? Call me a stickler, or a hick, or a hickler, but the glamification of this otherwise humbly glorious cuisine doesn't quite move me."
Corn bread and the ribs are awesome!! I agree with everyone here. The food are tasty. The customer service is even better. We went ahead and gave extra tip. The wait time on the weekend for high rating restaurant usually 1hr or more in bay area. I'm do happy that i do not have to wait. I got seated within 5 mins. Definitely will come back :D
This was the first time we visited Bobby-Q. What a wonderful place. The food and craft cocktails were very tasty. Our server Sarina was very attentive and delightful. You MUST visit this place you won't be disappointed!! Try and make a reservation if possible but it's still worth the wait without a reservation!
The closest thing to spending an entire day prepping and smoking the meat myself.... minus all the work. Great food at a very reasonable price. Our server (Cameron ) was on top of everything. We will be back even though we live over an hour away!
"The place was packed and the wait was about 45 minutes. Started with the calamari which was delicious. The corn bread and macaroni were amazing. The pork sandwich I had however, tasted like the meat had been sitting in water all day and was mushy with 0 texture. My wife had the brisket sandwich which was better, but again, the meat just tastes mushy and not tender. For the price, I would assume it would be higher quality. I'm sure there are other amazing items on the menu, but we were 0-2 on what we ordered."
"Great service and food. The complimentary cornbread is very warm and tasty. Manager Donnie was great and came over to make sure everything was great. Our waitress Tylor was wonderful. She brought us our beverages and kids meal right away. Brisket platter was very good. 
We also enjoyed the donuts for dessert. Everyone seems so happy and wanting to make sure the experience is great."
"First of all, kudos to Bobby Q's staff. Absolutely EVERYONE was super friendly and attentive. I was waited on in some way by at least 5 different members of their team, at least 1 of whom I believe was the manager. Everyone smiled and made eye contact, and they all seemed genuinely concerned that my needs were being met, and that I was getting what I wanted. I was immediately greeted with a smile when I walked in, and smiled at the entire time I was there. I really did experience 5 star service.

The ambiance was casual, rustic, and interesting in its own way. 

The bartender came right over (you guessed it - with a big smile) and when I indicated that I had not been in before, she immediately explained about the lunch menu and the various options in just enough detail. She left me to fill my drink order while I considered my choices. 

I decided on the Platter Sampler, which allowed me to choose three kinds of meat, a side and cornbread. I figured that this would give me a chance to check out more than 1 item. Of the sides, the roasted corn was the most appealing to my tastes. I also ordered their shoestring fries. I don't have the capacity to consume large amounts of food, but with that long a drive, I wanted to try lots of things, even if I couldn't finish them.

A few minutes later, I overheard a couple of gentlemen at the end of the bar ordering meatloaf. Wondering how I had overlooked that, I studied the menu some more, but didn't see meatloaf anywhere. When I asked, the bartender indicated that they periodically have off menu specials. Since I had come so far, I ordered the meatloaf (only $9.99) to go.

My food came out very quickly, and there was a lot of it. Portion sizes were generous. I had opted for a combination of Brisket, St. Louis Ribs, and Spicy Smoked Link Sausage. 

The roasted corn was not corn on the cob, although the dish was topped off with two slices from the end of a roasted ear of corn. The off the cob corn had kernels that looked like they had seen fire. The juice that the corn was in had a good solid smokey flavor to it. I had anticipated and would have preferred roasted corn on the cob. To my personal tastes, it wasn't great, but it also wasn't bad.

The shoestring fries were perfectly cooked, thinly cut, skin on, and nicely salted. It was a HUGE order that came out in a little pail. I could have made a whole lunch out of the fries alone! I hardly put a dent in them.

Turning to my platter of meat, I was somewhat disappointed overall. 

There were several slices of brisket. It was extremely moist, almost mushy as if it had been cooked in liquid, and there was no smoke ring. I've lived and eaten all over the country, including Texas and the Carolinas. I have had good smoked brisket, and this bore no resemblance. It was more like pot roast or meat you would find in stew, with no smokey flavor. In fact, the corn had more smokey flavor than my brisket. I would not order the brisket again because I think this must just be the way they have decided to prepare it. Maybe lots of people love it. Maybe they've never had better. I didn't like it.

The sliced link sausage was missing the usual coarse texture of sausage, with the textures of fat and lean. The mouth feel was as if it has been boiled, or in liquid at a sufficient heat to cook the fat out of it. That left the texture sort of like moist cardboard. The flavor coming through wasn't bad, but the effect was like nicely seasoned boiled cardboard. (It took me the entire drive home to figure out a truthful way to describe it.) Perhaps this batch had just been sitting in warm moisture too long. I'm going to go back and read through the reviews again to see if I'm the only one who experienced this.

The St. Louis Ribs saved the day for the meats. Except for being a bit fatty, and a general lack of smokey flavor, they weren't bad. Not great, but not bad.

The good news was my take-out meatloaf special. I swear my portion of meatloaf was nearly 2 pounds! It was also tasty! It wasn't what I expected as it had more pungently savory ingredients than I am accustomed to in meatloaf, including a degree of heat, although not excessive. It was topped with a generous portion of golden fried onions, and accompanied by a huge serving of skin on mashed red potatoes! The only downside for me was the gravy, which I am grateful came in a separate container on the side. I'm not a fan of tarragon or thyme or whatever it was loaded with. Lots of people at the bar were eating it, but I didn't notice whether or not they used/ate the gravy. Simply a matter of preference I guess.

Please consider this review with a grain of salt. I've traveled and eaten extensively, but I'm not a critic. I just know what I like. You may love what Bobby Q's has to offer. The only thing that I am really sold on is the wonderful customer service. I'll also throw in that they appear to have lots of regulars, and that lunch appeared to be a bustling affair with no lack of diners."
"This place is amazing. Better than Dillon, better than famous Dave's. The best barbeque."
Wow wow wow asked for a 3 rib combo and manager made it happen and that was after he took care of two apps since we were seated 15 mins late.  Totally unnecessary but very appreciated!  Kristin our server was unbelievable and Taylor the manger checked on us 5 times during dinner.  If I could give 10 stars I would.

"Wow. First of all, the complimentary cornbread from the start was sublime. They don't just give you a lil slice per person. No. They bring you a lot and then ask you if you want more. "We came to Bobby Q off of the recommendation of a friend and we were definitely not disappointed! The food was super good, the service was great, and the restaurant looked very clean and nice. 

We came at around 12pm and there wasn't a line, and we were seated at a large table. The waitresses were very nice, and brought us water once we sat down. We saw the fresh mini donuts being made near the front of the door and they kindly gave us some before our meal; the donuts were dusted with cinnamon sugar and they were delicious! The donuts were soft, warm, and perfectly fried. After the donuts, we decided on the Whole Hog, which was quite a lot of food for three girls. The whole hog came with St. Louis and Baby Back Ribs, three sides (which we ordered shoe string fries, mashed potatoes, and corn), BBQ chicken, and brisket, as well as cornbread. The cornbread was buttery and delicious, and it tasted great with the whipped butter. The bbq was honestly the best I have yet to have! The meat was fall-off-the-bone tender, and the meat had a good fat-to-meat ratio. Of the meats, my favorite was the smokey St. Louis ribs, which were less saucy and contained chewy tendons (if you're into that like I am). The mashed potatoes was also super buttery and smooth, and tasted almost like a dip. Also, the waitress brought two pitchers of BBQ sauce, one spicy and one original, so be prepared to drench all the meat in even more sauce. 

After the meal, the waitress was super kind and brought us another round of donuts! 

I would highly recommend this place if you're in Phoenix! The food was amazing, the staff was super friendly, and the sides and donuts make this place stand out."

"I've been to Bobby Q's 4 times now and always have gone at Happy Hour. Why? Because it has a nice little menu. Today, two of us ate 3 appetizers and the bill was $14.

This is my go-to spot for West Phoenix (I live in Chandler). Depending on your goal Bobby Q's has it - nice bar, nice restaurant, and nice club on the side.

Club: I've gone to the club twice now on Friday (not sure the hours). Earlier in the night it is rather interesting (in a good way). The way that I describe it as - someone brought in their iPod and put it on shuffle. They play country, hip-hop, rap, alternative, oldies, rock, and disco all in one sitting. This makes for an interesting dynamic as many people who want to dance to Toby Keith's ""I love this bar"" probably don't want to dance to the follow-up song of Soulja Boy's ""Kiss me through the phone.""

Except me of course - I stay and dance to whatever is playing.

With that said, the crowd is generally older. I was boogying down with a lady that was 70+ and having a ball. Later in the night (read: after 10pm) the crowd changes to an urban crowd and has a crowd that is complimentary to that music."

We shared the baby back ribs, pulled pork and brisket; our sides were mac and cheese and beans. The cornbread and the doughnuts at the end were quite enjoyable.   Everything was delicious.  The great thing was that since we told them we were sharing, they split the dinner on two plates so we didn't have to do that at the table.  We decided to only eat half of our dinner so that we could order dessert.  The dessert was good but not anything really special.  We had the apple cobbler.  The menu said peach and I would have enjoyed that more.  It was good.  Overall our evening was very nice.  The service was amazing and the place has nice ambience.  We will definitely be back."

"I tried Bobby Q's on the reccomendation of Yelp.  You guys know your stuff and I do trust Yelp when it comes to searching out new places.  As I've said before, I am no bbq afficianado, I just know what I like.  It was a weeknight when we went so it was not super busy.  We were greeted and seated promptly.  I noted that there was a large bar area and thought that this place was probably a hoppin joint on a Friday or Saturday night.  

Our server was very pleasant and helpful.  I asked what she liked on the menu and she told me her favorite was the brisket but she recommended I try a combo.  I got brisket and ribs.  I started wih a salad which was tasty and fresh.  My meal arrived shortly after and our server was correct, the brisket was so tender it just melted in my mouth.  It had a nice flavor.  Now, on to the ribs....yet again, melt in your mouth, tender and flavorful.  My daughter was happy as a clam with her chicken strips.  So, why only three stars?  Well, I don't usually disclose things like this but about an hour after we got home, I made several trips to the comode.  I never have issues when I eat, ever.  Something did not sit right with me or something was not good.  Was it the salad?  Don't really know but it lasted for two days.   Suffice it to say that, if that happend to you, would you be leary to give a stellar review and go back soon after?  

Bobby Q's has a nice atmosphere, cozy and warm.  I loved the music that was playing......blues and old soul.  The service was great too.  The other issue that I had was the location.  If I did not have a GPS, I never would have found the place.  It's set back off the road and the signage is very small.  

Maybe I'll give it another try in a year or so.....when the two days on the comode is a faint memory."
"it was our first time here and let me tell you... UH-MAY-ZING!! christin was our server, she was very knowledgeable about the smoking methods and the different kinds of meat. she really helped us to narrow down a choice (so many delicious sounding items on the menu)! she was funny and very personable which made the dining experience that much more enjoyable.
the endless cornbread is TO DIE FOR. it comes out warm with butter, it melts in your mouth! the portions are huge so there's plenty to take home for round two."
"Seated immediately on a Saturday night, score! The side-by-side booths in the bar area are brilliant. They save room and both seats face the TV. Can't imagine why other restaurants never thought of this. 

Corn bread comes out first. Just the right amount of sweet and perfectly crisped edges, with a delightfully fluffy center. My only complaint is that we didn't receive more than one each! 

For our entree, we split the three meat combo (baby back ribs, brisket, pulled pork), which comes with any two sides (pecan cole slaw, mac n cheese). They split it between two plates without being asked, which was a nice little surprise. It didn't look like enough food for the both of us and we thought we may need to order an appetizer, but it ended up being just the right amount of food!

The cole slaw is refreshing and makes for a nice break between bites of the other ""heavy"" foods. Mac n cheese is both extremely cheesy and saucy, so if a ""drier"" mac is what you prefer, I'd skip this. Meats were all incredibly tender and weren't drowning in BBQ sauce, as some other reviewers had experienced. 

They finish you off with fresh donuts. Who even needs to order dessert!? They're like little cinnamon pillows. I thought I was too full for anything after dinner, but I finished off the donuts before we even made it back to the car. 

Five star experience from start to finish."

"2000+ reviews and rated nearly 5 stars? Why, yes please!

On a nice evening, I'd recommend, if possible, to sit at the outdoor patio.  Outdoor string lights cover the patio. It's sort of dim inside but with bright lighting above each table. Instead of waiting for a table, three of us sat at the bar. With a couple TVs, we were able to catch up on sports.

Among our group we ordered the beef brisket and ribs. When they say a full rack of ribs, you get a full, meaty rack. The sides included shoestring fries, grilled vegetables, roasted corn, sautéed mushrooms, and mac n' cheese. "Hi, 
I visit Bobby Q on 7-19-2011 after reading the good reviews about this place, so I want to check it out myself since I'm from Texas.  I ordered a Whole Hog Heaven for me and my hubby with bottle of wine, and for my daughter I ordered the pull pork sandwich.  Alright people, the barbeque was ok and for the people who have dentures this is place for them.  The ribs, meat melt of the bone alright but it's too mushy.  I can't even pick up the bone because the mushy meats just melt in the tray.  Good bbq ribs, meat should attach to the bones when you break it and melted in your mouth when you eat it that's call good bbq people.  Their pull pork was good and their corn bread was delicious seriously, but the brisket was too dried and the meat is brownish like old meats.  After tasting the brisket I just stop eating my dinner.  Lucky I had a bottle of wine.  Good brisket supposed to be little char on the outside, pinkish inside, and juicy.  Barbeque sauce normally served on the side because the good briskets meats are juicy and tender; therefore, the sauce doesn't need to poor all over the brisket.  Our server was alright doesn't know much about wine though, but I can't complaints because I'm not at fine dining.  The ambience was ok, music ok, but menu little greasy and some bread crumbs in it that's not so ok to me.  The price is very cheap.  Quantity is beyond my expectation but need to work on quality of foods.  For three of us the bill comes to $86.37 including tips.  I hope this review help some of you, thank you!"
I ate at bobby q on the patio with our server Abby! My friends and I got yummy drinks and we're promptly served cornbread! Abby made amazing recommendations for food and drink and the manager checked in to make sure we were enjoying! Delicious food and fun and cute vibe! Will return!

"I can't tell you how many times my husband and I have been here. We moved here a little over a year ago and a colleague took him to try it. He came home raving about it until I agreed to try it. Last month we took our newborn son for his first visit :) We love that the manager always walks up to your table to make sure your visit is going well. They also have response cards (usually on the table, but not always) that you can fill out with when you were there and how your server was. That definitely shows that they really care about the service they are providing. Though it's almost always very busy, they have great service and the food comes out quickly and hot. Speaking of the food.. My husband is obsessed with their ribs and spicy BBQ sauce (he always asks for his own BBQ sauce bottle to have at the table) He also loves their burgers and swears that the Mac n cheese is the best in the world. When I go I get the steak sandwich. It's juicy steak cooked to perfection on garlic bread with sautéed mushrooms, au jus sauce, and fried onion strings on the side, incredible. But in saying that.. I always try to go on Saturdays because they have a steak and crab special for $18. Their crab is to die for! They place a candle on your table with a butter tray above it that's perfectly melted and warm. I also love their shoestring fries. They give you complimentary cornbread during your meal and a bag of little donut holes afterward. I love this place. We went here three weekends in a row one time (We had different things to celebrate each time and didn't want to go anywhere else!) I love their specialty drinks too. Like most specialty drinks, they aren't cheap.. But yummy. The shipwreck is my fav. If you like good food and good service, GO HERE!"

"Came here for the first time while on a business trip to Phoenix. I've had some good bbq in the past. This place is legit. There's a reason why they have above 4 stars here.

We ordered a combination of meats.

"Yeah, yeah, yeah, the name of this joint leaves something to be desired. I don't eat a lot of BBQ because most of the places in San Diego aren't very good. Man, did this place set the bar(bq) high for future BBQ spots.

I had the half slab of spicy bbq ribs with potato salad and mac and cheese. The amount of food that they brought out could have fed three of me- I can't imagine how much food they give you with the full slab. The ribs were incredibly tender and fell right off the bone. The SAUCE was amazingly delicious. I can't even describe it other than that it was so good that I wanted to order a pitcher of it and pour it over everything. 

I am a total potato salad guy and this potato salad hit the spot. Perfect blend of ingredients. The Mac and Cheese was just otherworldy with the amount of delicious cheesey gooeyness that it was. All in all I think I gained 30 pounds just from eating half of the meal.

Even if you don't order a dessert, they end your meal with some homemade mini doughnuts (yeah I spelled it out)! It's a perfect treat even if you have to take them home to eat them. Heat them back up before you do. 

I will definitely go back here next time I visit Phoenix."
"Away from home on the 4th of July my boyfriend and I were craving BBQ and after scouring yelp for the best BBQ places we decided on Bobby Q.

With reviews upon reviews and pictures of the whole hog heaven the boyfriend and I told ourselves that we would not be tackling that beast on our own... but we did. After a conversation with our waiter it really did seem like the best option to sample what Bobby Q had to offer. And for the amount of food given, it was well worth the price.

Although overwhelmed when the platter arrived to our table, the boyfriend and I found ourselves quickly working our way through it. We had enough leftovers to stuff one person senseless. 

Do yourself a favor and opt for the baby back ribs and the st louis ribs. You get more bang for your buck this way instead of going for the beef back ribs which they will only serve you two of with the Whole Hog. Shoestring fries, baked beans, and mac and cheese were on point and if i had to do it all over again I probably wouldnt have gotten the pulled pork and asked for more brisket instead."

"If there is one thing Bobby knows how to do, that is how to que! Second time visiting this place and first time in a year. This visit made me wonder why I gave up meat for almost a year of my life. I had the Jumbo BBQ Potato topped with brisket and a side of Mac n Cheese and it was phenomenal! I can't remember the last time I had a meal this enjoyable and delicious where I savored every bite. The brisket was cooked perfectly, little to no fat, juicy, tender, and flavorful. The barbeque sauce was full of flavor, not too thin, not too thick, and it had the perfect amount of tang to it. The Mac n Cheese was full of cheesy flavor. It went really well when paired with the barbeque sauce. I poured a little over the Mac n Cheese to give it a little extra flavor.
