"Bobby Q's entrance off 27th Avenue is subtle and in a quiet area and one of the first things you notice pulling into their lot through the small driveway flanked by bushes is that the place (and its lot) is huge.  It's obvious from its construction, that this building has been here a long time and the massively tall trees in the parking lot confirm that.  I actually parked in an ""adjacent"" lot next to the main one and had a decent walk to the restaurant's entrance around the corner.  The much larger bar facing the lot is NOT the entrance to go through to access the restaurant.

Before meeting my date here, I took a look at the menu and had a mild sticker shock.  The prices are not unreasonable for a Valley restaurant; but being that we usually eat in $ or $$- restaurants, it was quite a bit more than what I'm used to.  The important question, however, wasn't whether the prices were ""high"", but whether food quantity and quality justified them.

We started out with drinks.  I had the Strawberry q Lada ($9.00), which was quite delicious, with the strawberry and piña colada blending very well together.  While waiting for dinner, they also brought cornbread for each of us with butter, which was also quite good, though had it been hot instead of lukewarm,it  would have been excellent.

My date ordered the half baby back ribs with cole slaw and baked potato.  In her case, this was very much worth the $20.00 ... and I frankly can't imagine what the ""whole"" for $6.00 more would have been like!  For out came what I can only describe as half of the brontosaurus ribs they used to dump on Fred Flintstone's car; an overflowing bowl of cole slaw and a potato almost as big as the half-ribs.  I ordered the ""smoasted"" half chicken and can only say, that presentation is everything.  It didn't seem close to half a chicken to me; but since it was served in cut up pieces and on a large plate, that might be the reason why I thought otherwise.  For sides, I had the fully stuffed baked potato (still huge) and the grilled vegetables, which, I can honestly say, should have been double the amount while the potato could've been half the size.  Since my date picked out the restaurant, it was obvious it was a favorite place for her and her husband.  As the ""newbie"", I was very impressed with the taste and while my plate didn't seem to be overflowing like hers, it was more than enough and worth the price.  Before tip, my tab came out to $27.08, including tax.

Service is prompt, friendly and attentive (perhaps a bit too attentive, when you're trying to talk).  Interestingly enough, once the credit card was run, the waitress, who had constantly been checking on us throughout the meal, left us to talk in peace with only an occasional server interrupting to see if we wanted more water or Diet Coke.  Though the restaurant is nowhere near as big as the annexed bar, it is pretty roomy with dark, wood colors and a very high ceiling.  

DIABETIC ALERT:
------------------------

A glance at the menu will tell you that this place is pork and beef heavy.  There are only two chicken dishes and its obvious by what comes out, that chicken is not their specialty.  A diabetic will have a very hard time eating ""healthy"" here.  The more serious you are about watching what you eat, the more problems you're going to have navigating the menu.  This place should more likely be considered ""a-once-in-a-very-long-while"" treat.  Looking around tonight, most of the patrons had waist sizes that wouldn't surprise anyone coming here.  For the most part, only the wait staff was thin/proportionate, though not always.  While the food is very good, the staff hospitable and the atmosphere welcoming, this restaurant would probably elicit a big frown on your doctor's face, if he knew you came here ... and probably give HIM a heart attack, if he heard you came here regularly."
"Woo hoo! A solid five stars for some of the best BBQ I've had.  I've had my fair share of great BBQ experiences from all four corners of the US, including states and cities traditionally known for this great American dish.  I have to say that what I had at Bobby Q knocked it out of the park.

I had the two-meat combo comprising of baby backs and brisket.  According to my server, these two are ""the ones that keeps the lights on"" for the restaurant.  I totally see why.  Their meals are smoked in house for about a full day.  Combined with their special rubs, not only does this impart a great taste but the meats were some of the most tender and moist I've had.  The brisket was melt in your mouth tender while the pork ribs fell off the bone with little effort.  The BBQ sauce used was just right - not too overpowering the taste of the meat, not too sweet or ""ketchupy"".  Even the sides of broccolini and roasted brussel sprouts were spot on and complimented the entrees well..

I lucked out and came just before Happy Hour was done so I took advantage and ordered a couple of appys.  The buffalo cauliflower was exceptional (gotta try making this at home!) as was the beef brisket tacos.

I have to say that the service was great.  All of the staff, from the hostess, to my server, to the manager, Joanne, were friendly and helpful. 

Easily one of the best for BBQ I've had."
"Went here for a meetup group event.   First off, I would like to say, if I was grading the cornbread, the mac and cheese and the mashed potato sides, I would give them a resounding five stars.   The service, I would give five stars as well.   It's the BBQ that I would give more like a two or three stars, hence, the three stars since that's probably what the place is known for.

There was probably about 20 of us.   We had two servers, which they were organized and kept things moving along.   Drinks came out in a timely fashion as well as the warm cornbread and butter, which I could have just made a meal from that!

I love pork ribs, as you can probably tell from my prior BBQ reviews.   We could either order a half or a full.   I figured, since I was filling up on the cornbread anyway, I could take most of it home and ordered the full rack.   I asked which was leaner, which our server stated it was the baby back.   I don't want all that pork fat.  

The ribs were, mehhhhh, okay.   A bit on the dry side; yes, falling off the bone, but it just lacked that bbq, smoky flavor that I am used to.   The sauce wasn't all that tantalizing either.

Now, the mac and cheese and the mashed taters, that was another thing.   I don't know what kind of cheese it is, but it was creamy and plenty of cheese.   The mashed taters had the skin, which I like, and was quite tasty as well.

I ordered a manhattan, which was good.   It's just that I think someone drank half of it before I got it since the glass was partially filled.   I was wondering what happened to the rest of it.

Would I return?   I would for everything except the Q.    I didn't care for the dryness of the meat and the blandness of the flavoring."

"Finally tried this place after passing it everyday. We went on a Friday night at 8:00 and we still had a 20 minute wait. While we waited we sat in the bar and had a cocktail. Once we got seated by the rotisserie in the back the server asked if we had ever been there. Too which we both said no. Then she asked if we had ever been there while it was Bobby McGee's which I had since I grew up in the area and that was the place to go back in the 80's/90's for a fun and nice dinner. She said it's actually ran by the same owners he just sold it to a corporate company. I must say the decor was much better than it was back when it was Bobby's McGee's that's for sure. The server went to describe some signature dishes and cocktails. She was great! 

We had the Pulled BBQ Chicken Sandwich (which was very good) with a side of their Mac n Cheese and also had the Wedge Salad, and two more sides of Mac n Cheese (cuz I wasn't going to share my mac n cheese) and then I had another side of the roasted corn. While everything was great the corn wasn't so great. They take it off the cob for you which is fine but the corn was a bit soggy and over cooked. I wanted my corn to have a bit of crunch to it still. It had nothing. The Wedge salad was awesome. Perfect amount of Blue Cheese Crumbles, Bacon, Tomatoes...very tasty. Much to our surprise they give everyone a Thank-U bag of mini donuts that were so good! 

Overall Bobby Q's was very good and we will for sure be back soon."

"Ok I have to start off that I was initially going to give Bobby Q 3 stars until my wife filled out a Review and was responded promptly by the manager offering his apologies and a quick resolution. I was very impressed and changed my review to a 4. 

Ill start off with the decor of the restaurant. I really liked it and felt welcomed. It felt like a more upscale BBQ joint. 

We first ordered the Q rolls. These were simply amazing! They are brisket wrapped in tortilla then deep fried and accompanied by BBQ sauce and a chipotle mayo. 

We also got homemade corn bread while we waited for our entrée
. 
We then had a 3 meat combo.  We choose pork, brisket, and sausage. When it came to the actual BBQ I thought it was good, but not blown away great. I thought the sausage was over smoked and I'm not a fan of chopped brisket. I like my brisket cut into long pieces. The pulled pork was solid but again nothing blew me away.  I liked the man n cheese but honestly thought the garlic mash pataoes were a lil tasteless though. I added a lot of pepper to give them some taste. 

Overall Bobby's was a great place to eat. The service was outstanding, our server was Shay. The Q rolls were amazing and the food was solid. I really liked the personal customer service after my wife's review. So the only thing keeping me from a 5 star rating is the actual BBQ. "Had a great birthday dinner at Bobby Q's with my parents. "We had an incredible experience last night. My wife and I were motivated to go because of Yelp. I mean  there are an insane amount of 5 star reviews on this ""top 100"" restaurant. To summarize, the hype is real. This is a must try.

The food was amazing. Ordered the top sirloin cooked medium and ribs, with Mac and cheese, baked potato, and roasted corn for sides. They give you cornbread to start. 

Sirloin steak- perfectly aged, cooked, seasoned, and tender. FWIW, it rivals a lot of high end steakhouses. 

Ribs- right amount of sauce, balanced, not too tangy or sweet and it's slow cooked. The meat falls right off the bone.

Special mention on the Roasted corn and cornbread - the roasted corn was my favorite side. It came precut in a bowl,  not on the cob. But you could tell the corn was roasted from the appearance. naturally sweet and savory with minimal seasoning. The corn bread is out of this world. I have never had cornbread like this ever.  it's different in a very good way!

What had really made our visit special however was our server, Travis. We told him it was our first time and despite how busy it was he was extremely helpful, patient and friendly.  Travis really demonstrated his passion for his restaurant. He gave us a brief history on the Bobby Qs, made  great recommendations and even convinced us to try the dessert even though we were full. We would've regretted missing the out on the banana pie because it was amazing!

Will be back for sure. Might even have to move to Phoenix."

"Review from a visit on 9/2/16, just getting around to it.  Found Bobby Q based on Yelp reviews.  We were in town to visit my son that just started at GCU.

As we walked up I was a little surprised at how dressed many of the people were.  They looked like they were going out clubbing.  Turns out, there is a night club/bar attached to the restaurant.  Seems many of the club goers had dinner then moved on to the club.  The club in no way ruins the dinner experience and you can never hear the music or even know the club is there.  The food was very good and the service was excellent.  We were a party of 9 and we were assigned 2 waiters.

If you are Gluten Free all of their sauces are GF and they have a GF menu.  Only bummer is that they don't have a GF version of their cornbread.  The meats are tasty, tender and juicy.  The sides are all generous portions and good.  All 9 people got different items and no one was disappointed.  For the non-meat eaters there was a good selection of seafood.  I will return on my next visit to AZ as good bbq is not always easy to find."
Nothing unique to say. Just great food with very good service. I usually get the fried chicken which is delicious.  The sides are also great. Every time we've been there with either a big group or just two or three everything is quick and courteous. It's very crowded on the weekend. Making reservations is a good idea.
Simply amazing. Server was really friendly and made us feel welcome. The Q rolls were delicious and so were the ribs.
"Wow...this restaurant is amazing. We were visiting from California and were looking for some good BBQ. We found this place on yelp, read the views, and decided to check it out.  The service was great, the waiters were friendly, thoughtful and very knowledgeable, and really went the extra mile in providing my large group with great customer service. 

The food was spectacular, made to order, served hot, and good portions. The ambiance was good as well, exhibiting warmth within a family-friendly atmosphere. 

The only downside to our experience was that we live in California, so we could only visit Bobby Q's when we travel to AZ.

For those wanting some of the best barbeque in the United States, try this place out!"

"Good food. I had the ribeye, it was delicious. The mac 'n cheese was very good, not mushy at all: just right. The corn was good, too good to be healthy (i.e. sweet and buttery).

My experience with the service was more of a mixed bag. I was waiting 10 mins before the waiter came. It was a minor thing but the manager put the appetizer on the house. Also I had ordered my steak medium-rare but the steak was closer to medium-well (the difference is the blood, medium-rare is a little bloody, medium is not). I mentioned it to the waiter and the manager put the steak on the house. Honestly, the steak was so good I did't care.

I would go again. 5 stars for the food, 4 stars for the service, and an extra star for effort."
"Best BBQ joint in the valley. The Q-Rolls were fantastic, I almost wish I had just gotten a couple orders of those for my meal. I split the choose two-meats (baby back ribs and beef brisket) and two sides (mac and cheese and corn) with my date which was a great deal and quite delicious."

"Omg some of the best food I have had in a long time. We ordered the Q rolls as an appitizer. This is basically a brisket egg roll, these were yummy. I ordered the 12 oz. Top sirloin,  I was a little disappointed that it was not quite the way I order it. The mac and cheese was just awesome. I dare say it was almost better than my dads. "Love this place!! The pulled pork and the brisket are above average. That said, I couldn't find a smoke ring on the brisket. The sweet sauce is very good. The ""tangy"" is excellent. IMHO, the best sides are the Ranch Beans and the Mac n Cheese.... 

But, the St Louis Ribs are the reason to eat at Bobby-Q!! These baby back ribs are succulent and the meat falls right off the bone. They have the right balance between rub and sauce. The sweet and tangy flavors are what barbecue is supposed to be. I couldn't find the smoke ring under the rub and the heavy sauce. Sauce-less is not an option. Order an extra cup of the tangy sauce...

The cornbread is moist; a remarkable achievement since most places it's dry as a bone. Bobby-Q's cornbread is excellent and complimentary (Hint, hint to those from Nebraska who believe in charging for dinky little miniature cupcake-sized portions). It's even better with the whipped butter and/or honey on top...

Our waitress was knowledgeable and her service was top-notch. Our iced tea glasses were NEVER empty and she refilled the corn bread basket TWICE. (Hint, hint Nebraska...)

My only REAL complaint is the handicapped parking situation. The handicapped parking spaces are a couple hundred feet from the front door. I try to park out back near the ""Take-Out"" door. There are six spaces there. These spaces are approx 75 ft from the dining room doors, but are NOT reserved for the handicapped."
"Totally impressed by this place! We stopped from out of town as we were passing through Phoenix. First off, the staff is fantastic. So friendly, super responsive, and kind. So kind. I've never been a huge lover of BBQ but after eating here, I can't wait to come back! The brisket and pulled pork.... YUMM. The coleslaw is perfect, and the baked potatoes are so perfectly loaded. My boys thought it was very interesting that there was ice in the urinals.... ha ha. The manager even took the time to explain the reason for this!
Seriously, I can see why this place is rated so high. I can't wait to come back!"
"The only thing better than this delicious food was the service! We missed our flight in Phoenix and came here to visit a friend for dinner feeling kind of bummed about the flight. Kristin took amazing care of us and was super sweet! If you're going to eat here, make sure you request her!"
"As we went around the turn around to get to the restaurant the sweet bbq aromas hit our noses and we hoped the taste would match it...it did. The food was amazing!!

My son opted for a cheeseburger and fries. My mother and I split a 2 meat platter. Baby back ribs, pulled pork, Mac n cheese, grilled veggies, and cornbread. The cornbread was served like an appetizer and had a sweet flavor and was very soft. The ribs were fall off the bone amazing and the pulled pork was to die for. We probably did not even need the sides but the Mac and cheese was thick and cheesy. The grilled veggies could have used a little seasoning but they were still pretty good. Oh let me not forget about sauce. It was sweet but not too sweet. We even tried the spicy which I don't think had a single hot element!!! I would definitely go back here!!"

"First time at Bobby Q tonight. Read about it on MSN as one of the top 10 steakhouses in America. 

We arrived at 7:30 on a Saturday evening at t the place was hopping. We were seated right away tho. Our server, Amber, greeted us quickly. We were brought menus and cornbread as we made our drink orders. 

For entrées we ordered the Ribeye with baked potato and side salad and I got the three meat combo. I ordered Brisket, Baby Back Ribs and a Hot Link. My sides were Mac N Cheese and Pecan Cole Slaw. It all came to $80 plus tip with two glasses of wine.

The entrees were good. The ribeye was cooked perfectly, had minimal gristle and was flavorful. The ribs were very tender. The brisket was good but personally I don't like BBQ sauce on my brisket but that's the way it came. The hot link had no snap but was tasty. 

The Mac n cheese was excellent but the slaw was very boring. Why five stars?  Good food, excellent service and decent value."

"I found this place with Yelp and thought I would give it a try.

Our server was amazing and I regret not getting her name. She was very attentive and I appreciated her questions. She asked if we were looking to rush in and out. We ordered our food I went with the St. Louis ribs and the Mac and Cheese as my side.

We had our food within 10 minutes.

The ribs were very tender and had a great taste. We were offered extra BBQ sauce which I enjoyed the flavor.

I was really surprised by the Mac and cheese. It was very good and my favorite part of my meal.

We stayed at our table for an hour and forty-five minutes.

"Any one who gives this place more than 3 stars is taste bud deficient. Lesson #1: good BBQ has some smoke to the meat (this place has NO smoky flavor to their meat)
Lesson #2: there was no smoke ring that denote it spent any time cooking low and slow like they advertise. 
Lesson #3: the meat fell of the bone (Great BBQ is removed from the bone, not fall off the bone. Kansas City BBQ Society rules)
I suspect that the baby back ribs I was served were first boiled, then placed on the grill right before it was slathered with raunchy sauce.
The only reason it got 2 stars was because our waitress was fabulous, giving great service with nice atmospheres."

"Ok, I read all the reviews and I hate to swim against the current, my experience just wasn't that great. 1st off the restaurant is super loud, so not a great place to have a conversation, 2nd, I ordered the Brisket and I Love Brisket, but I didn't love it here. I got a huge helping of gelatinous cartilage and fat, and a small helping of actual meat. Now burnt ends are again one of my favorites, but there really weren't any of those dry crunchy ends packed with flavor one would expect. And the small amount of what i did actually eat consisted of 3 unflavorful bites. Lacking any real smoke flavor or even basic seasoning. In my opinion they hope their bbq sauce will give you the flavor the meat is desperately needing. The wait staff where great and the mac nd cheese was super creamy. Other then that, they would have rated a 2. Eat and live well my friends."

"My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner last night. It was our first time here, but we wanted to try a new place and after seeing the reviews (and how many reviews) we had to try it. We were both beyond impressed. There wasn't a wait since it was a Monday night, but I could see it being packed on a weekend. 

We ordered the Q Rolls appetizer and each got a cocktail. My boyfriend said his tasted a little weak but overall they were both very tasty and mine was not weak. I had the Peach Tea and I can't recall what his was. The Q Rolls appetizer was absolutely amazing. I can't recommend that enough.

For the entree, we decided to go with Whole Hog Heaven because we had no idea how huge it was. We got baby back ribs, beef ribs, rotisserie chicken, beef brisket, mashed potatoes, mac n' cheese, and shoestring fries. 

Right after we ordered, two pieces of cornbread came out with a side of butter. This was SO delicious. Shortly after, our meal came out. Let me say again how HUGE this was. I tried to pick up a piece of brisket with a fork and it was so tender I couldn't pick up the whole piece at once. I specifically wanted the baby back ribs originally as they're my favorite and they were easily the best I've ever had. Meaty and tender with an amazing taste. I suggest asking for some extra BBQ sauce for the table but the meats are delicious with or without it. 

There was so much extra that we both have enough for lunch and probably even dinner tonight. I'll be eating lunch soon and can't wait! 

They brought out a piece of ice cream cake for my birthday (vanilla ice cream with chocolate cake and a walnut fudge icing). Delicious but I was too stuffed to eat more than a few bites of it. 

After we paid, they brought us a little bag of these mini cinnamon sugar donuts which I tried this morning with breakfast. Very tasty especially considering they were next-day donuts. 

The service was great throughout the whole meal. Unfortunately I forgot the server's name but she was quick and attentive. Needless to say, we were very pleased and can't wait to go back."
Barbecue is the best. Everything here is good. Mac and cheese here is my favorite! Love the corn bread too...

"If anyone ever needs a great place to come for lunch (or even impress clients who don't mind getting their fingers messy), then come to Bobby Qs. Aside from the great BBQ, they also offer daily lunch specials. My favorite is the Wednesday Prime Rib sandwich special which may well be the best sandwich I have ever had. I also recommend the Monday Chicken Club sandwich and the Thursday spicy meatloaf. They also have a Tuesday ""Qban"" (Cuban) sandwich and a Friday fish special. Pretty easy access too, right off the I-17. Just get off at either Northern, then head north on 27th av, or at Dunlap, then head back south on the I-17 frontage road. All I ask is that if you come on Wednesday, please leave a prime rib sandwich for me!"

"To give a brief background, my fiancé and I just moved to the valley from Tennessee where BBQ and southern cookin' is done right. I had read a lot of great reviews about this place and since my soon-to-be hubby is a self-proclaimed BBQ connoisseur, I decided to take him here as a spontaneous mid-week treat.

It's a pretty neat location.. They definitely  nailed down-home, country vibe that they were going for. 

I wouldn't say the food was sub par by any means, but it didn't knock our socks off like the authentic, southern eats we're accustomed to. Sweet tea was off, mild BBQ sauce was WAY to sweet. Meat was okay, but nothing amazing. Service was decent. Mac n cheese was money. 

My guess is that the people who typically  eat here haven't lived in the South where this type of food is an absolute art form.

This location isn't particularly close to where we live so probably won't be back anytime soon but we are curious to try out Little Miss next!"

"First time at Bobby Qs! Four of us went for a birthday dinner last . We had the baby backs, sirloin steak and prime rib. Also baked potatoes, coleslaw and corn (buttery roasted corn shaved off the cob). And of course the corn bread and donuts. Everything was DELICIOUS! I was skeptical about getting the prime rib because at many places it can be really fatty and you end up not getting much meat. Not here! The waiter (Josh) assured me it was a lean cut of meat, and it was! Very tender and flavorful. The steaks were perfectly cooked and the ribs were tender with not too much sauce. (The ribs were not ""mush"" like other reviewers have said.) They also treated us to a piece of yummy banana cream pie as a birthday treat (the crust was thick and nutty) - tastefully presented with no annoying restaurant staff choir. It was very nice. 

All that being said, the outside of the building and the inside don't match. We used to go to Bobby McGees so I did sort of expect the old Bobby McGees atmosphere - with old bathtubs and mismatched furniture... it was a goofy, fun place back in the day. Now the interior is just nice. Not that that's bad. 

Oh, and we mentioned Yelp and got a 10% discount. :)"

"It is hard to find a place with good food and good service but Bobby Q delivers both. Clara was our server and she was possibly the best waitress we ever had anywhere. We had the Q-rolls which were like large taquitos with the tenderest brisket inside.   You get 6 and it is large enough for a meal. We also shared the lunch combo plate with baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs, and pulled chicken. It is obvious they don't boil their ribs like other places. They claim to slow smoke them for at least 18 hours and I believe it. We had the Mac and cheese for a side and it was creamy and the noodles were just right and not mushy. The only thing I wasn't thrilled with was the banana cream pie. It was tasty and the crust was delicious, but the consistency was odd. I highly recommend this place for BBQ."

I had all the symptoms of salmonella poisoning and fortunately only suffered for two days. I called for two days and spoke to two different on duty managers who both told me the general manager would give me a call when he came in so we could discuss my situation. I ordered the 3-meat combo, for only $3 more than the 2-meat...great value!  I weigh in at 315lbs...and I didn't even GET to the 3rd meat - way too full. I got brisket as one of the meats - honestly, tasted like it was right off the smoker...that's NEVER the case in BBQ joints, it's always dry and flavorless by the time it gets to the table - not here folks, may as well been eating it right from the pit. Very impressive. 

Sides: hats off to the Chef, FINALLY...a BBQ place that has crafted their sides to be as good as their meats. And a special mention...the mac & cheese had great flavor! I also got the corn...tremendous. Can't wait to come back to try the other sides...

Energetic atmosphere, great staff, and tremendous food at a good value.

"When your first thought when writing a review is to acknowledge that you're craving for a fix... of whatever you're reviewing, it would definitely serve others well to give that place a try.

My wife and I were ecstatic to find a highly rated BBQ joint in the Phoenix area and decided to embark on a meat-laden adventure (get your head out of the gutter). As we drove closer and closer, we were a little hesitant about the area. Please forgive me for sounding like a snooty Scottsdale-dwelling yuppie. 

However, we could not have been more pleasantly surprised as we edged into the parking lot to discover a very lovely atmosphere. The lit patio and friendly service made Bobby Q a big winner in our book, but the true testament in regards to whether or not this would be an oft-visited establishment or a distant memory of a trek into questionable territory, both geographically and culinarily.

We were both very pleased with the baby back ribs. The ribs were tender, moist, and were almost  the fall-off-the-bone variety. The cornbread was fantastic. Honestly, I'm going to have to stop writing so that I can stop salivating.

Recommendation: If you are searching for a great BBQ joint in Phoenix, want a great atmosphere (try the patio when the weather is nice!), need great service, and most of all want to tear into some juicy meat, give Bobby Q a try!"

"First time here. I came with my son & didn't know what to expect. Being that it's location is right off the I-17 we'd pass Bobby Q's many times & often thought it was a dive due to its location. I requested a booth as I wanted to enjoy mother/son conversation over a nice dinner. The restaurant's interior is a rustic western theme with a bar in the middle, dining patio in front & separate dancing lounge connected to the back.  Everything was very clean and orderly like a well oiled machine. Our server was professional, friendly and quick. My son ordered the hamburger with cheddar cheese from the regular menu which came with shoestring fries & I ordered the Rib Eye with roasted corn and mashed potatoes. "I was super excited to try this place because I always heard good things about it, but was actually very disappointed during my visit. This place is jam packed on a Friday and Saturday night, but I will say their service is pretty responsive and fast to get the food out. I only got salad so I'm not going to get into the food part since it will be biased. However, the night got turned upside down when I initially got my check and saw they charged me 15 dollars for a 12 dollar salad! Side note, this place is way pricier than I expected a BBQ place would be. Anyways, I told the gentleman about the salad upcharge and he seemed like he didn't believe I was overcharged and he was like "" let's look through the menu together."" Hello I'm not a little kid, you don't need to be condescending. Anyways, he saw that I was correct on the price and he changed it, blaming their system for generating that amount. I wonder how many people got overcharged for that salad without anyone saying something?? I still wonder if they even updated their system... anyways, not a huge issue until I got overcharged at the club/bar portion AGAIN ON THE SAME NIGHT!! This is when my nostrils began to blow smoke out of them... we went into the club which basically to get in you have to sign your name on a paper, get your picture taken, your photo id is scanned, and donate an arm and a leg(jk about that part), never seen that in my life, so strict for such a run down club... then we go to the pay section and find out it's 12 dollar coverage fee!! For a ghetto club, are you kidding me... I give them my card, and they act all quiet and don't tell me anything, all of a sudden they don't give my card back the guy escorts me downstairs without informing me what was going on... I was low key thinking I was going to be an interrogation room not knowing what I possibly could have done wrong. He still has my card in his hand and gives it to the bartender and then leaves still saying nothing to me. Worst security escorter ever! Then I get my card back from the bartender and I ask what is going on and he tells me that they don't take card at the front so I had to go down to the bar to pay the cover... I then look at my check and find out I was charged 30 dollars (15 each) for the cover when I'm told it was 12 each at the front!! The bartender apologizes and says he will get us a drink on the house... FYI the drink was the worst crap I've ever had in my life... at this point I wanted out and talked to security about my experience.. he says that I probably won't get a refund but I can go talk to the general manager. Literally the general manager finds out we want a refund(after only being there for 5 minutes) and he doesn't even bat an eye before saying of course, give these girls a refund. I want to thank him for being an intelligent person, but I hate to say that his staff are complete dim wits who should find a new job or receive better training on how to treat people."
"I wanted to love this place, after seeing the reviews.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing.  Perhaps a steak is not what one orders at a bbq place.  

Staff was great.
Bob himself seemed respected by his team.
I loved the atmosphere.
Baked beans were really good.  Great texture.  Not just a soggy mess.
Onion strings were perfect.

The top sirloin I got was very tough, strings of gristle running through it, making it even harder to cut.
I didn't order the filet because I wanted more flavor than a filet usually provides.  The flavor of the sirloin was lack luster.  A good grill flavor but not much to it.
It was cooked perfectly. 

They did so much right but for a bbq place with not so great steak, I really want to go with 3.5 stars.

I'll be back to try the ribs and brisket.  I have high hopes that I will be updating my rating."

I'm sure it's been said nearly a thousand times before but this may very well be the best bbq in AZ. I'm a native Texan and used to eating some good Texas bbq but this is something to write home about. Jake our waiter states that they smoke their meats for 18 hours. The food tasted every bit like they did. I could really taste the smoke flavor with the sausage which they filleted open to soak up the flavor. I can tell you that it tastes like they use pecan and mesquite wood for smoking. I've passed this place thousands of times and smelled the fresh wood smoking and my only regret is not coming here any sooner. If you're bringing a group make sure to try the whole hog heaven. It's more than enough food for three people. The food was every bit worth the price!

"Let me just say that I am not a BBQ kind of girl. My husband is a BBQ fiend so I tend to make some concessions for him. Bobby Q's was one of those concessions. Thank goodness for that because I love this place. Luckily for me, there are things here I would eat such as the grilled salmon ($17) and chimichurri shrimp ($16). And the sides, good heavens, the sides are so damn good. The only ones I ever get are the sweet, buttery corn and the mac and cheese. Neither are healthy (the corn is extremely buttery) and the mac and cheese is extremely gooey...just the way it should be! I am a sucker for a good mac and cheese and then when you factor in the best corn bread I have EVER eaten, I am a goner. Good lord, you would think I am hungry the way I am writing this review but I promise I am writing this on a full stomach. No, but seriously, if you like corn bread, you have to try Bobby Q's corn bread. It's ridiculous. Then at the end of the meal, they give you these sugary donuts (the granulated sugar) that just top off a great meal. If you go on Sundays, try the Hog Heaven. For $29, you can feed 3-4 people. It has pulled pork, beef brisket, baby-backed ribs, bbq chicken, two sides, and corn bread. I do think the sides are not enough for four people compared to the amount of meat you get. We ordered it last night and had enough meat for 5 people but enough sides for only 2 people. They did give us 6 pieces of corn bread, though. Either way, it is a GREAT deal. 

The interior is very nice with dim lighting for a possibly romantic feel. It seems kid-friendly and we haven't had any issues bringing our almost 3 year old here. We have also always had good service. The prices are on the higher end but as I mentioned the Hog Heaven on Sundays is a very reasonable deal when eating out. Hmmm, I think another visit this week is in order...."

"The atmosphere is unique, unlike other bar-b-que places I've been to. The patio is much like a garden patio at a home with brick walls and plants high enough to block the traffic / side street noises.  The indoors has a rustic, yet, elligant patio feel to it with the brick walls and rustic wood ceilings.  The furniture is again, more of a patio feel than a typical bar-b-que restaurant.  The noise level was not too loud that you couldn't hear people at your own table. 

The food was wonderful! Although my husband said their burger was too greasy, that was the only downfall.  My brother and I had the St. Louis ribs.  The way they caramelize the bar-b-que sauce on the ribs is great. They aren't runny with sauce dripping down your hand. The rib meat falls off the bone and easy enough to eat with a fork or picking it up. 

The sides were great. I had the macaroni and cheese which was definitely homemade. Not runny and not too dry. The cheese flavor was not too strong either. 

 I would  be prepared to wait a bit for a table because they appeared to always be busy. Overall, I really enjoyed this place and would go back again!"

"I want to start off by saying, this is the BEST BBQ place I've ever had. The ratings and the reviews are all true. The best! My friend and I were in Phoenix for the weekend, and as soon as we checked in our hotel, we both were hungry and graving some BBQ. I personally was not expecting any good BBQ places nearby, we almost settled with a mediocre place at the Westgate shopping center! Glad my friend stumbled upon Bobby Q's. With over 1000+ reviews and still holding a 4.5 average rating, I came in with high expectations. 

My first thought when arriving was this place was pretty hidden, there is plenty of parking, the restaurant is big, and best yet, it smelled great from outside already! We were a little worried it was going to be busy and would have to wait a bit for lunch because of its popularity, but we got greeted and were seated right away! 

Our server Hunter greeted soon after and introduced himself and told us about Bobby Q and now they smoke their meats. He was extremely helpful and friendly and checks in on us frequently since he knew this was our first time. My friend and I each got the or own 3 meat combo which was only $25 and came with 2 sides! I chose the brisket, baby back ribs, and pulled pork with Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. We also ordered their blonde ale beer, which was good refresher. 

We waited for our food, and were given corn bread. Which were amazing!! We had to stop ourselves before we got full from them. Our food came quicker than expected, and we were not disappointed. There was definitely more food than I was expecting. There was going to be leftovers for sure. Having the first bit was heaven and knew immediately this must've been the best BBQ I've ever had. Way better than the Wood Ranch here for sure. My favorite was the spicy BBQ that our server Hunter gave us. It had a little kick without it being to spicy. My friend and I enjoyed our plans until we were too full, which we barely ate half our plates. We were more than happy to have it for leftover dinner. 

Before leaving, Hunter gave us complimentary donuts, which were a great touch, but we were way to full to have any, so added it on to our leftover bag. 

Overall, this place was delicious! Service and food was excellent!  I will definitely have to stop by here when I come back to Phoenix."

The manager checked in and asked how we were enjoying our meal. Even the hostess gave us good information about where to sit. 

Venue: great lighting, comfortable seating, roomy (but not too much) tables and well managed noise level. All good.

"Anytime is a good time for barbecue. The smell of burning wood, the sweet thick or vinegary sauces and meat that just fall off the bone -- these elements have mass appeal to my senses.

So it's probably no surprise that I've been to most Valley smokehouses to check out their goods.

My latest exploration, Bobby-Q, came after a day of bargain hunting at a clearance outlet at Metrocenter. So much shopping can work up an appetite, and you'll need an appetite since the prices at Bobby-Q are low and the portions are large.

The location might be familiar to many longtime Phoenicians -- it was Bobby McGee's until about five years ago. I have many fond memories eating there with my family as a kid.

While the building got a $3 million dollar makeover, the charm and coziness is intact. It's sort of a cowboy chic with dim lighting, stained concrete floors and a tin ceiling. The seating is comfortable and the service friendly and efficient. If you're in a hurry, you can call ahead; there is a separate entrance for to-go orders.

Everything on the menu is made in house, from the barbecue sauce to the fluffy corn bread. Being an avid home cook I can appreciate these extra steps.

Always wanting to try something new, the Q-Rolls ($7.50) are a take on a Mexican flauta. Filled and rolled with smoked beef brisket and then deep-fried to a golden brown, these looked better than they tasted. The roll's open ends allowed for far too much oil to penetrate the meaty interior, which ended up a tasteless crunch.

A steakhouse classic, the Wedge Salad ($5), is made with a quarter of crisp head lettuce, sprinkled with smoked bacon, chopped tomatoes and bleu cheese crumbles. I can never resist the power of blue cheese and bacon.

The menu includes entree-sized salads, sandwiches and steaks, but my focus was on smoked meats. You can order two or three meat platters, but I opted for the Whole Hog ($36), a choice of two ribs, two meats and three sides.

When the plate arrived, my eyes widened. Huge slabs of Baby Back Ribs and St. Louis-Style Ribs were framed by piles of pulled pork and beef brisket, it's quite the mother lode of meat, so be prepared to share with others.

Going straight to the ribs, I grabbed a bone and it immediately separated from the rib meat. The meat was melt-in-your -mouth tender, and rightly so; they cook their meats low and slow for about 20 hours.

With all of the meat loving going on, it's easy to forget the sides. The Mac 'n Cheese was creamy and gooey and was worth ordering again. Pecan Cole Slaw was good, but I especially liked the toasted pecans, hich provided a nice contrast. Roasted Corn comes topped with a few wheels of corn on the cob. I wish the entire dish were served this way, since the kernels were swimming in a pool of butter.

After finishing this feast, there couldn't possibly be room for Peach Cobbler ($6.50) or Mud Pie ($6.50). But it was a nice touch that the check was brought out with a small bag of hot fresh cinnamon and sugar-covered donuts."
"Great good, great service and a great atmosphere. Here for vacation from Toronto and this was by far the best meal so far!"
Great food!  Great service!  The portions are huge.  I highly recommend this place.  Make reservations though as it was very busy on a Friday night.
"We were visiting friends from Texas and were in desperate need of some legit BBQ.

Food - The Sunday family feast included 1/2 St. Louis ribs, 1/2 pound of brisket, 1/2 pound of pork and 1/2 of a chicken +2 sides and cornbread! All for $20 a person.

Things that REALLY stood out:
1) Q rolls were perfectly crispy rolls of yummy brisket!
2) Cornbread was unlike any other cornbread I've had
3) Chicken wasn't dry at all and had really good flavor!"

I have had lots of different versions of mac and cheese with my BBQ across the US. The food itself also warrants 5 stars. The meat was really tender and flavorful and the sauce was great. I'll definitely be back to try out other items."

"Don't know what all the hype is about this establishment but here's my feedback: First off my wife had the Ribeye entree I specifically told our waiter (a young fellow) no pink on the ribeye & to have whom ever is cooking/grilling the ribeye to cut the meat to verify there are no pink, but my wife received her uncut ribeye & she only ate what's not pink (1/2 of the ribeye). I was eager to try the beef ribs & again I told the young fellow easy BBQ sauce on them beef ribs because I wanted to taste the meat & the smoke flavor. To our surprise none of them were meant to our expectations. The beef ribs are fall of the bone but too much BBQ sauce on them ribs & I couldn't even taste the smoked meat. Ask any bbq enthusiast the taste are in the meat not the sauce. I rather stick with Dillons KC style beef ribs at Arrowhead location where you can taste the meat. This establishment is my first & last."
"I used to eat a lot of barbecue but I haven't had much since I stopped eating pork. The waiter had multiple alternatives for me, including beef ribs which are difficult to find. I decided on the country fried chicken, and was not disappointed. Cocktails were awesome. Each side plus the main meal was delicious and perfected. The wait staff was friendly and helpful, and the ambiance was lovely. I don't live in Arizona, but I would move here just for Bobby Q's!"
"Bobby Q's is a sensational venue to enjoy amazing BBQ. The brisket literally melts in your mouth and is always a favorite. Warm, scrumptious complimentary corn bread arrives to begin your meal. The extensive menu offers a vast variety of savory entrees from platters to sandwiches and salads and an excellent selection of side dishes. Be sure to try the roasted corn and the  macaroni and cheese. At the conclusion of your meal, they deliver a brown paper bag of freshly made warm mini sugar donuts! 

Maddie was our server this evening and she was delightful--very friendly, attentive, professional and offered great suggestions about popular menu items. She provided superb service. Thanks, Maddie, for your attention to detail and for excellent service! The manager actively greeted each table and checked to see that all patrons were enjoying their dining experience.

We made advance reservations (highly recommended) and were served promptly.  Great place for families.  A bit of an elevated noise level because this place is very popular among the locals--a hidden gem!"
I have now been here twice and both times the service was excellent along with the food. The only thing keeping me from 5 stars is they have rules on when they serve street tacos. I keep hearing great things about them and have wanted to try them but just can't seem to order them.
"This quite popular BBQ joint in North Phoenix is easy to miss off the freeway, but once you arrive you wondered how you could have ever missed it!  

This restaurant has a simple menu, fair prices, wonderful Happy Hour specials and FREE Cinnamon Sugar Donuts for all!!  (Get an extra bag to go!)

You can't go wrong with anything you order here.  All meats, chicken and fish too, are moist, tender, seasoned very well and are very filling.  My favorite side dishes there are the macaroni and cheese (da bomb!), Pecan Coleslaw (yes...Pecan!) and their shoestring French fries, with BBQ Sauce as a dip!  

That's all well and good, but what keeps me coming back is their BRISKET!!  Hot damn!  Lean, tender, juicy and addictive!!  You'll be dreaming of Bobby Q Brisket in your dreams that night!  Their Brisket, Ribs and PRIME RIB (ahhh) are the top three sellers at Bobby Q! 

They have a WONDERFUL lunch menu, but what I like is that they don't skimp on serving size for lunches.  You get a ton of meat and normal size side dish.  You just pay a few dollars less.  That's always good. 

Don't forget the FREE Cinnamon Sugar Donuts at the end of your meal.  Grab an extra bag of them as you leave.  I've also seen people grab a bag of them as they go in as well!  No one there will tell you that you will spoil your meal by doing that so have at it!"
"I just drove past Bobby-Q's and remembered that I've had a good experience with them.

The time was around Thanksgiving. They offer smoked turkeys that are pretty much ingenious. One, they're smoked - so literally half the cooking is done for you. I can't stand putting an entire raw bird in an oven and waiting for it to cook for 234 hours. Well, I've never really done that, because I think I wouldn't like it much, as I hate waiting while I watch people poke, prod, and baste a raw behemoth and then put it in the oven for 234 hours. 

This thing was done in I think 2 hours. 2 hours!!! Brilliant. And better yet - it tasted phenomenal. The spice rub was so complementary to the meat it needed no sauce to make it a tasty experience. 

And it wasn't cost-prohibitive. The only thing you really need to worry about is ordering one well enough ahead of time for your occasion."
"It's pretty clear from all the reviews, meat loving barbeque aficionados really like Bobby Q's. 

This review is for my fellow vegetarians who for some reason end up here.   Why you say, would a vegetarian even end up here? Well, for one, to keep peace in the family, for the sides, and for my fave salad, a wedge of iceberg lettuce ( I can hear some of your groans, ""iceberg lettuce!"" ""What is she talking about"") with house made chunky blue cheese dressing.  This dressing is the best I've ever had -  I usually get a pint or so to take home. The grilled vegies are consistently good as are the baked potatoes and the corn bread.  The mac and cheese is rather average.  Prices are reasonable - portions on the large size.

The little donuts they send you home with are a nice/sweet way to end the meal - but not worth the calories.  

The wait staff are fun, friendly, efficient - the camaraderie has a good feel to it."

"One of the best bbq restaurants that I have ever been to. There is always a long wait, but the staff was able to help us find a table at the patio. I think the patio is better than inside because it's spacious, and there are mist to cool the temperature off. We ordered Hog Heaven, fried onion rings and couple drinks for four of us, and we couldn't even finish all the food. 

Corn breads are delicious and just like the ones I had in North Carolina. It's not too sweet, outside of corn bread is a bit crispy and inside is soft. When you placed the butter on the top of corn bread, and the butter just melts right of away. This combination added extra flavor to corn breads. 

Whole Hog Heaven: beef ribs, pulled chicken, baby backs, prime briskets, mac & cheese, meshed potatoes, roasted corns. 

Man o Man, They are so delicious. briskets are moist and tender. you don't need to add any bbq sauce. Prime briskets are great to eat by itself. I like to eat mac & cheese after having briskets. M&C here are really good with a slide sweet taste in it. 

- Baby backs were cooked so well and the meat fell off the bones easily. 
- Pulled chicken was juicy and didn't have the dryness that chicken breasts usually have. 
- Beef rib is delicious and still attached to the bone, some people like it roasted so the meat would fall off easily. However, for me, I prefer to chew the bone. very yummy.

If you ever visit Phoenix, definitely stop by here and make reservation at least couple days ahead of time."

"YUM!!! I would recommend this place if you are in the Phoenix area. My co-worker and I heard nothing but good things about it, so we decided to check it out.

Atmosphere: The exterior is quite deceiving. It looks like an old, big shack. The interior is gigantic and cozy. It is clean and organized. There's a pretty bar area, a doughnut station, and lots of tables. They have a separate area with another bar that I think is used for private parties or probably weekend nights. There were some cool decorations on the walls all over the place.

Service: It was great!!! Our server was so knowledgeable. She was friendly and personable, and she had fantastic, flawless makeup! Lol. A manager came by our table to see how we were doing during our meal. It added a nice touch knowing that they cared.

Food: Delicious! Cornbread? Yes! I ordered the grilled shrimp with macaroni and corn. The shrimp was cooked to perfection! And the seasoning was great. It was also great on the corn. I probably could've just eaten corn as a full meal and been happy. Hehehe. The macaroni was delicious, but it was as good as my mother-in-law's. Lol. My co- worker really enjoyed her meal - pulled pork and coleslaw. We split a dessert - the mud pie, and it was good, but we were hoping it'd be on par with the rest of the food. It wasn't, but it didn't take away from the meal. The best was probably the doughnuts!!! They give out free mini doughnuts. They are fresh and sooo wonderful!!! Don't forget them on your way out!"

"Very solid experience!  This is a well put together restaurant.  Decor and ambience are very comfortable.  Place is very clean with a good energy.  Management is very visible and seem to spend a lot of time checking on there guests to ensure satisfaction.  

We had the the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  The fried chicken and gravy were excellent.  Good flavor all around and crispy crust on the chicken.  Chicken was moist and flavorful.  Gravy was also tasty and mashed potatoes were very good.  Mac and cheese was just ok. Not bad.  We also ordered the baby back ribs with a green salad and corn.  Baby back ribs were excellent fall off the bone, tender and juicy. The salad was very fresh, good size with tomatoes onions, cucumbers, croutons and homemade ranch dressing. Yum.  The only disappointment was the corn. It was mushy and swimming in greasy butter like sauce.  They need to change this one up.  Fresh corn on the cob with seasoned butter to the side would be a better option and a more worthy accompaniment to the rest of the delicious food.  

Service was spot on throughout, but getting check closed out was a bit slow, but not much to complain  about.  All in all a pretty great experience.  We'll be back and excited that they will have a new location soon at 32nd and Camelback!"

For dinner we split the three meat combo. We got St. Louis Ribs, Beef Brisket, and (Pulled) Pork. For our sides we chose grilled vegetables and the mac n cheese. OMG was it good. "I went here with my boyfriend. Our waiter was being trained, but he did an excellent job! I got the pulled pork sandwich (minus the bun) with shoestring fries. "An upscale BBQ place and very popular (reservations are recommended during dinner time)!  Nice decor, service was consistent, and an outstanding menu for BBQ lovers!  There is a bar with flat screen TVs and there are booths for couples at the bar area. Babyback ribs and beef ribs are made to perfection, lots of flavor, soft, and falls right off the bone.  Beef brisket was good too, sausage was ok.  A good selection of beverages, appetizers and sides as well...from mac&cheese to beans to cole slaw to grilled veggies. "Okay, hard for me to give 5 stars to a casual restaurant but I totally agree with the overall Yelp rating that this place is 4.5 stars for food.  First time visit and have been meaning to go for 10 months since moving to PHX.  I got the Baby back ribs, potato salad & grilled veggies.  Ribs were great with little fat or gristle.  Pot. salad is awesome.  Two of my friends had the fried chicken (boneless) with chicken gravy.  I kept poaching their chicken, mac cheese and mashed potatoes. Corn bread is tasty but crumbles too easily for me.  Desserts were good.  

Definitely will be going back this summer a few times to this place.  I was in NC on vacation two weeks ago and ate at two BBQ places and they pale in comparison."
"This place is amazing for BBQ or just coming in to have a drink.  I had the half slab ribs with skinny fries and beans. My colleague had the brisket with beans and coleslaw.  Service was friendly and the manager paid us a visit to see how we were enjoying our dinner.  I had their old fashion which wasn't amazing, but suitable.  The beans are great because they add chunks of brisket.  I'm a big fan of skinny fries too and they were good. They gave us some complimentary miniature cinnamon donuts which were addicting."
I love this place!!!!! Great pricing on Food! Wonderful costumer service and I love the experience I get when I'm there ! The food is amazing !!!!!
"Bobby Q is set back off the freeway in a slightly shady part of town, but don't let that deter you! The parking lot is covered in huge Eucalyptus trees so you can have shade on those hot summer days when you spend the next 1 to 2 hours of your life here haha. The BBQ here is delicious. The meat is moist and not overly wood tasting. I have had BBQ that had so much wood smoke cooked into it I was burping up the taste for the next 3 hours. Yuck. The potatoes are so good and the best part are the house made donuts in the brown baggies you get on your way out. He donuts are worth going here for alone yum! The staff is always attentive and it has a more upscale vibe. The outdoor area is shaded and has very tranquil water features so it is enjoyable to eat outside as well."
This place had great service along with amazing BBQ. We are very hard to please when it comes to BBQ coming from KC. Which has a lot of great BBQ!
"I noticed that the owner/manager of Bobby Q is frequently on this yelp page, so I really hope he gets to this review because I had a fantastic dinner at Bobby Q's Sunday night. The food, ambience, and everything was great, but what really set this place over the top for me was our server, Anthony.

So if the staff over at Bobby Q's ever reads this, I just want to let them know how impressed I was with Anthony's service(enough to toss him a $10 tip on a $20 check, it'd be more but a starving student can only give so much haha). He was not only attentive and helpful but was very friendly throughout the night. Coming by at the most opportune times to offer us water refills, extra sauce(warmed sauce, fancy!), and even suggested different items on the menu that he thought we'd like better(which we did!) Such a great guy and really made a huge difference in our dining experience.  So if you ever get the chance to stop by Bobby Q's, ask for Anthony and toss him a huge tip as a thank you after you have one of the greatest dining experiences of your life!  Haha.

All that aside, the food at Bobby Q's was great as well. We got the three meat combo with Beef Ribs(great), Baby back ribs(my personal favorite), and beef brisket(a tad bit dry, but still good) with Mac and cheese(amazing!) and shoestring fries(also good) as the sides. Everything was great, and the fact that we didn't have to wait an hour like at other BBQ places was another huge plus as well. The food came quick, was piping hot, and they even split it onto two plates for us because I was splitting the food.

At the end of the dinner, they gave us some cinnamon donuts to-go with our meal, which was the real cherry on top of everything. Loved this place, will definitely be bringing friends here for BBQ nights, and I could go on for days about the great service from Anthony."
"Worst service ever.  Manager has no manners

Like a particular restaurant I frequent.  The food is prepared properly (steak done as requested) and prices are reasonable."

Lunch time is the best time. love the wait staff! Good job you guys."
"I was traveling with my husband and after flight we decided to eat in Bobby Q.  We have some good restaurants back in Chicago and we enjoy many of them but I have to tell you that we did not expect this restaurant to have such a good food.  
We had full size fire roasted baby back ribs, roasted vegetables, baked potato and house salad.  Those ribs were so soft and BBQ sauce was amazing!!!
Even vegetables had a scent of the real fire and had a perfect tenderness. Our fully loaded potato was exquisite.  Just a perfect taste.  Salad- was a house salad. Good tasting but Nothing special about it.  
If they had mixed greens or spinach- It would be my favorite place.  Nevertheless I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone. 
Andrew and Elwira"
"We dined here last night for a family birthday celebration.  I've lived in the valley for 20 years but it was my first time coming here. The food was delicious - brisket and baby back ribs were my two favorites. I was a little surprised at the size of the sides - smaller than I would've expected for the prices they charged but they, too, were delicious. Across the table we ordered a couple of 'whole hog' platters, burgers, wings, house salads and 3 desserts. We all left very happy and stuffed!

The highlight of our meal, however, was our server Travis. You can often tell when a server first approaches your table what kind of service you'll receive throughout your meal - and he did not disappoint. He was kind, efficient and personable. Serving a family like mine is not easy but he did it with ease. I highly recommend you ask to be seated in his section when you arrive for your meal. 

The front of house staff was also great (bussers, hosts) which tells me that the training at Bobby Q's is top notch. It's hard to find a restaurant that has checked off all the boxes - great service and great food - but they do it. Don't hesitate to go here!!"
"Great service! Good cornbread, decent coleslaw but it ends there. Our waiter was awesome. He deserves 5 stars. Had a gift card to use & was craving ribs, ordered the big pig platter and the ribs were all that was edible to my liking. Obviously this place isn't hurting because it is packed!!! I will continue to go back to my usual bbq joints."
"A bunch of friends and I tried this place for my husband's birthday the other day after I found it here on Yelp.  For the love of everything tasty, this place was the BEST barbeque place I have ever been to (aside from a place I loved that went out of business in San Diego).  After reading all the reviews about the appetizers and entrees, I pretty much already knew what I wanted to order before even sitting down at our table.  

Our waiter, Lorenzo, couldn't have been better with his service and sense of humor.  The feel of the interior was a mix of casual and modern yet not too overly countryfied...there weren't dead animals hanging on the walls staring at me as I ate or hides either.

The group of us ordered the Onion Block for our appetizer.  I am not an onion person, but am a fan of the Bloomin' Onion at Outback.  But I can tell you right here and now that the Onion Block at BobbyQ's was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G-L-Y delicious!  It had the perfect crispy consistency, but what made it was the BBQ ketchup that it comes with.  I could have ate the sauce by itself.  The 6 of us ravaged it.  

For our entree, my husband and I went for one of the winning combinations, particularly the BBQ chicken and prime rib.  We decided on the ranch beans and the Mac & Cheese (after the reviews) for our sides.  I went to ask for an order of corn bread (3 for $1.50) but Lorenzo told me that he would bring us a basket for all of us.  So, I am not sure if that is something that is included, kind of like chips and salsa at Mexican food joints.  

The chicken was absolutely juicy and had the perfect amount of sauce and the prime rib was also juicy and melted in my mouth (we ordered it cooked Medium).  First, the Mac & Cheese was so very creamy and tasty that I had to stop myself from eating that and get back to the meat.  But the ranch beans tasted like so many others I have tasted, not bad though.  My friends and I, who also ordered the M&C, noticed a hint of jalapeno (not spicy, just the taste).  We asked Lorenzo and he told us they have two types of melted cheese in the kitchen, one being the cheese they usually use for the M&C and then this pepper jack/jalapeno cheese they use for other dishes.  He had said they must have accidentally used the wrong one and that it hadn't been the first time it happened.  This was so not a problem, b/c that jalapeno taste was actually what made it, I think.  I'll have to request it next time.  

The desserts didn't impress me much, but I knew from the reviews, we'd be getting free donuts before we left.  I loved that touch!  Mark my words, we will be going back more than once.  I'm sure we will take our in-laws and my family to give them the chance to taste BobbyQ's deliciousness!!!!!"
"My wife and I decided to try this place after looking for somewhere to have lunch on a Saturday afternoon. What a great decision that was! 

The restaurant is located on 27th avenue near I-17 and off of Northern. It is tucked away in the neighborhood, but don't let that fool you. Once inside, you will be treated to some of the best food you have ever had.

Our server, Jessica, was awesome! She was funny, helpful, courteous, attentive, and laughed at my stupid jokes (definitely a plus). The service there is outstanding, and makes the experience there that much better...if it's possible.

The menu is stacked with food that will make your mouth water. We are told that they cook all of their meats on-site for at least 20 hours. My wife had the beef brisket with corn and mashed potatoes. I had the smokehouse burger with mac and cheese as my side. Both were cooked to perfection and melted in our mouths. Be warned, the portions are big. Come hungry or be prepared to take many to-go boxes with you home, as we did. But that did not stop us from having dessert. My wife had the Death By Chocolate and I had the Banana creme pie. Both were so good that we were depressed when we were done eating them. When they bring you the check, they give you a couple of little doughnuts as a after dinner treat. Excellent!

The price is very reasonable for the quality of the food you will be eating. We will definitely be back to try more of the menu, and this time come with empty bellies!"

"Our last stop in Phoenix before returning to reality and I was craving some ribs, Bobby Q was a suggestion I'm so glad I opted to go for.

 First of all the building itself is very southern style and includes a trough like waterfall on the back patio with a unique water fountain that is really fun. 
 While waiting to be seated I asked about a fryer like contraption which was for their COMPLIMENTARY churro like donuts and was surprised with two to start our dining experience!
 Love that the manager himself sat us and attended to us a couple times, for customer service oriented was the impression I received, as well as the fact that everyone including our server introduced themselves. 
 Scott was kind enough to offer some suggestions as well as provide another COMP that being their cornbread muffins. O.M.G they are seriously worth the trip  in itself. Just a bit sweet and buttery with a slightly crisp top.

 I ordered the St Louis style ribs with a side of spicy BBQ sauce and baked potato. They truly fell off the bone, super flavorful from the mesquite smoking and the sauce while not unique was very good. The baked potato was good, cooked just a bit too long, however hubby had the gravy which I used a bit for the potato and it was amazing. I suggest asking for the baked potato, if not going for mashed, to have with gravy.
 Hubby had the fried chicken and side of fries with gravy on the side. The chicken was EXTREMELY moist and the batter once fried was light and crunchy. We have concluded however that unless it's KFC or a restaurant in the South we aren't going to get much flavor from the batter itself. However that's what the gravy is for and it was extremely good, I believe sausage based minus the actual meat. The shoestring fries were good but not specially seasoned like we get at our favorite Tucson BBQ joint. 

 We were going to order the mud pie for dessert however they were sadly out. 

Truly amazing even with the minor drawbacks, I would done here monthly if we're in Phoenix.."
"This might be my longest review ever. You don't have to read it, but you probably should. 

How this place has over 700 reviews to begin with is beyond me. Not even Amy's Baking Company has that many reviews and, as you might know, was heavily trolled after it aired on Kitchen Nightmares. They must be handing out money to folks for writing this shit. Or they're planted reviews. What's even more baffling is that it has a solid 4 stars. Methinks something is not quite right, but whatevs. Let's move on, shall we?

This place is truly bizarre. I've been here maybe a total of 3-4 times since it first opened many years ago. It's a BBQ restaurant / club-lounge thingy. And as I learned for the first time at happy hour yesterday, it's apparently two different restaurants. At least, that's how everyone acted. My boss had made reservations for us in the Q Lounge for their Friday happy hour. Apparently you can just walk in (provided you're 21) and eat a buffet spread for free. But not until you get past the LAUNDRY LIST of dress code rules. Yes, a restaurant that serves BBQ, near Ghettrocenter, has a fucking idiotic dress code. Seriously some of the dumbest shit I have ever seen. I thought I was in metro Phoenix at a BBQ restaurant, not a Scottsdale nightclub. The list includes asinine things such as: No white t-shirts, no hats, no sunglasses, no sandals, and must be a cougar. I wanted to be like, mo' fucker, do you know this is PHOENIX? We wear sunglasses upon walking up. We wear hats to shade our faces from the blazing sun. We wear sandals, often times fashionable ones, so our feet don't get all sweaty. And white t-shirts? Now you're just acting foolish. Of course, my boyfriend whom I invited, was wearing a white t-shirt, with a nice button-up collared dress shirt (it was unbuttoned), a hat (a nice one, like derby style), and sunglasses because um, to shield your eyes? He was asked to button up his shirt, remove his sunglasses (no shit Sherlock, don't we all once we get inside?), and remove his hat. Mind you, he's a nice dresser, not some hobo with tattered clothes (usually). Had I not been invited by my boss to this happy hour, I would've bounced right then and there. It all just seemed like some giant, corny joke.

Time for a paragraph break. It helps your eyeballs if you break things up. I'd like to point out that the actual restaurant portion does not honor said happy hour. That's right, you must go to the 21+ side with the fun dress code rules to have happy hour, even though it gets insanely crowded with nowhere to sit. Oh wait, you CAN order a happy hour beverage, but you have to get up from the table and walk your ass to the bar. If you order a beverage at your table, it'll be full price.

I will now talk about the redeeming qualities which merited that killer 2-star review. The food is very good. The mac and cheese is the cheesiest, and all of the meat is incredibly tender. A wee bit overpriced, but not awful. They also give you free freshly-made donuts when you leave instead of a damn dinner mint. That's pretty dope. The staff is very kind. Our sever, Alicia (sp?), was very sweet and accommodating. Kudos to her.

Lastly, it's confusing as shit to get into this place. The parking lot is weird, and if you've never been, you'll have no idea where to enter. The Q Lounge vs the restaurant portion. Two different places, remember. Even though...it's...not.

Note: Just don't dress like you live in Phoenix. You might not get inside to the dopest dance club in all of metro Phoenix."
"Prices are too high for the quality of food. All of our baked potatoes were day old and both looked and tasted awful. My almost $7 garden salad was very small and was only iceburge lettuce and two tomatoe pieces. For $7, really?!!! Will not come back"

"So I am adding another star to my review based on the fact that Jack reached out to me to apologize on the items that didn't live up to Bobby Q's standards. That speaks volumes when a restaurant takes the time, especially ones that are as busy as this one. If and when we return if the bbq is as awesome as this takeout was and the sides are up to par I will update again to five star because the meats were truly delicious.

This review has me a little torn. I ordered take out for my Mother's 89th birthday. A combo of meats by the pound, brisket and pulled pork. Pecan coleslaw and a half pan of apple cobbler. 

Ordering was a breeze over the phone and they emailed a credit card authorization form just in case I needed another family member to pick up.

Arriving the day of and most of the meal had been packed I just had to wait for the cobbler for a few minutes. Everything was packed nicely and they had wrapped the extra sauces in plastic wrap to avoid spills.

I must say the bbq was outstanding. Brisket tender and pulled pork was fantastic. Probably the best I ever had. I was a little surprised that the meats had been sauced though. Don't get me wrong their sauce is delicious but the proteins were so flavorful it didn't need any sauce.

Now the coleslaw was good but it didn't have any pecans as advertised on the menu. Another family member said they usually put the nuts in a cup to add but we didn't have any.

The cobbler. Looked picture perfect. Looked. Apples and sauce perfectly seasoned and the apples held their shape with a touch of crispness still. The crust was good along the edges but the middle was raw. Completely raw. 

Next time we will just order proteins because they truly were delicious. The sides left a lot to be desired. And when you pay $17 for coleslaw it should be perfect."
"I'm a BBQ nut and super picky. This was a good spot to meet a friend and have a nice meal. 

Brisket Sandwich: Both my friend and I ordered the same main dish and both of us had the same reaction. The brisket was pretty tender but the flavor underwhelmed us. It wasn't bad at all, but again, I'm a super picky with BBQ. I wanted the brisket to ignite my taste buds with the flavor of the cut. It had flavor just not in the way I was after. 

Roasted Corn: This was pretty good. It's a grilled and well seasoned piece of corn on the cob. Once it's done, they cut the corn from the cob, put it in a dish and serve it. It's a good BBQ side. 

Beans: My friend had the beans and enjoyed them. 

Service: Friendly, timely, attentive. The food was hot and served in a timely manner. 

Summary: A nice spot for a casual dinner, date night or even a laid back business meeting. Food was good and atmosphere was inviting. Would consider going again if I was in the area."

"First impression of Bobby Qs: especially polite and helpful service calling in for our party of seven reservation.Then we arrived to the best service we've had in a LONG time, from the hostesses to our amazing waiter, Dylan and all of the others that helped him serve us.
