"Bobby Q has been a part of the neighborhood ever since I was a kid. Before my last visit, it had been a solid 10 years since my last time. I wasn't sure what to expect as I didn't remember any of it. I was excited to see how good the BBQ was and to support a local place. 

FOOD: We ordered the ""Whole Hog"" which comes with 2 types of ribs (your choice), 2 types of meat (your choice), and 3 sides (your choice). This sampler platter was $55, but a great trial for three people. The food only took about 15 minutes to be prepared and brought to our table. Holy cow it was a great feast! My personal favorite from that meal was the St. Louis Ribs. Those ribs were cooked to perfection and fell off the bone with amazing flavor. The sausage was also extremely delicious with a hint of spice. The sides we chose were mac & cheese, baked beans, and roasted corn. All of these were exceptional and well worth it. The food alone will have me coming back to try other menu options. 

SERVICE: Our server was Dustin. He was a really nice guy who knew a lot about the menu and how all this great food is prepared. One of the people in my group had a dairy allergy, and Dustin was able to help accommodate us on what we could order. I was really impressed with the service and how friendly everyone was. 

OVERALL: Bobby Q shocked me with their delicious food and exceptional service. The ambiance of this restaurant makes you feel right at home with a southern BBQ style vibe, and food that is to die for. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the valley who is looking for a great BBQ place to try."
"This place was simply incredible: from the wonderful waitress to the quality of the food. The ambiance was very relaxed as we sat outside in the patio area. The server was very positive and professional. Our beef ribs, cornbread, onion loaf, rotisserie chicken, St. Louis ribs, cheeseburger, and kid's meals were all awesome. Portions were hefty, and pricing was very reasonable. This is definitely one of the best barbecue restaurants I've been to in a long time. Best beef ribs and cornbread; hands down. I'll definitely be returning to this great restaurant with my wife and children for another extraordinary experience."
"Not sure why this place is so highly rated. I think it's just mediocre Q. Ordered the whole hog with baby backs, beef ribs, pulled pork and brisket. The baby backs were over cooked as you couldn't even lift them by the bone. The meat had no pull on it and just fell off the bone. Any bbq expert knows that ribs need a little pull and resistance to being completely pulled off the bone. The meat was of course mushy. That is not tender meat, it's over cooked. The beef rib was very good. The brisket was dry and not extraordinary. The pulled pork was not remarkable. Mac and cheese was really good. Corn had been cooked way too long. The donuts at the end of the meal were a nice touch. If you like bourbon you will be disappointed in the selection. The place gets super crowded so make sure you have reservations. But I'm sure there are better bbq joints in this town."
"I was in Phoenix , from Las Vegas,  attending a convention. Wanted some good bbq so we Googled. This place came up so we decided to give it a try.  We were not disappointed.  Loved the baby baby ribs and pecan cole slaw. One friend was not hungry for dinner so she ordered dessert only. She said that bread pudding was superb,  the best she's ever had.  We are very particular about our bread pudding. I've had terrible bread pudding at casino buffets but also good bread pudding at Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen. My sister loves the bread pudding at Famous Dave's Barbecue. So we now know where to get some great bread pudding. I love that the meat is smoked at least 22 hours. BbQ done correctly.  Bob himself also came by our table to greet us / meet us. Nice fellow! Wishing you continued success,  sir!"
"This place is great. I love the atmosphere and the food. I got a very positive vibe from the hostess and servers. I ordered the beef and pork ribs with corn and Mac n cheese. All were great. Meat did fall off the bones. The Mac and cheese was awesome. The corn was tasty but oily. The corn bread is good too. 
As good as it was I can't come often to drop $30 for a combo rib plate all the time. It was a nice treat for me that night though."
"Went to Booby Q this past week while on PHX for business.   The place was packed, yet we were able to get a couple of seats in the bar area.

Our server was relatively new there, but good and kept it lively.  We ordered and the food was out pretty quickly. 

For the price, I found the servings rather small, but very tasteful.  Quality competes with our local ""Phil;s BBQ"" on San Diego.

At the end, the server took the check and said ""let me get you some doughnuts.""  We were like...WHAT?  The guy brings back a bag full of cinnamon sugared, hot, fresh doughnuts. They were awesome!!!

They have a doughnut machine behind the hostess stand and truly make fresh doughnuts on the spot!! I would go back, just for the doughnuts."
This bbq gem is very unassuming from the outside. We pulled into the back parking lot and I was really not expecting much. We go in and not only is it a decorated super cute we were greeted right away and the place was beyond busy. I ordered the Wednesday special. Truth be told I would get it every Wednesday if I could! Our server brought us corn bread which was so good and after our meal she gave us a small bag of mini cinnamon and sugar donuts which were obviously freshly made.
"Spacious facility for larger groups.  Loved lunching outside on the porch, covered but still having an outdoors feeling.  I had a great salad, Bobby's chicken with blue cheese that had chunks of cheese in the dressing.  Only negative was being able to hear what the person across the table was saying."
"Really good place to take the family, they have good serving sizes, and some of the best BBQ in town...  Love it!   And ALWAYS friendly staff."
"Not bad, a bit overpriced, the decorations are nice, it would have been better if the customer service was better, it was bland"
"This restaurant is amazing! The food is to die for, probably the best bbq ive ever had! The salmon and shrimp is also amazing. They serve cornbread with most meals; i dont even like cornbread but here i do! The q-rolls appetizer is incredible! Also the servers are kind and the managers come and converse with you! The atmosphere is amazing with beautiful lighting. If you havent been to this restaurant you are missing out! Perfect for a date or family night out"
"This place is legit! Very good tasty food! Awesome environment! I visit Phoenix often - will stop by this place again. 

I ordered the brisket, pulled pork and ribs! Best in Phoenix!"
"Good food, good service, but BBQ could be better.
We had a three meat sampler with pork, brisket, ribs, garlic bread, corn bread, Mac and cheese and French fries (nothing healthy about this).  All in all the food rates good.  The BBQ had a nice, smoky flavor, however the all the meat had the same consistency.  While moist, none of it held texture.  Everything just fell apart into a tasty meat mush.  
The server was excellent, prompt and timely."
Good food and smells great. The corn bread and the donuts at the end are yum. Our waiter was very attentive and the atmosphere was nice.
"OMG - come for the corn bread; stay for the BBQ.  I'm usually luke-warm about corn bread -- a few bites and I'm bored. But THIS stuff was out of this world!  Not too sweet, moist and slightly crumbly (without being doughy), and a delightful crunch from the toasted crust.  I'd be OK with them giving me the recipe (OK, give it to my wife -- my cooking is primarily associated with grilling and smoking after all).

OK, let's talk brisket-- tender and tasty, served with a dollop of sauce. Nice that it's not drowning in it; they'll bring you a small pitcher of it if you prefer it that way (not me -- I like to taste the cow!)

Thirsty? Nine bucks for a 21-oz draft (if you only want one beer); smaller pours are available if you're dieting)

Service was top notch -- a tip of the hat to our server Noah. Very helpful, perfect timing, and just downright hospitable. 

The only (minor) ding is the Mac N Cheese. A little gummy and the cheese was bland -- but hey -- it's just a side dish, not the main attraction. 

We walked away stuffed to the gills, and a bag with some leftovers to go with my eggs in the morning. 

5 stars means we'll be back for more on our next trip"
Dylan was such a great and personable server! Made our dinner great and fun! Great employee there. Food was great.
"First, the food was amazing. We both had the BBQ Pulled Chicken sandwiches and the chicken had just the right amount of sauce and smoke but what really was amazing was how tender the meat was. You could tell they truly do smoke everything in house and take great care in the preparation. Secondly the service was outstanding. Our server Orlando was great and really friendly with our daughter but even though the restaurant was about half full the managers went around to every table checking in. Everyone was super helpful and friendly and you can tell they know how to run a great restaurant. We drove over from Scottsdale where we are staying and can't wait to come back the next time we are in town."
Bobby Q has become one of my very favorite restaurants in Phoenix.  I have always had fantastic food and impeccable service.  I highly recommend anyone trying this place if you haven't before.
Awesome food! Great service!! Definitely would recommend this restaurant!! Wear your loose pants because you will want to eat every bite!
"It was good, don't get me wrong. Portions are HUGE! Q rolls are a delicious appetizer (honestly could have gone for another order for my meal ). But the food was just ehhh (don't hate me) - nothing special. I recommend upgrading your fries to the beer fries (instead of the shoestring). The steak is REALLY Smokey if you're into that... it just wasn't what I was used to, so it wasn't my personal favorite."
"I miss Little Bo Peep and the rest of the character servers of the late Bobby McGee's!!! I miss the private and romantic individual seating areas. I miss the salad bar and the food of yesterday!! If you have been around the area for a while, you know what I mean. If not, you missed out BIG TIME!! Bobby Q took Bobby McGee's out and I'm still depressed about it over a decade later!! Bobby Q, you do not impress me much.

Like many others, I do not understand the hype or the love of this place at all, whatsoever, NOPE, not now and I never will!!! Their meat is ""moist"" alright, to the point of no texture and you could feed it to a TOOTHLESS infant!!! I like some texture and a lot more smoke flavor!!!

I especially do NOT like the donuts they serve after your dinner. They are greasy and mush much like their meat. My young kid said they made his ""stomach sick."" Their cornbread is good, but I make mine from a boxed pre-mix and add a can of creamed corn and a small can of drained green chili's (only the 3 ingredients) and I like it BETTER!! 

I give them two stars only because for lunch they have a good deal. You can get a brisket or pork sandwich with a side for $9.00. The atmosphere is nice and the service is good so I might return for lunch, but not very often and ONLY if I happen to be driving right by. I will NOT go out of my way to eat here!!!"
"Three of us went here last night and other than the noise level in the place, the food was good and the service was fast;  almost to fast. The baby backs were fall off the bone good but the BBQ chicken was the star to me. I had the sides of bean and corn and both were just average. We got there at 6:20 and sat right down but when we left around 7:30 the place packed with a line out the door. I really good place to go for a quick meal."
"Chill spot, the dessert donuts they brought out after the meal were so so good! Could eat them all day! Good brisket and veggies. Had a great experience. Cool place"
"I love Bobby Q and can't believe I haven't been here in over 5 years!  We brought some out of town family to enjoy some great BBQ.  I enjoyed the rotisserie chicken with a side of roasted corn and mac 'n cheese - wow, that was amazing!  The cornbread they serve should be illegal...it is that good.  I love that they make homemade donuts as you walk in/walk out and they give them to you at the end of your meal.  Bobby Q's has a really nice atmosphere and the service is great too!"
"Hands down best bbq spot I've ever been to. My guy Dylan was honestly the best server I've ever had. He recommended dishes and drinks that were incredible. Everything he suggested was amazing. He's definitely someone who is absolutely great at their job and brings much charisma to his work, hes prolly one of the guys you would want to work with on a shift with. Babyback ribs were my favorite. Cornbread was killer as well. Thanks again Dylan for the incredible service, thats my guy."
"We tried: 
Zucchini fries
Spinach artichoke dip, salsa verde & salsa roja & chips & breadsticks
Hog heaven: beef ribs, baby back ribs, brisket, chicken, Mac & cheese, fries, broccolini
Jumbo broiled shrimp 

Lunch & dinner came with a basket of corn bread-- one round piece per person. It was hot, moist, and perfectly sweet & savory. 
Zucchini fries were perfectly fried and dusted with Parmesan cheese-- a delicious appetizer I would order again
Artichoke dip was gone before I could try some, but everyone raved about how delicious it was
Q rolls: smoked brisket in phyllo dough. Absolutely delicious! 

Meat: beef ribs were perfectly cooked with tons of smoke flavor. Absolutely delicious! My favorite of all the meat we tried. 
Baby back ribs: fall of the bone tender-- covered in the perfect amount of BBQ sauce. Would definitely recommend trying. 
Brisket: super tender, some tender & some lean. Absolutely perfectly smoked. 
Chicken: breast was slightly dry and under seasoned. 

Broccolini: perfectly cooked & seasoned. My favorite of all the sides. 
Mac & cheese: slightly too salty, but a generous portion. 
Fries: I prefer my fries to be shoestring, but these were cut a little too thinly for my taste. 

Service: super nice & attentive despite how busy they were. 

If you are visiting the Phoenix area you must try this place. It was so delicious that I went back the next day!"
Without a doubt some of the best bbq I have ever had and I have been to places like Memphis TN. The service was amazing but the food...wow. And to top it off they send you home with mini doughnuts. A must when in Glendale. Bravo!

The turkey was moist and Smokey, the sides I wish I ordered more of for left overs, and there really was more than enough food for a family of 5.

"Bobby-Q is a Barbecue Restaurant that cooks it's Beef Ribs, Pork Ribs, Turkey, Beef Brisket  Chicken, and other meats in the traditional true BBQ smoking method. It is delicious and certainly worth the attention and patronage of true BBQ afficionados. They also do a nice selection of side items including Pecan Cole Slaw, Beans, Mac & Cheese, Baked Potatoes, French Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, and others. Service was good, but today for lunch was less than it's usual 5 Star Level. A bit slow initially to take our orders, and to deliver our check. Also ribs tasted reheated and not freshly cooked. Also a bit pricy but IMO worth it when they execute properly. I do recommend them."
"I had the three meat platter w beef ribs and double brisket order.  The beef ribs were awful as the only meat on them were inbetween the bones...maybe a mouthful or two for each bone. They were mostly fat and membrane from the bone. I should have listened to my server who told me not to get them...lesson learned :) 
The brisket was mediocre at best.  it was not trimmed well as the bark was mostly fat.  Definitely a disappointment.  The service was good and ambience was nice but the barbeque was not up to snuff.  Certainly better  barbeque spots in Scottsdale...I think Little Miss BBQ  is close by and much higher quality bbq IMO."

"Delicious! The meat falls right off the bone. The whole hog heaven can easily feed 4 people and gives you good variety.  The Mac and cheese did not disappoint. Im not a fan of mac and cheese, but
I'm glad we tried it. a must try.

Service is really great. My nephew has food allergies and our server and manager explained to us which kid's meal would be good and not. They also made sure that his food was cooked separately to avoid cross contamination. Overall a good experience. BBQ heaven indeed.

Btw, they give you free cornbread, free heavenly dessert donuts and 10% off if you check in on yelp"

"We chose Bobby Q for our first dinner, on our first day of vacation in Phoenix.  The Yelp reviews were great, and it was located just across the street from our hotel.  

We arrived at 6:00 p.m. on a Thursday evening to a busy dining room.  We were seated quickly and our orders were taken within a few minutes.  I order the Southern Fried Chicken, mashed potatoes and gravy (a known weakness of mine), and mac n cheese.  My wife tries the pulled BBQ chicken sandwich, and coleslaw.  My son orders ""The Perfect Hamburger"", and mac n' cheese.  Cornbread is provided as a free appetizer and is solid.  The food arrives after a reasonable 20 minutes and is mostly very good, and in some instances ""great"".  My Southern Fried Chicken was perfect and was the best execution I have tried of this dish.  The mashed potatoes and gravy were very good as well as the mac n' cheese.  My wife did not care for her pulled BBQ chicken sandwich and barely touched it.  Flavor of the BBQ sauce and the texture of the chicken just didn't do it for her (my son tried it and also had the same opinion).  Her coleslaw was good though.  My son's ""Perfect Hamburger"" surprisingly was perfect, as advertised.  Said it was the best burger he has had - EVER.  This is a kid who eats a lot of burgers, so that comment was surprising to mom and dad.  He also liked his mac n' cheese, but commented it was almost too rich.  

Non-food related comments: Volume was just right - loud enough to know something is happening, quiet enough that you can converse without issue.  The lighting and atmosphere were good.  The indoor and outdoor dining areas were both very nice - much better than my picture indicates.  Service was very average and forgettable - couldn't pick our waiter out of a line up if my life depended on it.

Overall, a very good experience.  I'll be back for the southern fried chicken on my next trip to Phoenix.  My son lives here and has vowed to come back next week for another ""Perfect Hamburger"".  Check this place out; it is well worth the money."
This has been one of my favorite restaurants for more than 10 years. The food is amazing and it's great for large groups. Prices are reasonable and staff is very friendly.
"My wife and I spent this weekend in Phoenix to watch the Padres play. Which they won 6-2! We were deciding whether to eat Mexican or bbq. We chose Bobby Q's because the reviews were solid and we love bbq! If you're not paying attention in finding this place, good luck. Their sign is about 4x4 in size. The parking lot was packed which is a good indication. We chose to sit outside in the patio to avoid the wait time. Patio heaters were a plus. The menu is lengthy from ribs, chicken, brisket and all the fixns. We were served hot corn bread which was outstanding. My wife ordered the half chicken with baked potato and roasted corn. I ordered the brisket with the baked potato and baked beans. No need for a knife. The brisket was so tender I used my fork. Only minor drawback is that my food could've been a lot hotter. So if your in Phoenix, visit this place. And if you're in San Diego, visit Phil's bbq! No other place holds a candle to Phil's!"
"This is the best BBQ place in the Phx area.  Great ambience, service is always good.  The servings are large.  You must try the Q Rolls for an appetizer, but save room for the fresh made donuts  on the way out.  You won't be disappointed, there is something for everyone."
"This place is probably one of my favorite spots in the valley to take a date. Although the area is not so nice, the inside is pretty nice. The food is always delicious. I always get the 14oz prime rib and it never disappoints. The sides that I order are usually their beer battered fries (which are not on their menu but highly recommend!) and their mac n cheese. You can make a meal out of their mac n cheese alone. It's completely thick and creamy."

"Super fun and tasty lunch. Reagan and Kyle were great and shared some opinions on GCU, as we just did a tour there. Fabulous BBQ. Smokey and tasty, but not drowned in sticky sweetness. "Absolutely some of the best barbecue I've ever had! It was actually so good my coworkers and I came here two nights in a row for dinner. Last night I had the sliced prime beef brisket, grilled vegetables and Pecan coleslaw. The beef brisket was moist, tender, and flavorful. The barbecue sauce was both sweet and tangy but not too much of either; my mouth is watering just talking about it again! Tonight I had the two meat dinner which included the prime beef sliced brisket and smoked pulled pork. Again the dish was absolutely perfect, with the pulled pork being just as good as the sliced beef! The service on both nights was equally good, the waiters were friendly and courteous. We didn't make reservations either night but the three of us were seated within 20 minutes on both visits. The place has a surprisingly nice ambience for a barbecue restaurant. You definitely don't want to miss this place if you're in Phoenix and really enjoy BBQ."

"We were visiting Phx, and have been at Castles and Coasters for most of the day. Needed something good, found BOBBY Q, and seen the reviews. Let's just say...O.M.G!

We came at a great time. Was seated promptly. Was greeted by a very friendly server. Told her it was our first time, and she gave us the quick story of the place.  We made our selection and it took no more than 10 mins for the entire meal to come out. That was amazing. Was looking at other tables too, their food came out quick as well. Not only was it FAST, the QUALITY was magnificent! Nom nom nom. 

At the end of the meal, we did our check in on Yelp, which earn 10% and also got us a free chocolate cake! Yummmmmmmy!! On top of that, for dining, we get a bag of cinnamon mini donuts! 

Only reason why I didnt give them a 5, was because.... 
The cornbread was so deng DELICIOUS,  they didnt give more. One per guest. And I asked for the price and they said its $1 each. Cmon! Just a little unhappy about that....hopefully that will change one day and they'll give u all u can eat corn bread!!! 

We'll definitely return next time we are in town!"

"I've been there a few times now. So far I've gotten excellent service. The food comes out fast, it's really good, and the portions are huge. I honestly can't think of anything to complain about. The bathrooms were also very clean. I'm happy I found this place."
"We were completely blown away by the service. ""Captain Jack"" gave us an experience of true southern hospitality. The food was outstanding but truly the service is what made this place so great. This was our first visit but it will not be our last!"
"A coworker of mine highly recommended this place last year when I told him I was headed out to Tempe for spring training. I didn't get a chance to come last year but I made it a point to check it out this year. I was able to make a same day reservation for Saturday evening through the yelp app and I'm so glad I did because the wait was going to be about an hour otherwise. We waited less than 10 minutes to be seated. 

Our server Tiffany was great, we told her it was our first time so she took the time to give us history on the restaurant and she gave us her recommendations. The corn bread was so yummy and moist. My fiance and I shared the whole hog heaven, which comes with two meats, two ribs and 3 sides. For $40 not bad at all, we didn't finish our ribs and meat (there was a lot for two.) The sides could have been a little bigger, we devoured the mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were so creamy and flavorful. 

I usually prefer baby back ribs over the St. Louis but in this case we agreed the St. Louis were better. The pulled chicken was my favorite, it wasn't the typical chicken covered in bbq sauce. It had some other flavor I can't describe but it was amazing! We walked out of here stuffed, I almost needed to be carried out. The home made donuts at the end were a nice touch, even though I was full I couldn't stop eating them because they were so light/fluffy and bite size. Definitely took advantage of the 10% for checking in. Saved us 10 bucks, I'll take it!! I'll be back next year when I'm in town."
"Review 5/10 for the 10 bookmarked businesses to review before the end of 2016! From Meagan B.'s thread: https://www.yelp.com/topic/phoenix-yelp-phoenixs-10-firsts-of-2016

Bobby Q's was on our way back from our weekend trip up north and it was around lunchtime so we figured we'd get something from there to go so we could eat it back at home. The menu was easy to browse through online. I called and placed an order for the three meat combo which would be ready in 15 minutes.

There are two areas in this restaurant. The front is for dining in while there is a separate back parking lot and take out entrance. Service at the counter was friendly and they even offered me a drink while my order was being put together. 

The smell of BBQ in the car was mouth watering as we drove back home. I ordered the combo with baby back ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. For sides I had the roasted corn and coleslaw. The meal also included 2 pieces of cornbread and they gave me some extra BBQ sauce.

All the meats were very tender with smoky flavor. My favorite of the three was probably the pulled pork, followed by the baby back ribs. The brisket was good and they included fatty and lean pieces, but the memory of the superb brisket from Little Miss BBQ still lingers in my memory as one of the best I've had.

The sides were excellent. The roasted corn also had some smoked flavor and the coleslaw was crisp, tangy and refreshing.

Overall it was a good meal and I do like how they have more convenient hours and better atmosphere than Little Miss BBQ. I will be back for more BBQ!"
"Excellent every single time. Best BBQ place in town as far as I'm concerned. Brought my entire family there for my Dads Birthday. The meat just falls off the ribs, the steaks melt in your mouth. It's a bit pricey but you'll definitely be taking home leftovers, and free donuts to take home! Also I'm Gluten Intolerant and they cater to us Celiac folks! Never been sick after eating there! Yay!!"
"Everyone loves this place but I just don't get it. Cute space, nice servers, good food but nothing amazing as far as I could tell except the Mac n cheese. We got a variety of things and they were all good but for the price I'd just rate it average. Maybe I'm spoiled on fabulous BBQ in the south at low prices."
"Never been here before. We had a nice little room off the main dining. For a Tuesday night the place was jumping!  Our server was superb. On top of everything. Drinks promptly refilled, making sure our selections were perfect. The appetizers were excellent. We had shrimp in a light BBQ butter, the corn bread muffins hot with warm honey butter, the fish sticks fresh with two dipping sauces and the tortillas and dips were also excellent. Everyone chose off the menu. I had the steak open face on garlic toast and a baked potato. Steak cooked to perfection and tender. I'll be the first to admit not a huge fan of smoked meat but this was good. At the end they have these little bags of tiny donuts that literally are hot and melt in your mouth."
The best BBQ in town! Service is always great and everything was cooked to perfection.
"Stopped by here on the way to Sedona, AZ and had a great lunch! I came in around 2PM on a Friday and there was no wait, so we were immediately seated. I ordered the lunch rib special which came with cornbread, a side (I picked Mac & cheese) and a complimentary dessert (cinnamon sugar mini donuts). All meats were aged for a few weeks and smoked for almost a day so the ribs I ordered were very tender and flavorful. The Mac & cheese was unlike any I've had before - a LOT of cheese (maybe too cheesy) and only a little mac... The freshly made cinnamon sugar mini donuts were still hot when served and tasted delicious!"
"I used Bobby Qs to cater my wedding, and all I can say is EXCELLENT customer service!!! From the moment I started discussing my needs with Jason and Dana, I could tell how much they cared. They completely customized my event, made it personal and affordable! With other restaurants I shopped for catering they wanted 2 or 3x the cost with simply pulled pork on buns. Bobby Qs catered my wedding with baby back ribs, pulled bbq chicken, 4 different sides of my choice, AND had an attended server at the event!! It was absolutely amazing and everyone raved about how good the food was! It was hot, delicious, and they even made sure the set up was done early so it wouldnt interfere with anything about the ceremony. I have nothing but 5 stars to give this place! ! Jason and Dana have given me hope that customer service still exists and they are absolutely fantastic at what they do! Thank you for making my wedding food absolutely perfect!!!! You are the best!!"
"It was our first time in Arizona and first time at Bobby-Q. It is veteran's weekend so we came around 5:30pm to beat the dinner rush hour. We were greeted by the hostess, told them I was 'Tiger' and got the pager. We were told it would be 15-20 minutes but we were seated within 5 minutes, lucky us!

Everyone was welcoming, hostess, waitresses/waiters. Our Waiter, Derrick welcomes us and gave us a brief introduction on what's popular and recommendation. We got the winning combination with a medium rare prime rib and BBQ Chicken. 

The food came out in 10 minutes which is amazingly fast. The prime rib was amazing, super juicy, moist, and tender. Fiancé enjoyed the BBQ chicken as the flavor was more sweet than tangy, which she preferred.

Thanks for the delicious time. Would highly recommend this place . the staff did a great job to create a great vibe."

"Since we loved Bobby Q in Mesa, we decided to see what the ""Original"" location in Phoenix had to offer. I don't know who runs this place or the other, but I'd LOVE to meet him/her or them. The service at this place it top notch and far surpasses that of any 5 star, fine dining establishments I've ever been to. I am a firm believer that food may come up short from time to time. Maybe a recipe wasn't followed. Maybe there's a new cook in the kitchen. Maybe they are so slammed the kitchen cant keep up, etc.. It's a bummer when that happens but most often people will return to try it again. But... a server is on stage, in front of their guests, until the last curtain call. They really have no room for error without getting scrutinized and skinned alive. And they tend to take the hit for the entire restaurant. If the food is bad, for some reason it's easier for people to take it out on the server. If it took an hour to get a table, somehow it's the servers fault. If an entree was missed and didn't make it out to the table...yep it's the server's fault. Am I wrong? 
Well here is where I'm going with this. The service at Bobby Q is so cream of the crop, that  in the unfortunate event of any one of the above mentioned scenarios, I can't foresee it ever being an issue. 
Our server Donald, was more than just an order taker. He was a true experience maker, and we had the best time with him. I asked him about a couple of cocktails I was torn on. He was honest about one of them, the Watermelon Cooler, and let me know it's not for everyone and it gets sent back quite a bit. I ordered it and LOVED it. It tasted like a Jalapeno infused, Watermelon Margarita. I love spicy margaritas and this cocktail was right up my alley! 
The food was also superb. I had beef ribs as well as 1/2 rack baby backs, accompanied with Mashed Potatoes and Mac N CHeese! 
PSA: There is absolutely no dainty way to eat the beef ribs. Just accept the facts, get in touch with your inner Caveman, and go to town! Nom, Nom, Nom... while you're feasting, try to remember you are in public, people may be watching, so keep the growling to a minimum. 
At the end of our meal, we were so full, we regretfully declined dessert. We did however find a tiny bit of room for the complimentary mini donuts. I actually asked if we could order some to go. To my pleasant surprise, they sell them by the dozen! And, to my ultimate surprise our server brought us a few extra donuts, told us not to leave, and came back with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!! Whhaaaaaaat?? Omg... mind blown and super yummy! All in all Bobby Q. has it together from start to finish and you will not be disappointed! Be sure to ask for Donald, he's one of the best!"

We started off with an appetizer of the Q-Rolls (suggested by our waitress). They were so tender and the dipping sauces were so good. Best BBQ sauce I ever had.

We ordered our lunch. My boyfriend had their smokehouse burger with shoestring fries and I had the slices BBQ prime beef brisket sandwich with Mac and cheese. The brisket was so tender and the Mac and cheese was really good. I had a bite of my boyfriend's burger and that was the best burger I've ever had- and I'm not a big burger person. Before we left, our waitress gave us their homemade sugar donuts which are soooo delicious.

"Solid four-star restaurant but not five. The beef brisket was the most flavorful brisket I've had in my entire life; A penetrating yet not overpowering smoky sensation.  However, I was disappointed with two of the three the barbecue sauces.  The ""regular sauce"" is sweeter than catch-up with just a little more sophistication.  The spicy sauce tasted more like corn syrup mixed with hot sauce.  However the Carolina sauce was a genuine flavorful masterpiece.  It's commonplace for vegetables in barbecue joints to be lackluster, but a four and one half star 800+ review restaurant should be an exception to the rule: it was not. On the more delectable side, we had the Apple cobbler for dessert -nine out of 10."
"The restaurant had a comfortable but classy kind of country charm.  There was a nice size bar area and people seemed to be having a good time watching the game on the two large flatscreen televisions.  The regular dining area was a large room with several smaller areas off of the large area.  There was a mixture of square, rectangular and round wooden tables and chairs.  While we were there I saw the staff moving some tables together to create dining for a large group of people.  The lighting was low, more like a bar setting, but adequate.  We had reservations, via Open Table & the Yelp app, and were seated immediately.  

Our server was friendly and attentive.  We ordered two Strawberry Q'ladas, a strawberry flavored Pina Colada, off the speciality drink menu.  We got our drinks then he took our order and food was at our table about 15 minutes later.  The drinks were very good, but we both wished they packed more booze.  The cornbread was brought to our table after our drinks but before our meal.  Both grandkids had to have some right away.  Both gobbled down their pieces and probably would have asked for more if they could have gotten away with it.  

The Baby Back Ribs were outstanding; falling off the bone the way they are supposed to be but hard to get just anywhere these days.  I also had the Pecan Cole Slaw and fortunately for me, the pecans were sprinkled on top so I could scoop them off and eat the rest of the really good slaw.  The Ranch Beans were pretty unusual.  I have not tasted anything quite like them.  My wife said they had cinnamon in them but there were a bit too spicy for me so I shoved them off on my grandson, the ""fire eating kid.""  But I enjoyed what I had already eaten.  The cornbread was good but I really liked the super thin french fries I kept stealing off my granddaughter's kid burger meal plate.

My wife had the 8 oz Sirloin Steak and Baked Potato.  She asked that the steak be medium well and it was.  It appeared to be larger than 8 oz.  The potato wasn't as good as the steak; it could have been a little hotter.  It also came with a few thin onion straws that were a nice little surprise.  Before we left, we were surprised with some warm little donuts to take with us.  They were rolled in cinnamon and sugar and were just the right end to a delicious meal.

I asked the server if there was any chance the owners would open a location in Tucson because we would definitely be regulars.  But sadly, according to our server, both the owner and his kids are retirement age and the likelihood of a Tucson location appears to be extremely slim."
"Great happy hour, service is phenomenal.  Food is fantastic and everything met our expectations and more.  Thank you"
Great food and service. Found this on yelp and thought we'd give it a try. Didn't regret it.
"This restaurant was out of this world. I am no Phoenix local but my boyfriend is and as a place he grew up with, I was really excited to try this. I have a hard time finding reasonably priced BBQ where I live, so this was an impressive treat. 

The Restaurant
Just wow. The design of this place feels like it should be on the cover of Home Magazine. It feels like a dream in both its indoor and outdoor seating. It's the kind of charming decor you just have to come to see for yourself. 

The Service
These servers really know their menus that's for sure or at least ours did! Dustin was our waiter and he didn't need to question the menu. I have an allergy that is in just about everything and he didn't skip a beat knowing his ingredients which I greatly appreciate. He was friendly, upbeat and checked on us just enough. The food arrived quickly and the hot cornbread even quicker.

The Food
We ordered the Whole Hog to split between 3 people. We don't eat a ton of food but we definitely don't skimp out on portions when it comes to BBQ. The meal portion was plenty with some to spare. We chose the sausage which was super tender and packed with flavor and two different kinds of ribs that were to die for. I asked for some extra sauce and a toasted bun, and Dustin brought the bun with practically a pitcher of BBQ sauce (new best friend). The sides we ordered were the roasted corn, baked beans, and the mac n' cheese. I could only eat the beans which were fantastic, and the other two people loved their sides as well. The Whole Hog that comes with the three sides costs $52 and between 3 people that is more than reasonable!

Overall
I will most definitely be coming back here! I would love to try the outdoor seating next time because it's so beautiful and I know the food won't disappoint. I don't rave about restaurants often but I'll be spreading the word about this place to everyone I know who is looking for a fantastic BBQ restaurant. Thank you for a wonderful dinner!! My photos just don't do the food justice."

"This place is alright. We came in on a Sunday night, it was not busy at all. "This is one of my favorite BBQ joints in Phoenix. Whether inside in the dining room or outside on the lush patio surrounded by an impressive garden array of color, Bobby Q is a great place to relax and gnaw on a few bones with friends or family. 

It's expanded from this original location just off the I-17 and 28 Ave, with spots in Mesa and near central Phoenix/Scottsdale. 

Between my ambitious belly and generous friends at meet ups, there's little I haven't tried on the menu. Here, despite the availability of burnt ends and lean or fatter options, the brisket doesn't quite make my favorite list. It's dry, even with additional sauce, and often my mouth registers char. It's got the perfect pink smoke ring that indicates properly cooked brisket. It isn't bad, really. Just not my favorite. 

Pulled pork is better, whether on a sandwich or piled high on a platter. It's reliable but not quite as sweet and homey as the pork at Pork on a Fork or even the chain Famous Dave's. Writing that makes me sad. I want Bobby Q to just step it up and get a bit messier before I crown it Piggy Queen. 

Chicken is where this place takes me down south and leaves my face and fingers dirty and grinning. Smoked to silky perfection and then topped with the perfect amount of sauce, this is my guaranteed highlight whether I scarf down half the bird or get it pulled into juicy strands and chunks. 

The menu includes a host of southern favorites and even a few steakhouse classics. Side options include all the classics like a creamy potato salad with egg and mustard,  BBQ baked beans with generous bits of meat and heat, slaw, roasted vegetables and more. 

I've only managed to order one dessert here, a rich cheesecake with a caramel aroma that was brought out with four spoons for the table. That habit from well meaning servers gets my goat. If I wanted to share then I'd ask. Your bringing them out makes me look greedy. Quit that. 

Of course, the best dessert at Bobby Q isn't even on the menu. I confess, it's my favorite treat there. Servers bring out tiny brown paper lunch bags filled with hot cinnamon sugar donuts, barely the size of a donut hole. Imagine them crispy and spicy then melting on your tongue and floating into your tummy. Bliss. My only complaint? Hoggy pals who can't stop themselves from grabbing extras before the bag makes its greasy way around the table. 

One of the options I'm dying to try at Bobby Q is their Thanksgiving dinner to go. It includes a smoked turkey, a selection of holiday sides and easy instructions for a price you can't beat. Expect more catering options from them soon. Whether your group dines in house or takes the meal home, Bobby Q is sure to keep you saucy and content."
"I have to admit that I love the smoked meats at BobbyQ.  They are as close as I've had to real smoked brisket since I lived in Texas.  The cornbread is good and always comes with your meal.  Don't forget the mini doughnuts like you would get at the state fair that they bring with your final bill.  Sometimes the wait staff doesn't seem to know how to deliver great service and what is up with putting ice in the urinals?  It doesn't seem sanitary to do this, but the bathrooms are always clean, it's just the ice in the toilet is weird.  I would defiantly recommend this place to anyone for a beer or wine and smoked meats.  One of the best in Phoenix that's for sure!"

"My little brother and I are on a long road trip from Los Angeles to New Orleans and we had to go past Phoenix. As I was driving my little brother searched up a place to eat and he wanted to try some barbeque. 

We opted to try Bobby Q because another place was closed on Monday, and we thought the name + the numerous reviews was appealing. 

We made a reservation online for 2pm but when we arrived, it wasn't packed so we were just able to get seated easily for 2. They also have an outdoor patio area where you can sit and enjoy a waterfall, we almost sat there but we decided to let the host sit us wherever was most convenient for them. 

We were sat and asked what we wanted to drink by our waiter Chris(topher). He's got his greeting and mantra down, ""Have you been here before?"" 
Us: No we're just passing by.
Chris: ""Where are you all from?"" 
Us: Los Angeles area
Chris: ""Very cool, I'm from California, San Bernardino myself!""

I heard this repeated to other customers who sat down. He's a very personable waiter. 

We wanted to try a variety of things so my brother and I opted for the Whole Hog's Variety. It was about $54 but we already dented it. It came with a choice of a variety of different things but we chose: sausage, beef brisket, beef ribs, and St. Louis ribs.

Sausage: I thought it was good but nothing too special. Perhaps I'm just not a fan of sausages done this way, but by no means was it bad. 

Beef brisket: This was probably the star of the dish. It was amazingly delicious. It was very juicy and tender and the sauce didn't overpower the meat taste. This is something I highly recommend.

Beef Ribs: I'm a sucker for beef ribs, and these were so good the meat came off the bones easily. The flavor was a little bland but that was perfect, because the sauce provided the needed salt.

St Louis Pork Ribs: They were also really good and they melted off their bones, but the St. Louis pork ribs were too salty. I was only able to eat 2 because I couldn't keep eating it, but the flavors were good. 

For the sides we got the: Mac and cheese, corn, and pecan cole slaw.

I originally wanted more vegetables as a side because vegetables help compliment meat, but my little brother wanted the mac and cheese, and the corn. So I chose the cole slaw as a means to cut the richness of the different barbeque meats. 

The mac and cheese was very rich, and I couldn't eat too much of it because of how rich both the entree and the side was. 

I was also so-so with the corn, but as a disclaimer, I'm very impartial to corn to begin with. To me, unless it's naturally very sweet they're almost wasted calories. This was just a personal preference, but my brother wanted it.

The pecan cole slaw was perfect. If anything I would have liked a little more acidity in it, but it was such a good addition to the meal. After a bite of the rich pork ribs, the cole slaw really helps cleanse the palette. It was very refreshing. 

Overall we were very pleased by this restaurant. Our bill came out to be about $39 per person (tax and a hefty tip) but we probably had enough food to last 3 meals."
"Second time here. Our server, Abi was excellent. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and didn't miss a beat. Beef brisket sandwich was amazing! Mac n cheese is out of this world. "There's a damn good reason this place is close to 5 stars with over 3,000 reviews. 

Complimentary cornbread and donuts, impeccable service, moist and tender meats, mouthwatering sides....what other reasons do you need to try this place?

Checked out the lunch menu and they definitely offered great value meals. Boyfriend and I were looking at the 1/3 rack of ribs, but decided to split the whole rack of ribs with 2 sides, mac & cheese and shoestring fries. Erica recommended the mac & cheese and we couldn't have been any happier. With fives cheeses, it was so cheesy and creamy. 

Ribs were moist and fall-off-the-bone tender. They offered 3 types of made in house bbq sauce: regular, spicy and a vinegar based sauce. I liked mixing the spicy with the vinegar based. The added pepper to their shoestring fries made them great on their own. But since I love condiments, I dipped my fries in ranch and the bbq sauces because why not. 

I wish I was hungrier so I could have ordered off the dessert menu. But then all of a sudden a bag of complimentary cinnamon sugar donuts appeared on our table courtesy of Erica and all of a sudden, I had room for donuts. They were made fresh when we got them and they were crunchy and sweet and so satisfying for the end of the meal. I took the rest to go and had them throughout the day. 

I was out here for a Muay Thai competition and if we're planning do this tournament again, Bobby Q is a definite MUST for post fights."

I ordered a full slab of baby back ribs and they arrived hot, juicy and very flavorful. The portion of ribs was so big I ended up taking half home. My wife ordered the top sirloin medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. Again, a big steak that only got half eaten and the rest brought home. There BBQ sweet sauce is exceptional...try it!
Save room on the way home in the car for the extra special treat of a little bag of donuts given to you when you leave!"
"Bobby Q has an amazing atmosphere and delicious meats. The boyfriend and I went there for our third date, and again early May this year as we were in town for a friend's wedding. We shared the Whole Hog's Heaven both times. The ribs were our favorite this time (St Louis Pork Ribs tender and flavorful, and the Jumbo Beef Ribs sooo juicy). Sides were also amazing (mac n cheese to die for; seasonal veggies grilled with a perfect hint of smokiness). The corn bread wasn't quite as solid and buttery as we remembered from two and a half years ago, but service made up for that, and they had sent us home both times with with our doggie bags and complementary mini donuts to go :) This is definitely one of our favorite restaurants in Phoenix, and we will look forward to coming back when we are in the Phoenix area again."
"Best steak & lobster in Phoenix. Our go to restaurant! Service is A+, great atmosphere prefect for a night out."
"I didn't know once I stepped into this dimly lit, vivacious establishment that my life would be changed forever. From the groovy bangers to the tender, well-seasoned meats, Bobby Q has everything you ever wished for in a restaurant. 
However, the grandeur of the restaurant does not stop there. After indulging in some moist corn bread, I decided that I wanted a cocktail that would freshen my night up. But there were so many choices in their diverse menu, how could I ever choose? I was set on ordering the Watermelon Cooler, and called over a mysterious waiter, Dylan, to tell him my order. Little did I know his service and demeanor would be the spark in my sudden revelation. Dylan was the amalgamation of Paul Rudd, Chris Pratt, and Chris Evans and quite frankly any other marvel super hero with confidence, bravery, and class. Once I ordered, he respectively gave me his opinion on my drink choice, saying that it was not one of his favorites, and steered me in the right direction with the El Chingo, a smokey, zesty vanilla and cinnamon wonderland. He said that if this drink wasn't for me, he would also give me the cooler with no added charge. Trusting his confident opinion, I went with the Chingo and was blown away by the flavor explosion. From then on our whole dining experience was taken to another level by his helpful comments and playful aura. Our server, Dylan, has sparked some self-reflection in myself that I didn't know I needed. I came to Bobby Q's looking to have a delightful meal with my family, which was easily achieved, but have left this fine establishment with a new outlook on life and humanity."
"We were traveling from Los Angeles, California and we were passing Phoenix,AZ. We were so glad that we passed by here in Bobby Q. We were seated quickly and our waitress, Sarah, was very accommodating and friendly. She gave us a thorough rundown of the menu and recommended her favorites. She also helped us choose our items since we told her we couldn't eat pork. The food came out in a timely manner and was piping hot! Everything was delicious. My personal favorite was the beef ribs. The meal also came with complimentary cornbread (before the meal) and donuts (after). 5/5, would highly recommended this place if you're ever in the Phoenix area. Definitely coming back!"

The place wasn't too busy on a Thursday night but I stood at the front podium for what felt like 3-4 minutes with waiters, hosts, bartenders buzzing around me doing things, chatting with each other and not even noticing I was standing there waiting. They finally sat me but then I waited another 9 minutes (this time I kept my eye on my watch) to get greeted and brought a menu. I was dining on my own as I travel for work and have noticed that when you are a table of one, you get kind of forgotten about. 

I ordered the Q rolls, which, oh my god, GET THE Q ROLLS!!!! So tender and juicy and the dipping sauces are great. I also got the ribeye which was delicious as well. The cornbread was one of the best cornbread I have ever had. I even got to take home two little complimentary donuts. 

This place has ALL of the right ingredients to be a favorite but I just wish service was a bit more attentive. However, I would definitely visit back next time I am in Phoenix."

"One of the most popular BBQ places around. When we're here, it's protein time! The meat from the baby back ribs was super tender, and easily fell off the bone - just the way I like it. The beef brisket was also tender, and very flavorful. "I'll go 4.5/5 for this one.  I've eaten BBQ all over the country, and I can't say Bobby Q is ""as good as it gets"", but they are pretty darn good.  Almost 3 weeks ago Mr. M and I met up with Tim S. and his family to give this place a try.  

Right away I was impressed with the friendly service, and the hostess was helpful when we needed to add a high chair to the table.  Our server was Kanisha and she did a great job and was on point with taking our orders, making sure our drinks weren't empty, and bringing us togo boxes and the check when we were ready.  

We wanted to be able to try a wide variety of items so we started with the Q-rolls ($10.50), which are absolutely delicious.  Brisket wrapped up like an egg roll?  Heck yeah!  Those disappeared quickly.  We also started with their house beer, which if memory serves is an amber ale and that was a nice, easy to drink beer.  Really enjoyed that as well.  The smaller one is $4.95 and the larger one is $6.00, so the moral of that story is, go for the big one!

I ordered the BBQ chicken/prime rib combo ($34) which came with 3 sides.  I chose the loaded baked potato, mac & cheese, and the ranch beans.  Mr. M ordered the 3 meat combo ($25) with pulled pork, brisket, and some ribs.  

I thought I would waddle out of the joint stuffed to the gills, but we actually had so much fun talking that I didn't eat nearly as much as I thought I would.  Here's what I thought of the food:  Prime rib, chicken, and ribs:  Excellent!  Brisket: very good.  Pulled pork and ranch beans: really nothing going on there.  Very little flavor in the pork, and the beans tasted syrupy and had no BBQ flavor.  The other sides we had were very good.  I could OD on the mac & cheese.  Nicely done.

Lunch was pricey if you look at the receipt total of $93.63 after tax, before tip, but we had a lot of leftovers.  Overall we had a great experience and I would go back any time."
"Went here last night for dinner and the experience was...okay. Service was great, drinks were great but the food was lacking. Really wanted some killer BBQ and was let down. My wife got the chicken sandwich and I got the 2 meat combination plate. The chicken sandwich was sort of sweet tasting and the chicken didn't taste grilled. The 2 meats I got were the brisket and the baby back ribs. I got mash potatoes and broccoli on the side. Both meats has no smoke rings. Honestly they both tasted like they were put in a slow cooker. Yes it was fall of the bone meat but it fell off like it definitely was put in a crock pot or something originally. Not much flavor or smokiness. The BBQ sauce was okay but not for a BBQ restaurant. The broccoli was not cooked enough. The mash was okay. 

Sorry, never coming back intentionally. Was very expensive for the quality."

"I come from the Midwest and have high expectations for bbq, and believe me Bobby Q didn't disappoint. "A few years back I had seen this cool looking building surrounded by a trees...behind of all things in Phoenix....a scuba dive shop.  I had no idea exactly what it was.  That was until this time around (2018), when we busted out the oracle that is yelp and learned that is ""Bobby Q.""  A play on BBQ....rightfully so.

Craving MEAT....we opted to pay this location a visit after some afternoon baseball. We parked in the front which was actually the back and enjoyed the greenery.

There was no issues what so ever on getting a table.  Fast and friendly service.  The interior is hard to describe.  I can only say that it is very cozy.  Every employee there was all smiles and working their tails off.  Our server...damn, if I can remember her name and I lost my receipt....she was awesome!  Happy and quick to suggest something tasty when we asked her.

The first thing she confirmed after we ordered was the ""Q-Rolls,""  These were delicious pastry style rolls with delicious brisket tucked inside.  They were served with a delicious chipotle sauce.  I was so enamored with them, I forgot to take pictures of anything else....with exception of a delicious coconut mojito, we had ordered prior.

Next up was the ""The Whole Hog Heaven,""  the GF and I split this amazing plate of BBQ.  It consisted of Baby Back Ribs....so tender the bones popped right out.  Beef ribs of which I devoured.  Pulled pork and Prime Brisket with mac-n-cheese and pecan coleslaw.  All for $51.

We were drunk on BBQ.  So good was what I can only say is the single greatest BBQ experience I have ever had, we chowed until there was nothing left.  NOTHING!

No meat sweats.....maybe just a little.  It was meat nirvana that was complimented by a visit from taylor.  Not sure exactly what his role in the experience is.  I can only saw he is a BBQ sage who wants to help you transition from the physical to the spiritual side of smoked deliciousness.

So full....no desert was ordered.  No matter....Bobby Q has a marvelous little doughnut machine and you are given a complimentary bag of tasty, fried dough.

Wherever we stay next year....you can bet your bottom dollar, we will pay Bobby ""Budda"" Q a visit.........."
"Went twice while in Phoenix for two weeks,  the pulled pork was spectacular. The smoasted half chicken was good but I'd rather have the pulled pork."

"Oh my God! The baby back ribs. The pecan cole slaw. The corn bread (complimentary with your meal) and the fresh hot mini cinnamon-spiced donuts that are given to you on the way out. This was a near perfect experience, the service, the food, the awesome exterior...everything!"
"I consider myself a BBQ connoisseur, traveled to many places in search of some of the best BBQ places, I know Texas, Kansas City, Memphis, and North Carolina are the BBQ capitals of the US.  I would say Bobby Q's is more like Kansas City style than anything else.  They drown the sauce all over the meats, in which hides the true flavors of the smoked meats.  I have heard about this place many times, and finally gave it a try since my co-worker raved about this place, and said it was voted as one of the best in AZ.  In which, I respectfully disagree BIG TIME.  That honor would go to Little Miss BBQ in Phoenix.  I would say even Rudy's, Joe's, and Famous Dave's is far superior.  So let's get into my review.

I came to this place on a Saturday afternoon with my wife and my brother.  We noticed the building off the I-17, it felt older and had a BBQ smell about it, in which I enjoyed.  The dining room was dark and  had an older feel to it.  We decided to sit outside.  One thing that I did notice is the chairs are very old and falling apart.  I had to move some chairs around cause a few of them had BBQ stains on them.  Anyways, I'm at a BBQ joint, so I don't let that stuff bother me, it's almost to be expected.  We ordered the Hog Heaven and fried chicken dish.  The Hog Heaven consisted of half a rack of spare ribs, 2 beef ribs, some pulled pork, and prime brisket.  It also came with 3 sides in which we ordered shoe string potatoes, mac and cheese and a baked potato.  There was also corn bread for the table.  My wife enjoyed her fried chicken dish, but thought the sides were a little bland and mashed potatoes could of used more butter and salt.  My experience  with the Hog Heaven was just ok.  When enjoying BBQ, I normally don't like ribs completely falling off the bone, and the pulled pork was completely doused with sauce, and the brisket was extremely tender.  I'm not trying to be a BBQ snob, but I like ""competition style"" BBQ.  Ribs should be tender, but hold up.  You should be able to take a bite and not completely fall off the bone, and the same with brisket.  It should be able to pull it apart and be tender and moist on the pallet.  The brisket completely fell apart and was too covered with too much BBQ sauce.  We were served two beef ribs, but one barely had any meat on it, (See Picture).  For 50.00 for the Hog Heaven, I truly didn't feel it was worth the price.  The sides were ok, but how hard is it to screw up fries, and a baked potato.  The mac and cheese was good though.  Overall, our experience was ok, nothing to rave about, but I'm glad I had a chance to experience Bobby Q and see what all the fuss was about.

In conclusion, I'm more of a sauce on the side kind of guy.  I truly enjoy BBQ and enjoy the smoked flavor and the tenderness of the meats.  The sauce should be on the side and help accentuate the meat, not completely covering the meats.  Why smoke BBQ for 6 to 15 hours if you are just going to ruin the flavor?  In the area, there aren't a lot of great BBQ places, but I would give this place another shot, I would just order the sauce on the side.  I love's Joe BBQ in gilbert, but I've had a bad experience, where the meat was a little dry, so I would give this a try again."
"This is one of my favorite places to go for steak & ambiance. The waiters are professional & genuinely friendly, not fake friendly. Our food was brought to us in a timely matter & was delicious!"
"This is hands down one of the best bbq joints west of the Mississippi. Their food is no secret in the Phx area. More than likely you will have to wait for a table that is unless you show up at opening. Reservations available through Yelp, but if your party is larger than 6, a phone call is in order. There were 7 in our party. 6:30pm reservations on a Sunday and we showed up to a full house. Tried walking in on Saturday eve but the wait time was 2 hours for 5 people. 

The bbq is delicious. I went with the Whole Hog Heaven, $56 and split with my wife. 2 styles of ribs with some brisket. I had lots of leftovers. No way I was leaving that bbq behind. I brought it back to Cali with me. Everything was good. My friends enjoyed their meals and thanked me for pointing them in right direction. If it weren't for me they would have eaten that so called bbq up the road at one of those roadhouse joints. 

This is not a sports bar type atmosphere. There are a couple of small TVs by the bar. Great cocktails available as well. Make sure to get some of their fresh mini donuts on the way out. 

Also, kid friendly for those traveling with kiddos. Parking lot is huge, which means full lot equals full house."

"Over the years that I've lived in AZ, I've driven by this restaurant many times. It's barely visible from I-17.  It's name reminded me of a chain back in So Cal know as Bobby McGee's which was so, so - so . . . I wasn't particularly eager to give it a try, that is, until ready other reviews here on Yelp.  

It is indeed quite pricey especially for a BBQ joint but it has a cool vibe with a large outdoor brick wall patio and an inviting interior. It reminds me of visiting somebody's home but entering through the backyard.

The BBQ is pretty good in my humble opinion.  I'm not from a BBQ state but I've been lucky to sample some good fare in places like North Carolina, Texas and even Colorado.  Bobby Q's is really tasty and well prepared.  Always tender, perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection.

As others have mentioned, their portions are quite sizable which makes them perfect for sharing which in turn brings the per serving price down.  

This is a great place for a large family celebration but order carefully or you'll end up with a huge bill and a lot of leftovers."
"Bobby Q is the best BBQ food I've ever had hands down! Always great food, great service and a friendly atmosphere. Their ribs are very meaty and fall off the bones. Best Mac n Cheese ever and the corn bread cakes always delicious! I would recommend Bobby Q to anyone. Never disappoints!"

"Bobby Q is an excellent BBQ restaurant in Phoenix.  The portions are large and the food is tasty.  

We recently went and shared a rack of St Louis ribs, brisket, corn bread, mac and cheese, a smokehouse burger and fries.

The ribs and brisket were good.  The mac and cheese was creamy and delicious.  The corn bread was soft and fresh.  The fries were the perfect size.  But the best of the best was the smoke house burger.  It was a huge patty on an awesome toasted bun.  It came with shoestring onion stack, bbq sauce, and cheese. "I'll say up front that, being a Texas BBQ fan (and resident), I was a bit skeptical of BBQ here in the desert, but I was here with a group from work, and they were footing the bill, so here we go. 

First up at the table, following beverage service, were baskets of little round cornbread rolls, a little smaller than hockey pucks, but far more tasty. They were a little sweet, but not overwhelmingly so, baked to a golden brown, and great with the supplied whipped butter. 

For the main course, I ordered a three meat plate with sliced brisket, ribs, and sausage, with a side of mac and cheese. Here's the rundown:

Brisket: This, alone with the other meats, had sauce already applied (I forgot to ask for it to be omitted), but it wasn't slathered with it. The meat was a tad bit dry, but it was what we call in Texas ""lean brisket"", so that was to be expected. It did, however, have good smoke and a pleasant flavor all around. It was also well seasoned, as were the other two meats. A good start to the meal!

Ribs: These were smallish, still ""assembled"", and looked quite nice. Upon digging in, they were a slight bit overcooked (definitely the ""falling off of the bone"" phase), but the meat was tender without being mushy, and it also had good smoke and flavor. There was also a quite nice meat to bone ratio. 

Sausage: The weakest of a decent spread of meats, this was a medium grind that wasn't overly ""Eckrich-y"", had good smoke, but the flavor just didn't wow me. 

Mac & cheese: A fairly standard offering, it did have a good, strong cheese flavor and creamy texture, but the pasta was overdone . 

This was really a nice meal. After the main service, a few bags of little donuts, sprinkled with sugar, arrived at the table. They were hot, fresh, and VERY tasty. It would have been totally easy to just eat the whole bag, but I limited myself to three :). Definitely check this place out if you want some decently good BBQ in the Phoenix area."
"This is the best bbq I had my entire life. Whenever I go to Arizona, this will be my go to place."

"I recently tried the new Bobby Q and I wanted to try the original.  The outside is run down and off a side road, so get your GPS out if you are not from the area. "Where do I start?!?

Made reservations for 5:45pm and arrived right on time and was seated promptly right at the side by side tables in front of the bar.  It wasn't too busy but there were plenty of patrons in the restaurant. 

Jared was our server and he was LEGIT!! We were welcomed by him and asked if we had ever been to a Bobby Q's to which the answer was no. He gave a quick background about the restaurant chain and how it came about. Advised their angus steaks are aged 60 days and cut in-house and their BBQ meats are smoked for 22hrs (Pretty sure those were the timeframes but I could be wrong). Went over the menu and gave the drink menu. 

Started out with the Cajun Shrimp appetizer 
-shrimp not over cooked
-sautéed in butter cajun seasoning and beer
-garlic bread 
Holy crap this was soooo good!! The shrimp was ""juicy"" which is not something I would ever describe shrimp as but I'm not quite sure how else to describe it. It was DELICIOUS and not tough or chewy. I'm a sauce fanatic and I literally wanted to drink the sauce out of the dish but didn't think that was appropriate so I opted to just dip the garlic bread in the sauce 

The cornbread was dense and sweet and didn't fall apart - yummmmy

Dinner came out within 10 min, right after the shrimp was finished. I got the pick 2 meats as suggested by Jared because I couldn't decide between the beef brisket or the pulled pork - and with the pick 2 I got both!!  The pulled pork was my FAVORITE of the 2. It was fall off the fork tender and melted in my mouth. Again since I'm a sucker for good sauce I asked for more BBQ sauce to which Jared brought out both spicy and regular. The spicy wasn't too spicy at all and had just the perfect amount of ""spice"", that was my favorite of the two BBQ sauces.  I dipped my potato in the bbq sauce and even my mac and cheese it was so good I could drink it!

For my sides I had the loaded baked potato without chives and the mac and cheese. 
Baked Potato - The skin was baked with salt which is my fav!! 
I asked for a side of butter since it came with just sour cream, bacon bits and shredded cheese. It was good but just a standard baked tater and since I seem to love extra condiments I personally could have went for more sour cream and cheese but I'm not going to complain. My friend had the ranch baked beans and next time those are what I will get in place of the baked potato. 

Mac n cheese -creamy and thick. Rich in flavor but not too rich - I loved it and will def order again

Let me tell you how much I loved the music!! It included 80's pop Deniece Williams-Let's hear it for the boy, Motown; The Supremes, 80's rock; Loverboy-Turn me loose, Katrina and the Waves-Walkin on sunshine, Dusty Springfield-Son of a Preacher Man, Wild Child-Play that funky music white boy, Evelyn King-love come down, Queen and the list of awesome music goes on and on!!

Had a perfect front row view of the 76ers vs Rockets game and all. 

Christy, one of the managers came to check on us about halfway through dinner to make sure everything was great and make sure everything was acceptable 

Lots of drink choices and I couldn't choose just 1, so I got 3 :-)

Watermelon cooler with tajín rim - Strong but delicious 

Q-lada -Toasted coconut rim with some type of coconut cream and Pieces of strawberries blended 
Cannot taste any alcohol in it with the light rum and it was super delicious and refreshing 

Pineapple Passion - Served in a frozen pineapple with a dried pineapple slice and tangerine slice
Creamy and strong but delicious - similar to a pina colada

Between the busser(s) and Jared, the empty plates were cleared promptly 

Dessert, I was so full from shoveling all the delicious eats in my face but, I couldn't pass up their dessert!!  I got the banana sub zero square with warm caramel drizzle.  It's frozen banana pudding with a graham cracker walnut cinnamon bottom crust (I think that's what the crust was, that's what it tastes like). It was also very good but I could only eat a few bites and opted for a to go box to enjoy later. 

Christy came by after we finished dessert to see how everything was and even got my dessert to go box!

Never felt rushed at any point throughout dinner/drinks/dessert. 

I didn't want to leave and felt like I could hangout here all night!! But, after 2 hours I figured I better get my a$$ up so other people can enjoy this place just as much as I did!!

Just when you think it cannot get any better, our check showed up with a bag of FRESH, HOT donuts fried in peanut oil and covered in cinnamon sugar!!  OMG! I couldn't wait to eat them later even though I had ZERO space for anything else. I had to eat just 1 while it was hot and it literally MELTED in my mouth. 

Bobby Q's, you have a fan in me!! I loved every single aspect of my experience and anytime I'm back in Phoenix I WILL BE BACK!!"

"As far as the BBQ goes, it was very ordinary, but they had some proper platter deals and lunch specials. Plus complimentary corn bread to start off the meal! They also usually have complimentary mini doughnuts to end the meal, but unfortunately the fryer wasn't turned on before opening when we arrived and it wasn't hot enough by the time we were ready to leave... so the fact that I had declined the second helping of corn bread (which came with our platter) all so I could save room for the doughnuts was not well planned out. 

In any case, again... the BBQ was rather run-of-the-mill and perhaps some items were overcooked, but they're all about their sauce here. We ordered the *Platter Sampler* since it was a great way to try out their wares. We selected brisket, baby back ribs, and St. Louis style ribs for our meat choices and a mac as our side. Our server asked if we wanted their Original or Spicy BBQ sauces and she obliged when we requested for both. They give you relatively large vats of this sauce, so you basically are smothering everything in it. Otherwise, the baby back ribs were probably the most impressive. Good tender meat with that overcooked, fall-off-the-bone quality. The sauce on the St. Louis ribs wasn't anything I was accustomed too; a bit astringent and not exactly vinegary. The brisket was pretty boring, dry, and over cooked. Again, the sauce helped greatly to enhance its quality. 

We also sampled a bit of their lunch special for $9.95, the *BLC Sandwich* aka the bacon, lettuce, and CHICKEN. It was a very good deal and the one half we consumed was actually rather tasty; meaty and juicy chicken with a large helping of bacon, lettuce, and sauce. 

Service was fantastic and the outdoor patio was relaxing and comfortable with the cushions, although said cushioning was kind of grody and caked with spilled food. There's a lot of BBQ in Phoenix and this one is very much well-loved by the locals. Again, not real BBQ in my opinion, but you go for the ambiance... and good deals!"
"As visitors from the Los Angeles area, my family and I were very impressed! We ordered a combo that we were able to share -- top sirloin, ribs, baked potato, onion strings, mixed vegetables, and mac & cheese. Everything was grilled to perfection -- the sirloin was flavorful and tender, and the ribs were falling off the bone with amazing flavor as well. The mac & cheese was the best I've tasted anywhere, and the corn bread was moist with the perfect amount of sweetness.

All in all, it was a great experience. The ambiance is also very welcoming, with an artistic flair. We will most definitely be back if we visit the Phoenix area in the future!"

"This was a great find for barbecue in Phoenix. The large restaurant is tucked away in a residential neighborhood but very popular as there was a 20 minute wait at 8pm in a Monday night.

When you sit down they bring you complimentary hot cornbread and butter which melts in your mouth. Baked potato comes loaded with sour cream, butter, bacon, cheese and chives - it was amazing. We had the ice box banana cream pie for desert and one was big enough to share. They also bring piping hot fresh mini cinnamon sugar  donuts in a brown sack at the end of the meal.

Service was excellent too! Food was brought out very fast and piping hot. The visit by the manager after our food was served to check to see if we needed anything was a nice touch.

We cannot wait to come back - the chicken also looked fabulous!"

"This review has me a little torn. I ordered take out for my Mother's 89th birthday. A combo of meats by the pound, brisket and pulled pork. Pecan coleslaw and a half pan of apple cobbler. 

Ordering was a breeze over the phone and they emailed a credit card authorization form just in case I needed another family member to pick up.

Arriving the day of and most of the meal had been packed I just had to wait for the cobbler for a few minutes. Everything was packed nicely and they had wrapped the extra sauces in plastic wrap to avoid spills.

I must say the bbq was outstanding. Brisket tender and pulled pork was fantastic. Probably the best I ever had. I was a little surprised that the meats had been sauced though. Don't get me wrong their sauce is delicious but the proteins were so flavorful it didn't need any sauce.

Now the coleslaw was good but it didn't have any pecans as advertised on the menu. Another family member said they usually put the nuts in a cup to add but we didn't have any.

The cobbler. Looked picture perfect. Looked. Apples and sauce perfectly seasoned and the apples held their shape with a touch of crispness still. The crust was good along the edges but the middle was raw. Completely raw. 

Next time we will just order proteins because they truly were delicious. The sides left a lot to be desired. And when you pay $17 for coleslaw it should be perfect."
