The filet mignon is always cooked perfectly and the mud pie is also so good. This will always be my first recommendation for amazing bbq!
Good food but expect to spend some $$.  2 of us dined during the Early Bird time zone (3 until 5:30pm) when the filet mignon with one side is $12 (vs. $34.95?). When the bill arrived it was just over $80 because the waitress didn't put the order through with Early Bird pricing (even though when we checked in at 5:17pm I stated we were there for the Early Bird program and was told in the past that as long as you are seated by 5:30pm you qualify for the special prices. Thankfully the manager straightened this out and adjusted the bill but the moral is you can enjoy a delicious dinner at a reasonable price if you get there early enough (and I believe Early Bird dining is only available on weekdays).  I've not been impressed with their limited and not exactly appealing appetizer specials at Happy Hour...just my personal opinion.
"Wow what a great experience we had here! I'm not usually very impressed by BBQ, but this was awesome. The food was great- we split the 3 meat option with pork, brisket (we asked for it chopped), and sausage with asparagus, Mac and cheese, and Brussels. The meats were so tender and the sauce made it even better. Our server Devin was so kind and helpful. And then the complimentary homemade donuts! A pleasant surprise! 10/10 will definitely go again."
"Great meal!  Excellent service, Blake is a fantastic server!  We really enjoyed our family Christmas Eve Eve dinner!"
"I was passing through Phoenix after being on the road all morning and looking up yelp for ""best places to eat"" Bobby Q came up way up there on top. I made a reservation through yelp, but it was honestly not really necessary as it wasn't that busy being a Monday afternoon and all. 

We were promptly seated by the manager and our server came by soon after. The table was a bit wobbly and our server went off to find something to stuff underneath one of the legs to make it more stable. It was still wobbly but A for effort I guess haha.

The brisket is hands down the best I've ever eaten. I've never had a brisket so moist and juicy in my life. If I could turn back time I would have just exclusively ordered a whole tray of it. The BBQ slathered ribs were good, but I'm not a fan of sweet foods. The saving grace is that all the meats were perfectly cooked with the meat sliding right off the bone.

If I ever pass through Phoenix again I'll for sure be coming back here."
"This is probably best barbecue I've ever had. The corn bread is amazing. I got the St. Louis ribs, they wee fall of the bone. I got the Mac and cheese as a side. Every thing was great.  All the people working there were very friendly."
"I have wanted to try Bobby Q for years and finally had the opportunity with some friends. It's a really good place for BBQ!

I made a reservation (they get an extra shout out for being on Open Table) and it's a good thing I did. 6:15 on a Wednesday and the place was packed and many people waiting to be seated. We were promptly seated thanks to my reservation. 

Our server came by to take our drink order and asked if we wanted any appetizers. Knowing what we would most likely be in for food wise, we skipped the appetizers and went right to dinner. 

To drink I ordered sweet iced tea. $2.00 I love this stuff and order it wherever, whenever I can!  

Though we skipped the appetizers, we did order salads which were really great, $5.50. Ranch house salad, my favorite type anywhere. Crisp lettuce, cheese, tomato, red onion and ranch dressing. Simple and delicious! 

My friends split the Whole Hog Heaven platter. They could choose two kinds of ribs, two meats and three sides. They ended up ordering double ribs and double brisket. There was so much food that four people could have easily split it. $48.00

Being a prime rib fan, I had to go for it. I ordered the smoked 10oz slab $26.00. It was outstanding! I was a little afraid the smoked flavor would overpower the meat...Not at all. It was just right. My entree came with two sides so I had mac and cheese and potato salad. Both outstanding! 

Dessert was tempting as mud pie was available which I would normally go for. There just wasn't room after all that food! We did however receive a complimentary bag of mini doughnuts. Served hot and dusted with cinnamon and sugar. Delicious and just right. You can take those home if you want. 

Everything about our evening at Bobby Q was outstanding. We were taken very good care of by our server and management checked on us a couple of times. Special shout out to one of the managers on duty Donnie. He was very friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we were enjoying our evening. Nice touch! 

Be sure to try Bobby Q! It won't disappoint! Look for the Mesa location opening soon! 

Enjoy!"
"Took my GF there for Valentine's Day. The decor was fantastic, the waitress was very attentive, and the food was absolutely delicious. We will definitely be back!"
"This was the first barbecue place we tried after moving to PHX and were pleasantly surprised. The ribs were super tender, the pulled pork was juicy and the filet steak was cooked perfectly.  Homemade cinnamon sugar donuts are complementary at the end of the meal. We had great service and the lunch crowd was busy but not packed on a Saturday. All in all a good experience."

"Best bbq ever. I take everyone I know to this little gem. I live in Phoenix and drive the hour and a half, totally worth it. Very casual, cozy, patio. And you can explore Jerome after you eat. Best afternoon trip!"
"Looking for some BBQ in Phoenix? You have to check out Bobby Q's! From the moment we arrived the staff was welcoming and attentive throughout our entire dinner. Our server was in training and had a trainer shadowing her. We would not have known it was one of her first days, with how professional she was and how well she knew the menu too. 

The restaurant is rather large and would be a perfect place to host large group gatherings. We dined outside on their beautiful patio. 

Now on to the food, I highly recommend coming hungry. I don't think they know what small portions are here. My colleagues and I ordered the texas toast as an appetizer to start and it was delicious. We then ordered our meals and I ordered the shrimp entree that comes with two sides. I choose the mac and cheese as the server had highlight recommend it. I also ordered the mashed potatoes. While the mac and cheese was nothing special the shrimp was amazing and the mashed potatoes were pretty good too. My colleagues ordered the meat sampler and had a ton of food for two people. With the large portion size you really get a bang for your buck. 

At the end of your meal before you leave they offer a surprise mini donuts in a bag. Such a fun way to end the dining experience and what a nice surprise! These were rather tasty too! 

Tip... if you check in on Yelp you get a 10% off deal."
"Seriously the BEST Baby Back Ribs I have ever had. I'm not joking. Tender, flavorful, fall off the bone, perfect amount of flavor and sauce.  Delicious.  The owner stopped by our table and ask if everything was fine. He was hustling. They really take the time to make sure everyone's meal was delicious and everyone is having a good time."
"One of the few places in Phoenix where we enjoy eating out. They have consistent good service and good food at a reasonable price. What's not  to like?

"A group of us visited Arizona over the weekend and this was the only spot in my bookmarks we got to try :( we made reservations for a Sunday at 7pm and when we all sat down the football game was just near ending. My bf and I shared the whole hog deal ($56) based on reviews .. since I was the one who recommended this place, I recommended this deal for everyone (in pairs) and boy, we had full plates by the time we were all stuffed. In my opinion, this is a 3-4 people to share deal for the average person. Reviews said 2-3 but I would disagree. Nonetheless, we took home a bunch of leftovers and then forgot all of it in the fridge when we drove back to Cali. So those few ribs, brisket, and sides were all that I would get to experience and I can truthfully say, I am devastated. It was so yummy and the sides all made me happy. The price would have been great if we could have shared so that was our fault for over ordering and then forgetting it all. 

Our waiter Johan was great. We have no complaints and he was really friendly and gave us the best tiny cinnamon donuts I've ever tasted and a few extra to go.. still dreaming about these :( would recommend to all my friends visiting Arizona!"

"Went here while in town not too long ago... came on a weekend for lunch around 12:30pm. It was lively, but not too busy. However, by the time we left there was a line of customers waiting to be seated. 

From beginning to end, the service was great.. our drinks were always kept filled, we were checked on routinely, and our orders were ready in a timely manner..

Omg the food is soooo good. We opted for their feast type meal... we got baby back ribs, chicken, and brisket with Mac&cheese, coleslaw, and corn.. we also got broccolini and of course their cornbread.... 

The cornbread was a bit crumbly, but otherwise super warm and moist.. so delicious with butter and a little bit of honey. The sides were all flavorful and still simple, which I love.. the brisket was juicy and so tender you can cut it easily with a fork.. the baby back ribs fell off the bone.. and the chicken was delicious but definitely not the star.. 

For dessert, we shared a mud pie which would satisfy any chocolate/cookie lover.. and to top things off, our bill came with a small bag of fresh made mini donuts.. mind blown. 

My family and I really enjoyed our experience here and wish I didn't live so far!"

I ordered for take out and ordered the QRolls a 3 meat combo of: baby back ribs (so tender it literally falls right off the bone), brisket (so tender,  it melts in your mouth), and the spicy sausage (not spicy at all but really flavorful), a side of mac n cheese, and steak cut fries * both are so good.

"I drove all the way from Los Angeles to see a concert at Ak Chin Pavilion yesterday, but I had to scan Phoenix to find a special restaurant to try since it's not every day I will be in the area. Needless to say, I found what I was looking for and it exceeded every expectation.

First off, the atmosphere is very much like a roadhouse and I dig the individual lamps over each table. Sharli, my waitress, was very friendly, talkative and attentive to both me and my friend. She answered every question of mine with a lot of detail and built up the food even more, because I wasn't already hyped up enough. 

Now for the food! Let me begin by saying how amazing the cornbread was. With it's slightly crusty outside, mildly crumbly yet soft center and buttery melt in your mouth flavor I can honestly say it was as close to perfect as you can get. I ordered the 3 meat combo with brisket, baby back ribs, smoked sausage, mac n cheese, baked beans and an additional side of hickory smoked mesquite veggies. Every single bite of this meal was heavenly. The brisket was like butter. It was so tender and full of flavor. The ribs were cooked to perfection. I could not even pull out a bone with any real amount of meat on it. The bones just slid out and the flavor put me on cloud nine. The sausage was very smoky and just bursting with flavor. It had that nice snap when you bite into it. Assuring you that this sausage is the real deal. The baked beans were very flavorful and the little tidbits of brisket inside just amplified the falvor even more. The mesquite veggies made me want all of my veggies prepared like this. My vegan sister would go nuts for these! Last, but most certainly not least, the mac n cheese would satisfy any king or god on any planet and in any galaxy. The cheesiness and creaminess balance was absolutely on point and it blew every other mac n cheese I have ever had out of the water.

Needless to say, this was one of the best meals I have ever had. Every single 5 star review is justified. If you love bbq, or just amazing food in general, you owe it to yourself to come here if you are anywhere near Phoenix. 

One last thing, they give you free mini donuts with your check! They, like everything else I ate, were super yummy!"

"My girlfriend from Oregon and I had a delicious meal at Bobby Qs restaurant tonight. Initially, we had a minor situation with the menus each having different prices. The manager was very gracious and offered us the lower-priced menu.  Very professional and very friendly. 
LeeAnne was our server and she was a 10.  ‼‼My girlfriend ordered a steak sandwich. The steak was grilled to perfection with a glazed caramelized sauce that brought out the steak's flavors. "After regularly passing the building and commenting that we ""have to try it out"" we finally ended up at BobbyQ's for lunch. Our waiter, Oliver, was delightfully patient with all 9 of us ladies, some of who couldn't make up their minds. The place is big and open with little to dampen the sound so it was a noisy lunch hour. This turned out not to be a problem--it just meant the other half of our group didn't know we were talking about them! Baskets of yummy warm cornbread appeared on the table and just as magically disappeared. So good!! I ordered the brisket sandwich. The meat was plentiful and it arrived with sauce already on it. It was a little dry and I would have appreciated extra sauce on the table but I was so busy eating I forgot to take a picture. Everyone enjoyed their selections although the brisket won the popularity contest. I enjoyed my lunch and the whole experience. While I couldn't finish my sandwich, I did did not turn down the complimentary warm donuts that suddenly arrived. The food was good, our waiter was great and I enjoyed the atmosphere. I'll be back."

"QUICKIE REVIEW
Come on in here and get some of this smoked BBQ goodness.

FOOD
This is what I tried:
-Q-rolls
-Whole hog heaven

This place couldn't help but to knock it out the park right from the start.  The cornbread they give you does not need butter or anything extra added to it.  Just enjoy as is.  Then the Q-rolls, soft crispy outside with brisket that melts in your mouth on the inside.  Then came time for whole hog heaven.
Wow, just wow.  Warning, this is going to be a LOT of food.   It can definitely feed two and maybe an additional two depending on how hearty the eaters are.  For the ribs, I recommend people try the St. Louis style (server can explain what it is) and nothing else.  You are supposed to pick two ribs, I am saying make that both your options.  Same thing for the two meats, make them both beef brisket.  In with all of the meat I had there it was smoked to perfection and if there a bone involved, meat fell right off of it.  Everything really seemed to just melt in your mouth if it did not already do so in your hand from being so soft and tender.   

PARKING
They have a whole parking lot that they own.  No shortage of parking.

SERVICE
Our waiter was good to go.  He was the one to recommend the Q-rolls and gave us the broke down of everything else.  Service was prompt and polite as it should be.

PRICE
For two, everything was under a $100.  To which I want to add I ate it later for dinner and breakfast the next day. 

TIP/OTHER THOUGHTS
When you are done with the meal and are leaving, they give you these heavenly donuts fried in peanut oil.   Man oh man.  Yes, just yes."
"Ordered the Thanksgiving meal for 3-4 people for $75.  Came with grilled corn,  creamy mashed red potatoes, gravy and corn bread.  Wasn't the best meal I had but def would order this again.  Loved smoked turkey for a change than the traditional oven-baked Turkey."
"When I saw quite a few of my Yelp friends checked in at Bobby Q, I definitely couldn't pass up a chance to go. We went on a Friday night and the wait for a table was about an hour and a half. This was a little bit longer than expected, however we figured we would grab a drink and wait. After seeing how large the drinks were that others around us had ordered, we decided on just one cocktail called Shipwrecked. It was large and pretty sweet with a blue raspberry-coconut flavor. Since this was the type of fruity drink I typically gravitate towards, I was satisfied and would get it again.

Their estimate on the wait time was fairly accurate so about an hour & a half later, we were seated at a table on their outside patio. Our waiter was friendly and came by our table immediately. He went over the menu items and suggested some of the meat plates and sides. I ended up getting a Pulled BBQ Chicken Sandwich with a side of Mac & Cheese (which multiple servers seemed to be recommending) and my fiancé got a three meat plate with the baked potato and mashed potatoes. While we waited, we were brought out some warm cornbread and butter to enjoy, and a short while later, our food arrived.

After tasting a little bit of everything that we got, I wish I would have ordered one of the red meats instead of the chicken sandwich only because it was so plain compared to the other items. I'm not a huge fan of red meat which I was pleased to see chicken on the menu, but the red meat had the actual BBQ flavor I was hoping to find. All the side items were good; I personally liked the mashed potatoes the most but my fiancé liked the mac and cheese the most. The chicken sandwich plate and side was small enough for one to finish entirely but we had some leftovers from the three meat plate.

After we were done with our meals, we were brought a small bag with some cinnamon sugar covered donuts. I had seen a couple of people making them fresh at the front of the restaurant when we walked in, so this was definitely a nice & unique treat.

Overall, I would definitely be up for coming back here and giving some of the other menu items a try ... 4.5 stars, just not quite 5."
"I am NOT a BBQ lover, so when I give this place 4 stars, I mean it...it's pretty darn good. I've tried all the BBQ spots in the East Valley i.e. Joe's, Famous Daves and I am indifferent to them. A drug rep brought us catered lunch from Bobby Q's and I had never heard of it. They have received national awards for their food and apparently they won State Best Mac&Cheese. We had cornbread, mac& cheese, pulled pork sweet & spicy flavors, coleslaw, and salad. I tried really hard not to go back for seconds on the Mac & Cheese and Pulled Pork that was catered at our office, but I my will power cracked and I dove back into the M&C and pork. It is so good, the flavoring is on point, the coleslaw is crisp and not runny. I'm a fan for sure. If I'm in the area I will definitely try to check out the actual restaurant and take my family or friends there."
"This was my family's first time eating here, even though we have lived here for 14 years. The place was VERY busy!! We made a reservation for 6pm, but weren't seated until 6:15. The food is good. My husband had a pulled pork sandwich with potato salad. I took a bite of his potato salad, it was really good. My 12 year old didn't want to order off the kids menu, so he ordered the 1/2 rotisserie chicken with Mac and cheese and fries. He surprisingly ate everything but the fries ( dad ate those). The portions are good sized, but a bit pricey ($25 for Brisket plate, $21 for 1/2 chicken plate). I would eat here again. "My girlfriend from Oregon and I had a delicious meal at Bobby Qs restaurant tonight. Initially, we had a minor situation with the menus each having different prices. The manager was very gracious and offered us the lower-priced menu.  Very professional and very friendly. 
LeeAnne was our server and she was a 10.  ‼‼My girlfriend ordered a steak sandwich. The steak was grilled to perfection with a glazed caramelized sauce that brought out the steak's flavors. It was thick and juicy and so flavorful covered in grilled mushrooms served with onion rings so tasty I ordered one to go.
Their potato soup is almost a meal in itself. It is so flavorful with cheese and bacon and chopped onions and potatoes I could've eaten another bowl instead I got one to go.
Bobby Qs gives you a small bag of homemade donuts to thank you for enjoying their restaurant. Give it a try for sure. 
Second review:  treated friends today to Bobby Qs for burgers and steak sandwiches. Kyle served us and he was beyond on top of keeping us satisfied. Actually I was the one who got treated today.  Manager Taylor himself took care of a minor problem I had with my steak. He solved the issue as fast as humanly possible.  He gave me the BEST customer service ever in any restaurant I've eaten. Food so wonderful; service the same.

"After searching for a good BBQ place to try, based on high ratings and reviews,  my girlfriend found this restaurant and it looked like it was going to be great.  We did not get any alcohol drinks, but I tried their strawberry lemonade and it was great. For our meal, we had to go with the whole hog heaven. Being from out of town, this was a no brainer, as this combo had the best of everything. We were able to try baby back ribs, st louis ribs, brisket, and pulled pork. All of these meats were delicious. My favorite were the st louis ribs and the pulled pork, but everything was so good.  Not only that, but this combo meal came with 3 sides. We went with the pecan cole slaw, mac & cheese, and mashed potatoes.  Again, very delicious sides. This platter was so large in size, that we had plenty of left overs to take home (to finish up later that night plus the next day). The portion size was excellent compared to the price.  The waiter we had was great. Made our experience even better. It was a nice bonus we got some fresh made mini donuts to go in a bag on our way out. And I got a free refill lemonade drink to go as well. This was probably the best BBQ I have had at a restaurant.  I can see why it is rated so high. A+ recommendation from me. Everything from food to service was outstanding. Everyone must try this BBQ."

"Updating to add I've now brought more family to this restaurant. I've spent quite a while talking this place up, and thankfully it did not disappoint!
My aunt thoroughly enjoyed her baked potato with pork, my mother enjoyed her brisket sandwich, husband enjoyed his steak, uncle liked his pulled pork, and I was not disappointed by my beef brisket platter. Portions are great and the taste is amazing. 
We had q rolls and queso dip to start. I already knew I loved the q rolls, and while I liked the dip, it wasn't stellar (to me). My husband liked it though.

"This place brings back some memories. It used to be the old Bobby McGee's themed restaurant, and I used to go on dates with my daughters when they were just little girls. It was dress up time with Dad, and they really enjoyed meeting the various servers that acted out their various personas. 

The last time I was here was a few months after they remodeled this place, and turned it into Bobby Q's. The food wasn't that impressive then; therefore, I never made it a point to return.

Due to an accident on the I-17, we had to make a detour on Dunlap to escape the traffic. Instead of having to endure a prolonged wait for dinner, we opted to give this place a try. I forewarned my wife that I didn't think that this place was any good, but we would give it a try anyway.

And we were about to be quite pleasantly surprised.

Riley, our server, greeted us with such enthusiasm and made compelling statements  about how amazing this place was. #89 in the country as far as BBQ joints are concerned, and over 1100 reviews on Yelp. 

His statements were received with some trepidation by yours truly, and in my mind, I was saying to myself - we shall see!

My wife ordered the Wood Fired Top Sirloin Steak, and I ordered the 3 meat combo (Pork, Brisket, and Chicken). For our drinks, we ordered the sweet tea.

The tea was just wonderful. Not too sweet and not too tart, and had zero after taste. Just the way the both of us like it. 

We were provided with fresh homemade cornbread that was just pure evil! They were absolutely and ridiculously delectable. You could just taste the sweetness, along with all the calories and the carbs! A caution sign should accompany these babies.

In spite of the myriad of people eating here; especially the two large parties that apparently were part of some spring training tour group, the service was prompt and efficient. 

Nary an empty moment went by without Riley continually checking in on us and apprising us of our meal's status.

Not too terribly long afterwards, our meals were presented to us.

My wife really enjoyed her Sirloin Steak, and she was quite impressed with the roasted corn that came with it. And the generously lavish heap of shoe string fries made a great accompaniment to her already delicious meal.

My 3 meat BBQ combo was quite heavenly. The smoked meats were very tender, and the sampling of the various BBQ sauces provided just brought out their flavors even more.

In the middle of us enjoying our meal; Renee, the manager stopped by and checked in on us as well. She was engaging and quite friendly. She even helped clear our table as we progressed through our dining experience.

And when we were all done, Riley spent a few moments recapping our experience.

We had nothing but great things to say about the service and their food. Both were thoroughly enjoyable!"
"Awesome !!!!!! The best bbq with a very reasonable price and great service !!!
I will come back."
"@ Mark: I would Probably say your food shouldn't be offered for delivery if you cannot guarantee the quality. Also, I doubt there will be a ""till then"".  I will take my business to a different restaurant."
This is the best BBQ me or my family had. The meat is so tender it melts. Cameron our server is really good and knows his job. Desert and drinks are great! Sad is so far from home.
"Went to Bobby Q with a work colleague and fellow BBQ enthusiast. We ordered two 3-meat combo plates so that we could try almost everything. 

All 3 ribs tasted good (baby back, st-louis, beef). I would have hoped for more smoke and more of a rub (we ordered them dry with sauce on the side). Of the three, I think that the St-Louis were the best.

We also had brisket, pulled pork and chicken. All three of these need lots of smoke (in my view) to be a success and there just was not enough. The brisket was not sliced and had no barque. It was more of a ""pulled"" format in small pieces. It tasted a bit dry and lacked smoke.

Overall, it's OK but not great. I'm stuck between going with 2 or 3 stars on this because the sides weren't all that fantastic either (mac & cheese, fries, grilled veg, ranch beans). However, it is still decent BBQ if you stick to the right items (ribs)."
"Went to Bobby-Q for lunch and tried the sampler platter. For my platter I got the baby back ribs, ST. Louis ribs and the smoked BBQ pork with a side of mac and cheese.  My compadre got the same platter but substituted for the sliced beef brisket and pecan Cole slaw so we could both share. Before your food arrives you get two pieces of corn bread and butter and at the end of your meal you receive a sugar donut.

By noon the restaurant was standing room only and our server was very attentive and refilled my ice tea three times. The rib meat really does fall off the bone and you can smell the hickory wood and taste the dry rubbed spices with each bite of rib which was mouthwatering and delicious. We asked the waiter to bring extra BBQ sauce so he brought us the sweet and the spicy sauce to sample.

Baby Back Ribs (Sweet Sauce)
ST. Louis Ribs (Spicy Sauce)
Sliced Beef Brisket
BBQ Pork"

The ribs are not fatty, and have a substantial amount of meat in them. The side dishes are good but it's the meat that you can't forget! 

Oh...they have the coolest thing in a restaurant! A mini donut maker! At the end of your dinner they bring you hot...mini cinnamon and sugar donuts! As if you have room! I have no shame in my game...I tell them I'm from Cali and I need additional orders for the road. That always throw in extras for me. So nice! 

This is a hidden gem!!!! I have friend in AZ who refused to go to dinner with me for almost 6 years. They finally went 2 years ago for a gathering. I received a call that night! They were so apologetic for have blown me off for years about Bobby's!

I will definitely be back here to try something that's actually barbecue. The prices are a bit high, but once in a while, I think this place is worth it."

"***4.5 Stars***

It's true. This place is all that and a bag of chips! All that and a plate of fall off the bone baby back ribs! All that and a box of freshly baked donuts! All that and... okay you catch my drift. It's truly all THAT!

Read some of the glowing reviews about Bobby Q before my recent trip to Phoenix and I just HAD to come here during my visit. Let's just say that they definitely impressed in all departments. Starting off with the decor and ambience; absolutely stunning! This place is pretty large inside too. 

They have a gorgeous covered patio with really pretty lighting. There's even a TV on the patio for all of the sports heads. Speaking of that, their BAR is beautiful too. It's a wrap around style with plenty of TV's and lounge tables. The dining area is dark and spacious with a fabulous ambience and nice high ceilings. Just really well put together. 

Service is absolutely impeccable! Derrick was truly amazing! That man deserves a raise! Talk about being on it the ENTIRE time. I was never forgotten and always attended to but not in an overwhelming way. He was also kind enough to give me some great recommendations as far as hiking and sight seeing in the area. A true gem with heart and personality. 

The drinks are.... wowza! I had their Q-lada which was similar to a piña colada but with strawberry purée and damnit... It was phenomenal! It was almost too pretty to drink. It came garnished with fresh coconut and pineapple and came l served in a HUGE ass glass! Shoutout to the bartender who hooked this drink up because it was FABULOUS! Yes, I was feelin' it.

And last but not least.... that FOOD!!! Woooooo babyyyy! Those RIBS were the truth! The TRUTH. Period. I ordered their 1/2 rack of baby back ribs w/ mac and cheese and ranch beans. It was delicious!!! The ribs definitely stole the show. They were falling off the bone and were oh so tender. The bbq sauce was a hit! Those PORTIONS are no joke either! Literally had to take a picture of my leftover boxes because it looked like I hadn't even eaten anything but I DID! I got so full. Mmm.

The mac and cheese was so creamy and cheesy but just a little too rich for my taste. They got the flavor down wonderfully though. The ranch beans were pretty good too but could have definitely used more seasoning on them. This meal also comes with cornbread AND they give you freshly baked homemade donuts at the end of your meal too. Lawdy lawd laaawd! I was NOT ready. 

Ermahgaaawd that cornbread! Yaaaass! It was a hit! And those donuts? And even BIGGER hit! That cornbread was so moist and the butter melted as soon as I spread it on the top. It was melting in my mouth! So good! Derrick even gave me some more to-go! Ha! Like I REALLY needed it, but it was so damn delicious.

I can't even talk about the donuts now because now I'm craving. They were perfect. That cinnamon sugar coating, that fluffy center... mm mm mmm. What a nice surprise! Even though I was stuffed to the MAX, I still was able to enjoy one before having to call it quits and taking them to go. What a night, what an experience, what a MEAL. It was fabulous. The owner/manager even stopped by to check-in and introduce himself while I was there. 

This place really prides themselves on excellent service and I truly appreciate it. Oh yeah, I can't forget to mention the 10% off Yelp-in offer! It's really such a great deal to take advantage. This was the best meal that I had in Phoenix. Hell, it was the best meal that I had in Arizona period. Cannot wait to reunite with Bobby Q's one day! Maybe they'll bring a location to Cali one day (wink wink)? Who knows! I guess we'll just have to wait and see!"
"(Before I say anything, order the Q Rolls. I don't see a single possible way anyone could be disappointed by them. Unless you don't eat meat, and then I feel sorry for what you're missing out on.)

Finally went off the beaten path (literally) and tried Bobbie Q's after years and years of driving right by it along the I-17. If you're anything like me, you thought it may have looked a little questionable from the freeway. Old perhaps, run down, neglected? Let me assure you, none of these are the case at all. Once you navigate the side streets to find this hidden gem, you are sure to be pleasantly surprised just as we were. 

Prepare to be greeted at the hostess station inside a beautifully kept up and clean dining room. You may notice the donut machine just behind the hostesses making fresh little donuts which will be warm and waiting for you on the way out. Once seated, I highly recommend you order the Q Rolls, as stated at the beginning of the review. The beef brisket wrapped up inside them is out of this world good. Great dipping sauces too. 

For the entrees, we had a loaded baked potato with shredded chicken, a pulled pork plate, a brisket sandwich and a pulled pork sandwich. Aside from one small complaint of a little bit of extra fat in the pork plate serving, everything else was excellent. Didn't notice the fattiness in the pulled pork sandwich I had half of, so I'm guessing it was just a fluke. The half a brisket sandwich was outstanding and the potato with chicken was also very good. Tons of side dish choices too; sure to be something for everyone.

As for the service here, the servers and managers don't appear willing to let anyone get out of there unhappy. They pride themselves on having happy (and most likely return) customers. Just look at their current Yelp rating; that's not easy to do! We had two different managers come over and check on us at two different points during our meal. Our server took great care of us, even hooked my mom up with extra cornbread. Totally made her night. And to all of the guys out there: ice cubes in the urinals when it's time to relieve yourselves. How many places can claim that? ;-)"

"Bobby Q BBQ. Clever. The restaurant had me at the name but it didn't hurt that they made Yelps 100 places to eat list. What does one do when they find themselves in Phoenix for the first time ever? Head over to Bobbie Q, of course. I came here for one reason and one reason only. Baby back ribs. I do love my baby backs. There is a pretty large parking lot to fit all the hungry BBQ lovers in one place. As I walked in and smelled the smoky goodness, the hostess in the front handed my party of three a bag of freshly made cinnamon sugar donuts while we waited a few short minutes for a table. Like a child who's been offered desert before dinner, I gleefully followed the hostess to our table whilst munching on my sugary donuts. Our waiter took our drink orders and I decided on the baby backs with a side of potato salad and mac and cheese. 

After what seemed like a forever of eyeing and sniffing my neighbors meals, our plates came out. The full rack of baby backs were huge. The photo does not do it justice. Talk about a bang for your buck! They smelled amazing as the smokey aroma filled my lungs. I went in with my knife and realized how easy the cut was. There is hours of love put into these ribs because the first bite just melted in my mouth. The best thing about these ribs...they are not overly sauced. You can ask for extra BBQ and add as needed, but the meat is not masked with sauce. I got through about half of the tender rack of ribs before I realized that I still had two bowls piled high with mac and cheese and potato salad. I used the complimentary corn bread with butter to create potato salad and mac and cheese sammies and inhaled my sides. The mac and cheese was so creamy with a distinct sharp cheddar flavor. I wish that the cheese was a little more gooey than creamy, but the flavors where there. The potato salad had good flavor and great textures. It paired really well with the sweet cornbread. Heads up, this place won't do you well if you are on the diet. This is one cheat meal you will not regret. 

The service was pretty impressive. Our waiter gave suggestions and replaced our drinks with new ones before we finished the original. Our food was served hot and when we were tipping over from being too full, he brought out to go boxes to pile our leftovers in. One of the managers was walking around in the restaurant and checking on tables throughout our meal. We gave kudos to the chef when he asked us about our experience. I didn't imagine Phoenix to be known for BBQ, but I was not disappointed with what I got. The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating (with a sprinkling cooling system) with big enough tables to feel at ease. As I walked out, another bag of cinnamon donuts were handed to me and I vouched to be back. 5/5 overall experience!"

"I love BBQ and I've wanted to try Bobby Q for a while so when the boyfriend had a friend coming to visit who was staying near here I suggested we try it out.

It's always a little scary to take someone to a place you've never been to but Bobby Q did not disappoint.

We started with their Q rolls for an appetizer. SO good. They are kinda like egg rolls but with brisket and they come with a chipotle dipping sauce that is really good. 

I ordered the brisket sandwich (apparently I was in a brisket kinda mood) which comes with shoestring fries and I ordered a side of mac n cheese as well. I'm not kidding when I say this is some of the best beef brisket I've ever had. It was so tender, not dry at all and it had just the right amount of sauce - enough to give you that rich BBQ flavor but not so much that the meat is swimming in it.
The fries were good but the mac n cheese was really good. VERY rich and creamy. I couldn't finish it all. 
The boyfriend had chicken and mashed potatoes. He said the chicken was good but the potatoes came without gravy. Maybe they forgot it? So those were kinda dull. 
Our friend got ribs and mac n cheese. The ribs looked amazing - fall off the bone type.

We stayed at the table really late - we were literally the last people in the place but they didn't seem to care that we were just hanging out which was cool. 

We didn't go to the bar next door but it was packed and looked like a fun place to grab a drink.

Bobby Q turned out to be a great place to bring a visitor since they let us talk forever and the food was tasty and reasonably priced. I would definitely eat there again."

"I'll be honest, this place has excellent BBQ. Although, couldn't say the same about their customer service. My daughter is graduating from college (first our family so BIG accomplishment) and she wanted to go to this restaurant afterwards for lunch. I called a week in advance to place a reservation on Thursday, April 25th at approximately 1 pm. (Mistakenly, I did not write down the name of the woman I spoken.) After I gave her the details pertaining the reservation, she asked me for a credit card. Quite shocked, I asked if there would be a cancellation fee or anything like that. She told me no and I was boggled. I kept asking why my credit card information was needed and she danced around the subject for a while. Finally, she told me there was a ""no call no show"" fee (basically a cancellation fee). 

After a lot of prodding, she finally explained that my credit card would be charged $10 each person if my party failed to show up. A PARTY OF 14 PEOPLE. Once again, boggled. 

In conclusion, I will not be taking my business back to this establishment as they have tried to scam me and my family. The women on the phone was VERY reluctant to tell me the full picture and I had to pry for an answer. 

Just wanted to share my experience so no one else gets scammed by Bobby Q's and this ridiculous policy."

"This place has the best bbq I have had in Phoenix!! And I consider myself a bbq enthusiast. I also say their potato salad is so smooth, creamy and light, very tasty. Service was great, and my wife enjoyed her food also. We also loved the complimentary little mini cinnamon sugar donuts freshly made that they send you off with! This place is awesome and I will be back to eat more!"
"If you're ever cravin' some good ribs, steak, burgers... come down to Bobby Q's! My partner and I went here for date night and we were not disappointed. I ordered the ribs and they were dripping with flavor! My significant other had the burger with bacon (of course I had more than a few bites of his) and we both agreed it was the juiciest burger on the block. The macaroni and baked potato were SO delightful. It was a pretty busy evening for Bobby Q's but they managed very well by tending to their customers in a timely manner. 

Their club opens at 11, we had seen people lining up to go in as we left, so you know it must be poppin'. We haven't came here for the club portion, but let my food go down and sooner than you know it I'll be out on the dance floor. Overall, we had a wonderful night; great atmosphere, awesome service & superb food. We even got little doughnuts as a dessert when we left. We will definitely be coming back! And I can't even wait until we come back because it was that good."

"A couple of facts about me:
 
I'm a native of AZ. I've only been to the Grand Canyon a few times. This was my first visit to Bobby Q.

I can't believe it took me so long. I have sampled their BBQ at events, but this is my first visit to their establishment. So being a native, I grew up going to Bobby McGee's (one of owner Bob Sikora's original endeavors here in the Valley). In 2005, he turned his attention to BBQ and opened up Bobby Q. You can smell the meat smoking as you get out of your car in the parking lot. The menu has a variety of meats to choose from like tender brisket, pulled pork, chicken, prime rib, steaks, fish and burgers. The brisket and pork is slow cooked for hours at a low temperature. They smoke their meat with Almond and Mesquite wood and use a nice blend of spices for the dry rub. For BBQ sauce, Bobby Q has both a sweet and spicy Carolina sauce available. They have a variety of sides to choose from for your entree but I highly recommend their cheesy mac & cheese. It's so gooey and delicious! My sliced-brisket sandwich was amazing and I savored each bite. If you aren't a meat lover (why would you come here if not?), the Biltmore location has a some vegan dishes and other healthy options on the menu. Bobby Q is known for their famous corn bread that is complimentary if you order something. They are really good (especially with butter on it) and are made fresh daily. Each table also gets a complimentary bag of fresh-made mini doughnuts dipped in cinnamon sugar for the ride home (mine didn't make it to the car). Overall, prices are very reasonable and portions are large. This was a fun experience and I look forward to future visits. The restaurant can be a little loud at times but it does have a fun community feel to it. In addition to the Biltmore location, Bobby Q also has a location in Mesa."
"So on yelp it says the Bobby Q is open till 10 PM we took a Lyft from our hotel to this place, got here at 9PM only to be told that they're not open and that they closed at 9pm and that it depends on location. when I stated to her that it was this location that it said they were open till 10 she didn't have a response and so if you're trying to come here......DON'T"

Manager came to greet & welcome us & gave us a complimentary dessert - apple Cobbler.  Corn bread & donuts are really good also.  Wonderful dining experience.

"We met with Jason French at the beginning of this year for catering service for our daughters October wedding.  We got to sample everything that day and choose a menu and a provided a tentative head count.

For the months leading up to the wedding, he was always available and willing to accommodate our requests and changes even up to the week of the wedding.  Out of all of our vendors, he was always the one that I could count on for a prompt reply and as busy as he was, he never rushed our conversations.  He always made me feel like our phone call was a priority for him.

The service staff that showed up to the wedding was there on time (actually about 10 mins earlier than we expected) and was ready to work. when they were done setting up the station they pitched in and helped us set up our other banquet tables.  They were so helpful during the entire event - moving tables around, beverage service, restocking the drink troughs, cleaning up, and even helping us with the breakdown.  They always ask what more they could help with.  Even at the end, they would not leave until they were sure that we didn't need help with anything else!

The food was AMAZING! The brisket was tender, the pulled chicken was juicy and tender as well. The food was also served piping hot! Our guests raved about the food and couldn't say enough good things about it.  

Thank you so much for helping make the wedding perfect!"

"While we were in town, I had a hankering for some ribs and thought I'd try this place based on the many positive reviews it garnered.

Location & Aesthetics - Located just off the I-17 somewhere I believe in the Glendale area of Phoenix.  Lots of available parking in an enclosed private lot. 
The place has a rustic look and feel to it.  Very spacious inside, clean including the bathrooms, and well lit.   

Menu - menus were quite extensive though my wife and I already knew what we wanted as we had a chance to review their menu online before meeting our friends there.  Menu was self-explanatory and easy to find what one needed, not too overwhelming.

Service - The staff was very friendly.  We were greeted immediately upon entering and was shown a large table to accommodate my wife and I including our friends who had two boys with them.  
I did have a gripe with the table we were seated at as it was a bit wobbly and thankfully my wife noticed too.  It wasn't too bad to shift our meals around so no loss on the ratings.  
Before the meals are brought, they do serve some cornbread with butter in the meantime and though I didn't try it, my wife said it was tasty, delicious, and not too dry or too greasy.

Food - I ordered the full rack of baby back ribs with vegetables and roasted corn.  Initially when I first saw the full rack of ribs I thought I wouldn't be able to eat it but I surprised myself.  My ribs was well cooked and was practically falling off the bone.  It was soft, tender, and juicy and you could even taste the smokiness to the meat.  The roasted corn was well seasoned, more than enough and came in a bowl.  The roasted vegetables that I ordered was lacking and only consisted of a few vegetable that looked like it was about a tablespoonful.  (-1)
My wife ordered the three-meat dish and it was so much that we had to take a bag back to the hotel.  She did comment on how well and delicious it was. 

Rating - 3/5.  The restaurant loses another star/rating based on a small issue.  
After the bills were brought to the table and the waitress ran my credit card, I asked if I can use my Yelp coupon and she stated that I couldn't do so as ""the card had already been run"" which I don't believe.  I couldn't see why she couldn't cancel it and re-run the card with the coupon. (-1)
Despite the 3/5, it's definitely a place I'd like to come back to try some of their pulled pork sandwiches which is what my friends had and looked absolutely delicious!"
"I grew up in Minnesota, and prior to me moving to a more southern state, the only barbecue I had was famous Dave's (which I am not a fan of). This place is on par with Famous Dave's. So on track to sub par.

I ordered delivery through Grubhub. I asked for the BBQ sauce on the side, yet it was coated with sauce. I also asked for a spicy sauce, and received a sweet sauce. I haven't physically been to this place so not sure what the BBQ sauce options are, but they could have at least put the sickly sweet diabetic making sauce on the side like I asked. At least Famous Dave's has a spicy sauce option.

The meat would have been good if it wasn't slathered in a sauce I didn't like. And I am a regular grubhubber, so I know the restaurant can view the ordering comments. 

Also, the man n cheese was really dry. 

And maybe my review is a little harsh, since I am used to the delicious BBQ of KC. 

Not sure if I would be willing to give this place another try."

"Whew chillay. AMAZING!!!! is all I can say. From start to finish (still here BTW, couldn't wait) as soon as we walked in...we were greeted with a smile and seated immediately. "Having lived in town for over 10 years, I'm almost embarrassed to say that I've never been to Bobby Q before, it's somewhat of a Phoenix icon. They've been around for forever it seems, everybody's been there and when you ask about good BBQ spots, they're always in the top 5 on just about everyone's list and top 1 for many. This, my friends changed a few weeks ago, and certainly glad it did.

I invited my nephew out, a picky eater who's list of acceptable meals can be counted on about 11 fingers, but luckily, BBQ is one of them and I decided on Bobby Q. They've got a full bar, everything you're expect on a proper BBQ menu, pulled pork, ribs, brisket, potatoes, mac and cheese, corn bread and a few veggie sides. I really was craving both pulled pork and brisket this visit, but didn't want to spend $30 for my meal, they were happy to accommodate my off the menu request of a sandwich with both brisket and pulled pork, what an awesome way to treat an unusual request. I've been to places that don't like to accommodate and it's super cool that they're not one of them.

They brought the check out and along with it, a bag of fresh mini donuts, two per person. I was drooling over theses bit sized delights as I walked is and saw them cooking them up fresh, but I rarely order dessert out at restaurants, what a cool way to say thanks for coming in. Overall I'd put Bobby Q up at my second or third spot on my personal list, but number one is the type of spot that cooks up their food for the day, opens at 10 am, closes when they sell out for for the day at 1 pm and always has a 30 minute long line of people; not convenient for a dinner on a Tuesday evening.

Thanks for the delicious meal Bobby, not sure what took me so long to come in, but I'm sure I'll be back at some point down the line."

"After reading several reviews about how good the brisket was I decided I had to try it. I went over on a Friday afternoon and sat at the bar. They had the lunch menu and their dinner menu and I noticed the lunch brisket was only around three dollars less expensive then the brisket platter. The bartender said that the dinner platter was a better value so that's what I went with. I opted for the fries and the coleslaw as the two sides. I have to say the brisket was amazing. Not only was it very tender but it was not at all dried out like so many other places that I have tried. Even people from Texas would be impressed.  My only minor complaint was the fries could have been crispier. I also have to say that I really like their ice tea as well. 

There are so many interesting options on the menu I deafly will be coming back to this place to try them out.
